text: Bottle. Amber color, good foam. Good vanilla aroma: sweet, oak, malt, wine, sherry, wood, bourbon. Taste: barrel, vanilla, toffee, bourbon, creamy, soft, a little bit of hops, bitterness.

30cl van de tap bij Zeezicht, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 9,8%
Uitgetapt in Zeezicht glas

Uiterlijk: hazelnootkleurig met redelijke schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: neus is zoet rijp fruit, smaak is caramel, bittertje, nootachtig, zoet van kandijsuiker, stroperig, rozijnen

Conclusie: heerlijke dubbel

355ml bottle [A big thanks to Maddie!]. Slightly cloudy, dark copper colour with average, sudsy, fairly lasting and lacing, sulphureous head. Oaky and malty aroma, notes of toffee, a touch of vanilla, old walnut. Taste is dry oaky, sweet-ish malty, slightly alcoholic, notes of toffee, walnut; warming alcoholic finish. Oily texture, soft palate. Not my cup of tee.

Temmelig sød øl med pæn gylden farve. Fyldig smag men mangler noget modspil til sødmen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sweet warm fermentation flavors. Has medium body for abv. Lots of head. Overall not the best old ale. but not out.

Draught at Moscow BCD17. Deep bronze colour, small head. Aroma: oak wood, malts, dried fruit. Full body. Tart oak dominates the taste. Malty, fruity as well. Light to medium bitterness. Well-balanced. Another beautiful beer from Founders.

Ruby copper with dense persistent beige head. Creamy full body with moderately high carbonation.

Aroma: rich sweet malt, vanilla toffee barrel character, dark fruit, faint silage.

Taste: charred wood, whiskey notes, vanilla oak, warm slightly fruity alcohol, toated grain, subtle spice notes like cinnamon and nutmeg.
Kopparfärgad öl med ljusbeige skum. Doften är söt med malt, karamell och kola samt även en del jäst. I smaken märks inte jästen och lakritstoner tillkommer.

Enjoyed in Vermont. Pours a clean, dark amber colour with a frothy light-beige head, good retention and creamy lacing. Slightly sweet malty aromas with some dark fruits, caramel and light oak. The wood shows up more in the taste creating a nice balance with the caramel and the hints of vanilla. Alcohol nicely hidden. Not as rich as expected, but lots going on, well-blended.

[8956-20161227] 355mL bottle. Mushy banana and raisin grains aroma. Slightly hazy, dark brown body with a quick foamy off-white head. Boozy booooozy bourbon banana mush bread malt flavour. Full body. Wow. (7/3/8/4/15) 3.7
(Vintage 2006; c/o biegaman, w/ him, HogTownHarry, jercraigs, others)

12 ounce bottle. Copper red color has a small dense creamy beige head. Nice clinging lace. Faint boozy toasted malt aroma has a hint of oakiness. First sip yields notes of bittersweet malt that conjures flavors of dried fruit, dark sugar, roasted walnuts and oak. Rich and flavorful, with a warming alcohol nuance in midtaste. Chewy, bitter notes help to finish this ale with wonderful balance. The oak is always present, yet is is nicely understated.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

From a bottle. Four words: beer candy malt bomb. Pours a rusty brown and makes a medium tan head. Aroma is of molasses, brown sugar, and yeasty, malty amazingness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg @ Tapped Leeds, Leeds. Copper-red with a thin head. Its very strong with a spirit-like hue and taste. Sticky-sweet in its texture and very sweet tasting.
35.5cl bottle. clear amber color. medium light beige head. malt, caramel, toffee, oak, vanilla, liquorice, low to medium bitterness. great beer.
Great malty aroma. Terrific flavor and nice strong alcohol content! Its a good beer!

Bottled 01.27.17. A: Typical barleywine apple cider quality. Syrup is there too. A: See through dark red body. T: Follows the nose. Molasses and slight oaky woodiness mix on the back end. P: Mostly smooth with a bit of oiliness. O: The acidic edge that you often find in barleywines/old ales seems softened by the sweetness of molasses. Its balanced too, which seems to be a Founders standard.

Normally I would expect a beer like this to be super saccharine syrupy and a punch in the face of alcohol. Surprisingly, this beer is somewhat light and almost like a barleywine. The aroma is pretty sweet, and the color is a nice dark red. The taste is oaky, coconut-y, but not without its hops and malty flavor. Overall a nice one! Good for getting home late and making garlic fries before watching Grace and Frankie (rightttt?) with your love.

Bottle, 355 ml, courtesy of JFK10000. Shared with him and Max. Pours copper to amber with beige head. Average to heavy malty, toffee, caramel, molasses, brown sugar, nutty. Moderate to heavy sweet with some light bitterness in finish. Medium to full bodied.

12 oz bottle- Pours hazy dark orange with a medium light tan head that retains. Aroma is vanilla, toffee, touch of oak. The taste is similar, oak, toffee, vanilla, raisins, dry bittering from a fair amount of hops. Solid beer, doesnt taste like almost 10% alcohol.

Bottle from January, 2016. Pours a clear copper with a finger of foam that lingers. Malty, bread-like nose with some faint pine. Some citrus and pine on the palate with a splash of molasses. Deep toffee, maple w/ a nice piney bitter finish. Really nice.

12 oz bottle, thanks brenn79. Aroma consists of vanilla, cinnamon, wet dog, vague fruitiness (apples?). Pours slightly hazy burnt orange with a one finger beige head that falls into a collar of big-bubbly foam fairly quick. Taste is lightly sweet and spicy with a bitter finish; flavors of the aroma with a touch of menthol/cough drop, a hint of wood. Has a somewhat lackluster aroma, but it has a really nice and unique flavor.

Amber/brown with a thick haze, smallish head with good retention and spotty lace. Aromas of molasses, brown sugar, caramel, maple, oak, vanilla and alcohol. Caramel, molasses and brown sugar sweetness dominate the flavor profile that includes a hint of earth and generous warming alcohol. Full body, minimal carbonation, viscous mouthfeel and a thick caramel/syrupy finish.
light malt aroma. red and clear in color with nice log lasting head. taste is initially richly of malt followed by oak flavor
Medium/full body. Taste is sweet with a ton of malt character up front. Alcohol is hidden well making this very drinkable for the abv. This brew just doesnt do it for me. Too malty.

Pour pitch dark copper with almost no head.Aroma; Molasses, dark dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar, raisins and minerals. Taste; Brown sugar. Caramel, dark dried fruits, brown sugar, raisin and malt.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. This is a clear deep dark almost glowing orange one with a small islandy and sidesticking beige top. On the nose I get some wood, oak, a little bit of alcohol, a nice pleasant sweetness and something light spicy. The spice quite evolves and opens up after a while in the glass! Not extreme, but still really nice smelling. Lots of flavor! Well bitter with both nuts, licorice and grass. The alcohol is a bit to obvious in this, perhaps. Doesnt feel correctly balanced in a way. It gets more vivid after a while in the glass, leaving my mouth light wood dry with a warming aftertaste. Can safely say that this is grew on me, and I wouldnt mind a second go where I have some more time. 04.05.2013
Poured from tap at Tuckaway nice copper color with a thin tan head. Aromas of caramel fruit hop dark fruit and brown sugar. Taste is sweet caramel fruit alcohol.

A reddish copper ale with very thin off white head. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with nice vinous character, light surranated hops, dark fruits and toffee. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity caramel malt with light grassy hops, resinous and piney notes, faint butterscotch, loads of alcohol warmth, light coconut and chocolate, interesting. Bottled 04/09/11, so 5 years old.

12.02.2017, 12 oz bottle @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, raisins, dark sugar, grass, minerals, alcohol, oak, fruit stones, dried fruits, caramel malts, bark. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, weeds, fruit stones, alcohol, grass, raisins, "knekk", oak, bark, minerals, burnt caramel, dried fruits, toast. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.

2017- Brown, dank, muddy with thin head and modest lacing. In other words, perfect for what you think an old fart would be drinking. Very malt forward nose with caramel, hint of clove and maybe most subtle ginger. Sweet up front moderately so, but turns moderately bitter, which also fades into a smooth finish. Medium to full body with soft carbonation. Long smooth bitter finish.
Bottle. Malty sweet with lots of toasted notes, brown sugar, dried fruits. Medium to full body, slick and smooth texture. Light warming alcohol in finish. Tasty one.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Fajnie ukryty alkohol, sporo beczkowych tanin, brązowy cukier, owoce. Fajne.

Bottle - aroma is quite sweet. It pours a lovely amber colour with a small white head. Taste is sweet and bitter. Strangely the combination is well balanced, and very drinkable. High alcohol is quite well hidden, just a slight warmth in the belly, and the finish is medium bitter. For me to say its drinkable with my aversion to bitter beers, it says a lot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Damián. Not an everyday beer for sure. Dark amber color with head copying color of body. Sweet, is it bourbon? aroma, persisting through whole experience. Taste is again sweet, malty and again very sweet, is this the bourbon? Im certainly not fan of bourbons but I would give this happily another try. Nice.

Bottle. Sensoric. Brown, medium hazy with small, dirty white head. Poor head retantion and lacing. Aroma is heavily malty - mainly caramel, roasted, lightly hoppy with moderate spicy character, riped, tangy dark fruits, barrel notes are moderately noticeable. In second or third raw some kind of peaty character. Taste is nearly heavy sweet and moderately bitter - stable, long. Medium body, slick texture, average carbonation, finish is malty, spicy, densed. Summary: Nice brew. Rich in malts, spicy character empowered by some moderate hoppiness. Podsumowanie: Słodkie, przyprawowe, owocowe, sporo karmelu, melasy, pikantnych, suszonych owoców. Bez nadmiernej ulepkowatości. Beczka fajnie wyczuwalna, bez szału, ale nieźle komponuje się z całością. W tle trochę jakby klimaty lekko wędzone, co przypomina trochę scotch ale.

Bottle from Total Wine & More, St Petersburg. Toffee brown with a hint of amber, slightly cloudy. A little bit of filmy white head on top. Salted caramel, candied orange peel, hazelnuts, thick honey, and some muted resin in the nose. Sweet, sweet, sweet. Should be cloying but it isnt. Long finish with hop bitterness bringing up the rear. Warm buttered toast with cinnamon sugar, brandy, stone fruit and a hint of smoke in the aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel. Really good stuff.
Red brown with a ring of foam. Molasses, Caramel, wood, dark fruit. Burnt caramel, sweet, alcohol warmest. Full body, slick with an average carbonation. Long heavy aftertaste.
Trübes rötliches Bernstein mit reichlich, sich schnell verabschiedenden Schaum. Malzig, süß, etwas Karamell, leicht würzig, etwas Honig, wärmend alkoholisch.
SB beställning, flaska. Bärnstensfärgad med matt skum. Doft av honung och svag humle. Lättflyktig och slinker ner. Fin ale. Bra drinkabillity. Bra till riktigt gammal Stilton.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Very pleasant beer, finishes different than any other. Its dry and has wine like characteristics while meeting beer flavor profiles. Id drink again. It smells really winey as well, but that malt comes in to remind you that it is a beer. I liked.

12oz best before 15/11/16, slight hazy dark caramel hue, with beige head, with a fruity grainy toasted, biscuity, caramel malty nose with some faint grape granola bar, faint barley sugar accents, and a faint fruitcake, cerealic bran muffin, raisin pie crust, faint toffeeish note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth fruity grainy earthy toasted, caramelized, biscuity, wheat malty character, with some faint fruity earthy flowery leafy, grassy hoppy, toffee, tea leaf, subtle tobacco leaf, faint molasses, subtle oak barrel flavours leading towards a warming sweet earthy fruity grainy roasted, toasted, caramel, pale maltiness, lingering fruity earthy leafy, grassy, minty hop bittering finish.
Dark orange with a white head. Aroma molasses and oak. Taste is molasses, toffee, and oak undertone.

the aroma is malty and fruity with hints of vanilla, toffee, cream and sweet wine... the taste is fruity and malty with notes of sweet wine, coconut, vanilla, toffee and brown sugar... sweet and dry aftertaste...
Yrttinen mausteinen tuoksu, makea sahtimainen runko, hunajainen jälkimaku. Sivistyssana.

35.5cl bottle. Pours amber/brown with very small head. Aroma is caramel, licorice and fruits. The flavour is very similar, I would say dark ripe fruits along with caramel and licorice. Sweet on the palate, not cloying. Medium body, soft carbonation. Decent, nothing remarkable though.

Bottle from ales by mail I think. Light hazy red, copper, brown color. Thin beige head. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, balanced. Medium body. Dry finish. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, spices, herby, malt, tobacco. Pretty good!
В аромате сладост& и карамел& вкус мощный и алкогол& пиво красиво& цвета. Срок годност& до 21.01.18. (Bottle 0,355/ 9,8%)
Bottle @ home. Aroma of vinous, malty, dried fruits, caramel. Clear reddish brown with lasting off-white head. Taste is heavy sweet and light+ bitter. Full body, oily feel and sweet malty finish.

Twelve ounce bottle from Bottles N Bins in Monterey, Ca for 3.29. Light amber pour with a lot of carbonation bubbles visible. Aroma is molasses. Flavor is sweet and includes molasses and malt. I did not get any oak character. Pretty easy to drink considering the 9.8 abv.

Bottle. Aroma rich caramel, vanilla oak and spiced dark fruits. A potent beginning for a dark amber ale with thin broken lace top. The taste is perilously close to barley wine in my view. Densely dark sugared and fruit packed. A fruitcake in a glass but wonderfully smooth. I suspect its an ale that is drunk solo and not simply because of its 9.8% kick. Theres a lot left on the palate un terms of malty complexity. It is getting a high rating from me but also a health warning. Probably the best thing to come out of Grand Rapids since MSUs first class.

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, brown sugar, wood, vanilla, dried fruit, bread and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, brown sugar, wood, vanilla and dried fruit; ends slightly dry with bread and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. The aroma could have been intenser and the appearance and palate are good. Had a really old bottle (around 4.5 years), so that might be the reason for this all. Really reminds me of kerststol.

From bottle. Pours a clear orange with a small off white head. Aroma has oak, caramel, toasted malts, vanilla, earthy old hops. Taste is sweet, oaky vanilla spice, bitter hoppy finish. Low carbonation full body.

Bottle - Pours a deep amber to ruby brown, soapy off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, fermented breads, raisins, plums. Tastes of ripe plums, raisins, rum raisin bread, other fruits (medley), spices, rich malt though, and a hops presence. Raisin bread aftertaste. Alcohol detected.

Birra alla spina. I Fondatori della micro birreria (USA) ha chiamato questa birra Old Ale con il 9,8% di alcool e ABV e lamarezza di 50 IBU, lo stile è un invecchiamento allinglese in barrique il colore di questo stile è di colore ambra a ramato intenso, il intensità del colore è legato alla ossidazione di malto dallinvecchiamento. La prima impressione è una schiuma beige persistente perle di ritenzione biancastre, cappello di schiuma compatto e basso, liquido ambrato chiaro con lampi di arancio e torbidità significativo, bassa carbonatazione e il corpo coerente. In aroma è complesso, non i grani di malto tostato, melassa aroma biscotti, si sente albicocche e fichi secchi uvetta e prugne, cè una nota discreta di prodotto agrumi possono essere utilizzati luppolo, sapore di caramello. Al gusto è dolce, con malto consolidata dando crosta di carattere di pane o biscotti inglesi, melassa, leggermente acido, nocciola, caramello, uvetta, prugne albicocche e fichi secchi, retrogusto lungo discreto, di agrumi alla fine e caramelle, è una birra equilibrata, anche se forte non riesce a saturare il palato, ottima birra di natale, da abbinare al panforte al panpepato o ai cantuccini e pasticcini secchi in generale.

De la micro cervecera Founders(USA) esta Old Ale de nombre Curmudgeon con 9.8% ABV y 50 IBUs de amargor, el estilo es una Ale inglesa envejecida por algún tiempo considerable, puede o no estar fuertemente lupulada dependiendo la edad ya que el amargor y el carácter del lúpulo es afectado por el tiempo disminuyéndolo, generalmente el contenido de alcohol es de 5.5 a 9%, no son tan complejas en sabor como lo es una Barleywine, el color de este estilo es de ámbar a intenso cobrizo, la intensidad del color esta relacionada a el nivel de oxidación de la malta por el envejecimiento, no es un estilo tan común y reproducido en cervecerías estadounidenses, tampoco es un estilo que yo conozca bastante, la pagina Ratebeer la califica con 96 en estilo y 98 en el general.

En primera impresión es una cerveza de corona de espuma mediana, de tono blanquecino, perlas compactas y baja retención, liquido ambarino claro con destellos naranja y considerable turbiedad, poca carbonatación y cuerpo consistente. 
En aroma es compleja, hay aroma a granos de malta, melaza, galletas, algo de frutosisdad como; uvas y ciruelas, hay una nota discreta de cítricos posiblemente sea producto de los lúpulos empleados, sabor a caramelo.
El sabor es dulce, con la malta bien cimentada otorgando carácter a corteza de pan o galletas inglesas, melaza, ligeramente acida, sabor a nuez, tofee, uvas pasas, ciruelas, caramelo discreto, cítrica al final, es una cerveza equilibrada, que aunque es fuerte no llega a saturar el paladar y se pueden disfrutar todas las variantes que ofrece,Founders a sido de las mejores cervezas que e probado.

Bottle 355ml. Served at room temperature. Pours amber with a slight haze. Head is medium sized, dense, beige and lasts wonderfully. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of earthy/resinous hops; fruit cake spices. raisins, overripe peaches, dried apricots, golden syrup, vanilla, smokey oak and pouch tobacco. Flavour is a firm earthy hop bitterness with notes of roasted rye bread; bourbon, sultanas, overripe nectarines, toffee, biscuits, tree sap, aniseed, and notes of smokey vanilla oak in the finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation and a long, warming finish.
Bottle poured into a pint glass. Copper color with light tan head. Aroma is malts with stone fruit.

355ml bottle. Clear amber with one finger beige head. Aroma of wood, molasses, mixed bread spices, vanilla, brown bread, toffee and light roasted malts. Taste is wood, molasses, toffee, mixed bread spices, light vanilla, roasted malts and warming alcohol. Medium to filling mouthfeel, initially strong but after a while medium carbonation and warming aftertaste of toffee, molasses and wood.

A Big Beer. Soviel steht fest! Der eine würde Whiskeybier sagen und der andere weiss es besser. Komplexe Braukunst wird hier kredenzt, sicherlich tief verwurzelt im Bourbonfass, aber auch mit vielen Schlenkern versehen. Hier ein bisschen Honigsüße, da ein wenig Vanille und obendrauf ordentlich Bitterness. Klasse wie das alles durch ein extrem malzbetontes, volles und samtiges Mundgefühl abgerundet wird. Nach dem ersten Schock erweist es sich auch noch als gefährlich gut schlürfbar....Bottle 355ml/6 aus den CRAFT BEER STORE HH.

Bärnstensfärgad med ett litet skum. Söt doft smaken är också rätt söt men alkoholen tar snabbt över. Lite bitig, nja sådär

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Muddy brown, tan head. Aroma has a bit of alcohol, raisin, caramel, bread. Taste is medium sweetness, lightly bitter, alcohol. Finish is mostly alcohol warmth.medium body, sticky, average carbonation. Maybe just not my style. Alcohol feel ruins the otherwise pleasant notes.

Bottle - Clear ruby-brown colour, medium stable beige head. Sweet aromas of caramel, dried fruits, brown sugar and raisins. Taste is heavily sweet with a lot of dried fruits, some dates, raisins and caramel, a touch of honey and some spices. Full body, soft carbonation, sticky mouthfeel, sweet finish, alcohol is well hidden. Great strong ale with rich maltiness.
Easily one of my go-to beers of all time. Like having a home-cooked meal and dessert all in one
Bottle to snifter. Sweet bourbon oak aroma. Clear ruby amber, small head. Sweet roasty very oaky flavor. Medium thick, low carbonation. Lingering sweet woody with modest bitterness .
Pours a clear, deep amber with a creamy, quickly diminishing head. Nice aromas of malt and dried fruit. Great malt backbone with dried fruit. Another good Founders brew, one of my favorite Old Ales.

1/3 pint, keg. Pours medium dark brick red amber and very opaque, turning brown within. Perfect white tan head subsiding average slow. Scent is herbs, maybe oregano. Cumin and cinnamon both. Gingerbread scent - ginger? Old ale. Taste is very dense bourbon cask with a surprising fire on the way down considering the lack of ethanol taste, in spite of high ABV. Very intense. Finish is whiskey. Impressive. Great.

0.355 l bottle from P&M Getränke, best before October 2016 (according to the import label which does not allow me to read anything from the original back label). Clear, deep reddish amber with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, beige head. Sweetish, malty and a bit boozy aroma of caramel, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, honey, candied fruits and some plasticine. Very sweet, malty and a little alcoholic taste of lots of toffee, molasses, brown sugar, some honey, a touch of vanilla and some plasticine, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, a little alcoholic finish. Full body, sticky and oily mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Heavy stuff, not that easy to drink, not completely round as wel. Still nice, but expected something more sophisticated.
Här var de alkohol! Det märks att det är nästan 10% i denna. I övrigt en rund och en aning söt smak. Fint brun med hyfsat skum.
This ale has it nailed. Aroma of sweet caramel. Just enough hops to balance the rich molasses flavor. Mouth feel is big, rich and smooth. The best in class.
Hazy amber color. Aroma has yeast, spice and some hops. Dominated by a malty taste, it has a nice layer of sweet caramel and a slight bitter hoppy finish. Well balanced.

What a beautiful aged ale!, dark golden color, with light brown head, showcasing the sensational malts, and the molasses been used to brew this amazing beer, the aromas of sweet malts, with elegant hits of oak, and spices from the barrel aging, taste of lightly roasted malts, and the taste of the barrel aging is breath taking, the texture is full bodied , and very creamy, smooth and very easy to drink.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass. Aroma is mild bread, caramel. Appearance is mainly clear light brown with some large dark sediment floaters, huge sparkle, finger-width creamy beige head with poor retention and decent lacing. Taste is mellow sweet caramel and bread with perfect amount of oak to complement the flavors and take it to a whole new level. Palate is medium-to-full bodied with creamy texture and nice smooth finish. Overall, an understated aroma and unfortunate dark floaters but taste and mouthfeel really shine. Founders knows oak.

Bottle from Systembolaget. The nose is soy, smoke and coffee, made me think of sushi. It pours very dark with a dirty, two finger head. Tastes sweet, molasses, coffee, chocolate, red wine and raisins. Great after-dinner-drink. I actually drank it in bed as my girlfriend had some wine. A bit too sweet at first but develops into something awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is sweet caramel, light molasses. Taste is caramel with light oak...gets a little wimpy on the end but overall delightful.

Bottle. Hazy dark amber with large foamy light beige head, oak aroma with a bit of caramel, medium carbonation, woodsy caramel taste, lightly sweet with alcohol undertones, thickish smooth body, long bitter woodsy finish with alcohol aftertaste. Strong and interesting.

Flaska från SB. Klar, gyllene brun med smutsbrun skumkrona. Söt doft av pumpa och ekfat. Söt och kraftfull kropp. Smak av smörkola, ekfat, pumpa, torkade frukt, peppar och alkohol. Fatig, jordig och torr avslutning.
Bottle. Hazy, brown, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

9.8%ABV. Old Ale.

Poured out clear mahogany. 25ºSRM.

Nose has molasses and brown sugar aromas. There are nice strong dried date aromas as well. The tang of alcohol gives this a nose like a nice scotch ale but with less smokiness. You also get some sweet maraschino cherry aroma.

Mouthfeel is syrupy. Palate has strong honey and treacle flavor notes. There is banana but also a very nice rich creamy bread pudding-like flavor which makes this overall like having a very moist and alcoholic banana bread. There are rum-like flavors as well. The finish is alcoholic with a nectary, raw brown sugar like base but with some nice spiciness which is accentuated by the curmudgeonly alcoholic burn: cinnamon, nutmeg, clove and maybe even some five spice. There is also this cloud of creamy aromas and flavors with vanilla bean, creme fraiche, and sweet cream.

Overall, a wonderfully belligerent tipple. So very very craftily put together with layers of complexity all on a bed of barely concealed aggression.

Goes on Favorites List !

Bottle. Pours a rich Bronze

Aroma. Dark Fruits, oak and syrup.

Taste. Very Rich and indulgent, Molasses, Dark Fruits, Oats, oak, with a spicy bitterness throughout and just a touch of whiskey.

Overall. Quite a complex, satisfying and indulgent beer
This barrel aged beer has lots of strong oak flavor almost over powering not for me.

Bottle. Copper color. Aroma of malt, sweet molasse, raisiny ripe fruit and cinnamon. Sweet malty taste of soft ripe fruit, oak, malt, raisin, syrup and some bitters in the finish. Very smooth and elegant.

Draft pour at the Willards Tap House. Nice to run into this beer while down here. 2014 vintage. Oily copper pour with an active fizz head. Mild sweet malt aroma. Flavor is complex, bready malt, bold caramel, sweet cream. Caramel heavy finish. Fresh feel to an old beer. Excellent stuff.

Reddish brown pour with a beige head. Nose is english old ale with light raisins, nutty, slight caramel and bready aroma and maybe a slight soft vanilla spice to soften things up. The taste is fairly light with mostly caramel, light dark fruit and again a dry nutty pressence. Finishes malty, well rounded and with a sweet bready aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium with fairly soft carbonation.
Pretty good ale. Medium body, good aroma, decent overall quality. The roasted malts are dominant, and pretty tasty.

Bottle from beer club. Pours light mahogany with almost no head. Aroma of molasses. Sweetness along with the 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On keg at Ushers. 
Appearance - hazy amber with a decent head. Like dark honey.
Nose - tonnes of honey and Jamaica cake. A bit Oloroso sherry too.
Taste - honey, toffee, figs and brown bread. Nuts. Dried orange peel. Oh and then a layer of marzipan on the finish. 
Palate - medium to full bodied with a creamy yet tangy texture and a long dry rich yet balanced finish. 
Overall - this is a bit special.

Buena cerveza, con toques bastante dulces mezclado con toques maderosos que hace que te venga a la mente el sabor de las castañas. Entra muy bien y no se nota mucho la graduación alcoholica. Repetiria una vez más.

Aroma of caramel and butter. Pours a reddish brown with a small, quickly dissipating head. Overall taste is sweet with pronounced molasses notes. A full-bodied ale with mild carbonation. The finish is bitter but not particularly long.

In the glass it has a reddish amber color with a small head. Aroma of sweetness like alcohol soaked fruit, raisins and oak. Taste is smooth with molasses, figs, raisins and more alcohol. Big flavor with a good balance that hides the alcohol.
Pours a dark amber/brown without much of a head. Has a nice full mouthfeel with flavors of coffee, chocolate, caramel, a hint of fruit, and a nice bitter finish. Very nice.

Sample at Whole Foods, Auburn Hills. Pours hazy caramel, kind of sedimentous appearance. Off white head. Aroma is caramel, fig, toffee, dark fruits, slightly estery, berry. Flavor is citrus hops, caramel, toffee, fig. Nice. Difficult to describe. Old ale.

Vissa upplevelser behöver ett lexikon för att uttydas. En krypteringsnyckel för att förstå om det är ett verk av idioti eller geni som ligger uppslaget på bordet - eller i glaset. En arom av russin, kanel och likör färgar också av sig i smaken som tyvärr är lite för söt och spritig. Efter en flaska kvarstår frågan - geni eller idioti?

Pours dark ruby with small head. Aroma: malty, molasses, wood, marzipan, a touch of vanilla (from the barrel?). Taste: very pleasant woody taste, counterbalanced with malty sweetness, leather, raisins and a decisive, hoppy palate, coupled with warming alcohol. Great.

Bottle @ home.cellared for 18 months. Pours a beautiful red liquid with a medium-sized head. Aroma is intensively sweet and malty with loads of dark fruits, caramel, toffee, molasses, port wine, raisins leather, milk chocolate, hints of peat. Warming, big body with a smooth texture. Taste starts out with caramel, molasses, toffe, vanilla, leather, plums, raisins. Really good duration. It finishes slighly drier with milk chocolate, some clean maltiness and more dark fruits, earth and a balancing bitterness and alcohol.

0,355 l bottle from Biervana 
caramel, cereal, resin, floral, alcohol, butterscotch, vanilla, woody. 
Dark amber color, clear and with a quick disappearing brown foam head. 
heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, thick feel, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,
This is one of those super high-alcohol beers with a big heavy sweet malt flavor. Its fuckin ok for what it is

7 May 2016, tap. Ruby/pink/orange. Nose is very soft, maybe bubble gum. Ned body and mildly fizzy. Reminds me of pumpkin pie. Doesnt taste like a pumpkin but has some similar spicing. Sweet, malty, mild alcohol. Decent.
Pours a dark amber. Aromas of malt, caramel, fruit. Flavor is kinda sweet, fruity, mildly spicy, with a nice hop background.
Bottle at home. Boozy and sweet. Little head, amber in color. Dark fruit. Nice end to.tge evening.

Flaska från SB. Kopparröd/mörk bärnstensfärgad, klar med gräddbeiget, krämigt, fingertjockt skum som lämnar längs sidorna. Riktigt tjusig. Stor malttyngd i doften; molass, torkade plommon, seg kola, russin, kakao, chokladpraliner, körsbärslikör, kakdeg, fikon. Anar en lätt syra från ekfat och en något spritig ton. Riktigt stor och maltdominerad kropp. Alkoholen märkbar, men på ett bra sätt. Nära doften i smaken, men med en större, värmande alkoholton som bär upp den tunga kroppen fint. Även här märks av en viss syra och strävhet från ekfatet som görs snyggt ihop med den annars oerhört maltdominerade kroppen. Riktigt bra!

Bottle from SB 160429.
Pours a beautiful clear red copper with a dirty beige sticky and lacing head. Heavy bready and malty nose with some dried fruits. Sweet molasses and toffee in the palate with raisins and dried prunes. A bit too much ethanolsweetness to be well balanced. Interesting but not my absolute favourite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 APPEARANCE: copper red with a large sticky head. AROMA: molasses and caramel. TASTE: reflects the aroma, but more "malty". PALATE: medium bodied; low carbonation; and medium bitterness. - not my cup of tea.
Redbronze, clear, with yellow coarse foam. Malt, molassis, and alcohol in the aroma. Malt, caramel, alcohol, raisins, with alcoholic aftertaste.
Copper red with off white/yellow head. Really nice malt and syrup aroma. Well balanced taste with a hint of chewing gum at the end. Hoppy and freshly bitter finish.

A cool leathery aroma, pours clear with minimal head.
A very complex taste, the leather from the aroma is there, but there is so much flavor here, some sweetness, tobacco, oak... Very nice.. Smooth oily feel with some fizzy tingle at the end.. Really nice

Aroma: caramel, toffee, molasses, dark fruits. Appearance: hazy, dark amber, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets continue, fortified wine, alcohol, caramel, molasses, dark, ripe fruits, prunes. Overall: very nice Old Ale, very rich and complex. Bottle at CASK Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico.
Tap, Bills beer garden, Ann Arbor, MI via. Hazy apricot. Citrus honey resin aroma. Thick. Sweet. Some caramel and coriander. Boozy finish.

Pours a rich amber with thin filmy off-white head. Aroma is rich and thick with molasses and prunes. Flavor is predominantly prunes with little carbonation. Very thick and rich.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark copper with a thin sticky head. Aromas of vanilla, toffee and oak. Flavors of toffee, butterscotch, vanilla, leather and oaky notes. Substantial booziness. Slightly sticky mouthfeel. Delicious.
Bottle from Number 21. Clear, deep copper with no lacing. Boozy, whisky oak aroma. Very light, incredibly smooth with sweet molasses and a whisky oak finish. Crazy good.

Mérite dêtre vieillie.
Nez assez belle avec pas mal de levure, du malt, et un peu de boisé.
Bouche assez proche dune quadruple avec les gouts de mélasse, des notes de chêne très perceptibles bien soutenues par les levures.
Vraiment bonne mais reste un peu jeune.

This pours the deepest amber-mahogany into the glass, with a fully diminished head that leaves little to trace lacing. There is vanilla bourbon to the nose, alongside woody oak, dark stone fruits, toffee and caramel chews. Flavors showcase the oaked bourbon aspect, with vanilla, toffee, Candi sugar, caramel, plums, licorice, unsalted crackers and light diacetyl notes, finishing with a burning alcoholic woody bitter. The full body is oily on the palate, has a chewy mouthfeel, and is slick down the gullet. This acts like an old ale, feels like an old ale, and presents/represents fully as an old ale. Great example of the style from one of Americas most respected breweries. Kudos!

Couleur du cuivre foncer, presque rouge, avec très peu de mousse mais les très belles dentelles. Larôme est bordée du malt, avec du caramel, sucre brun, mélasse, un peu de chêne et presque pas dhoublon. En bouche cest encore très malté. Dabord il y a du caramel, mélasse et sucre brun, cest un peu sucré et un peu lourde sur la palate, mais le malt puissant est accompagner presque toute de suite par une bonne amertume. Cest très près dun barleywine mais plus buvable. Avec le montant dhoublon ca irait bien vieillie en cave.

Pours a hazy gold amber with a lingering off white head. Nose is restrained and a little sweet with a bit of oak. The barrel aging dominates the front with complex lighter flavors coming out on the backside. Alcohol is well-hidden. A little unremarkable but drinkable especially given the strength

Appear : Clear ruby-amber color with foamy head. - 4
Aroma : Grainy malt aroma and woody-oak aroma. - 7
Mouthfeel : Medium carbonate, medium body, creamy. - 4
Taste : Bitter, sweet, soft woody, a little bit of booze underneth. - 6
Overall : Dont get what this beer is. - 10
One finger of head on a dark straw body. Aroma is spices, molasses, oak and lemon. Taste is dark fruit sweet, a bit of dry wood, and a mild dry bitter finish. Texture is thicker. Nice flavor.

Deep amber, hazy. Low beige head. Aroma toffee, candi sugar, butter biscuit, oak chips and rum cask. Palate medium, low carbonation. Pleasant and warming finish. Taste herbal notes, toffee, molasses, milk chocolate and vanilla. Wonder-fucking-ful! Complex and original beer.

Bottle 2010 vintage poured a clear reddish amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of toffee, fruitiness, sherry, spice and light caramel. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, sherry and dried fruit with a smooth lingering sherry finish.

Murky mahogany, no head just thin film of foggy remains of one. Sweet surypy malt, bit ash, bubblegum, mildly caramel, dried dark fruits, alcohol mostly hidden. Chewy, soft feel, low carbonation, full thick body, malty medium long finish with mixed sweet notes, vanilla, mocca. Nicely balanced, good warm thick feel and lively nuanced finish. Tasty winter warmer.

Very rich and sweet. Honey on the nose. Much more malty than hopyy overall. Nice deep clear amber colour. Interesting to drink this next to Lagunitas Brown sugga: similar maltiness and IBU level, but totally different hoppiniess perception, this one more pure bitterness and flavour, lesss aroma and pine etc.

Bottle purchased a couple years ago I reckon. Pours nice amber/red. Aroma is sugary sweet and toffee. Flavor is about the same. Some piny hops in the finish actually. Maybe a bit more than Id prefer.

.3l on tap @Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours cloudy reddish brown with medium head. Aroma is fruits, malts, syrup, bread, bisquit, dried fruits. Vanilla notes. Flavor is dark malts, bread, fruits, alcohol notes, vanilla, hops, syrup notes. Great beer!
Bottle. Bronze beer with a tan head. Malt aroma. Caramel and oak flavor with molasses. Medium bodied. Caramel and molasses lingers with oak.
Everything is good, except it is too sweet. Smell with caramel, plum and malt, come in red amber with thin white crown. Taste of caramel and malt, good texture...slightly slimy

Bottle. Pours daark amber with small head. Aroma is sweetish, toffee, caramel, malty, chocolate, slight roast. Taste is over medium sweet, toffee, caramel, milk chocolate. Medium + body. Sweet finish.
Pours a deep ruby red with little to no head.Sweet, dark fruit aroma, stewed prunes and plums. A very smooth, sweet dark red fruit taste as well, with a hint of burgundy finish.

12 oz bottle. Aroma is malty and slightly sweet. Color is Amber orange, somewhat cloudy, with a white head that leaves a little lacing. A little sweeter than expected, but still very pleasant. Light wood flavor is perfectly balanced. Full mouthfeel. Overall a great beer that tastes nowhere near the strength that it actually is. Beware!

Bottle. Clear amber red beer with a large white head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, bread, dried fruit, vanilla, oak and herbs. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel, bread, herbs, vanilla and nuts. Well balanced.
Pours a clear amber color with white head. Kinda bitter after taste and syrupy

Bottle. Tawny clear appearance with hardly any head. First impression was the strong presence of alcohol. Plenty of body but no real flavours. Perhaps I was feeling a bit grumpy when I tried this one but having said that it was still good, just not as good as I had expected.

355 ml bottle. Clear ruby pour, little head. Smells of malted barley, caramel and caramelized fruit (cherries, prunes, stuff like that). Heavy caramel in the mouth, together with a hop bitterness and a metallic feeling in the background. Not one of the best old ales out there.

Bottle, from the Guard of the Cellar, bottle dated 04-04-11, normally wouldnt just break out a 4 1/2 year old beer @ 2AM, but why the f not... I mean who am I to question the guard?
Pours a deep orange color with a small but well retained head and nice lacing on the glass.

Aroma is aboud with toffee & tobacco. Its got some mild oak & a little bit of cherry, maybe some clavados. Mildly oxidized at this point but the light sherry like character fits pretty well here. 

The flavor is toffee forward with a little bit of pear and cherry. Its still got some oak character but thats melded into the flavor of the beer well at this age whereas it can be a bit brash when the beer is fresh. Its certianly sweet but not cloying and has some nice plum , chocolte, & raisin flavor... The booziness is nicely warming and its not much in the way of papery oxidation. This has aged very gracefully, 

Im never enormously impressed with this one fresh, so this is a plesant surprise. This is easily one of the most clear cut examples of a beer improving with extended aging.

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ Cervezorama 2.0, Madrid, España.
A: Brown / Marron.
T/S: Roasted malt, caramel, alcohol / Malta tostada, caramelo, alcohol.

Bottle from systembolaget, Sweden.
Big and amasing lasting head for a 10 % beer.
Nice malty aroma with mild caramell.
Smooth caramell with alcohole clearly present and a firm bitterness. Big body and nice sipping beer.
Neither a borrower nor a lender be do not forget stay out of debt... Think twice and take this good advice from me...xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Bottle. Pours a dark auburn brown with a small, beige head. Aroma is syrup, molasses, caramel, dried fruit. Taste follows along the same lines. Some liquorice, light oak and vanilla in the finish. Full with decent carbonation.

Brown beer with small head that fades away quite fast. Aroma has caramel, toffee, oak wood. Some stingy alcohol is in there too. Taste is really sweet, caramel, syrup maybe port wine and warming alcohol. A bit too sweet and stingy alcohol doesnt help. Full body and a bit high carbonation.

Pours a slightly hazy reddish copper color with a medium sized frothy off white head. The aroma is sweet roasted malts, brown sugar, alcohol. The taste is predominately malts and the alcohol is very noticeable.

Malty, heavy. Not much aroma. Not my type of beer. Likely won't buy again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy brown pour. Aromas of leather, toffee, brown sugar and grapefruit. Flavours the same with a fading citrus and piney bitterness. Oak, lightly oxidized but good.

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours rusty copper with a little white head. The aroma features dried fruitiness, sweet caramel maltiness and a touch of spiciness  fairly rich all in all. Taste offers plenty of variety as well: caramel malt sweetness features initially with dry fruity elements such as fig and raisin, later a subtle hoppy touch rises and adds color to the drying finish. Also some lingering oak and vanilla appear, validating the label "old" in the style category. Excellent taste both in depth and balance. The palate is medium to full bodied, soft in carbonation. A great beer in all respects.

Alla spina. Limpido color mogano-rossiccio con un pannoso velo di schiuma beige. Avvolgente al naso con sentori di caramello, mou, frutta sciroppata e un tocco quasi legnoso; gusto dolce, rotondo, liquoroso con note che richiamano gli aromi e che persistono a lungo. Corposa, cremosa e fantastica!

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From bottle in English pint glass. Aroma of molasses, faint vanilla and oak. Rich malt profile and strong EtOH in the finish. One big burly barley brew.

Shared bottle. Pours is dark hazy amber with small head that lasts only for a while. Aroma of caramel, malts, yeast, light biscuity. Solid malty base, light sweet, light bitter, caramel mouthfeel. Heavy body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. Nice aroma, superb taste, overally awesomely ballanced beer, recommended.
Bottle, 355 ml. Nice appearance, well balanced. (My wife on this beer: divine)

A very nice barleywine style beer. Pours a beautiful deep red with a thin white head. Smells decent, of barleywine and a toastiness. Taste is classic barleywine, with chocolate off the bat, and some vanilla and spice in the finish, along with a lingering sweetness. Had on tap at Albany Taproom.

pours a cloudy copper amber with a slowly forming medium beige head. aroma is a deep boozy toasted malt with maybe some woody smokiness. Creamy heavy mouth feel. Sweet malty taste. The woody smokiness returns slightly on the very warm finish. Good beer for a cold night. Not my style, but solid.

355 ml bottle. Hazy coppery colour, thin off-white head. Caramel-malty aroma, with syrupo and berries. The flavour is sweet, caramel-malty, with wood notes, dried fruits and a warm finish. Very tasty.
Shared 12 oz. bottle. Amber brown in color with beige head. Aroma has caramel, licorice, booze. Taste: molasses, bourbon, wood, caramel. Nice unique flavor.

Aroma: faintly sweet and malty; Appearance: clear, dark brown with minimal head; Taste: smoothly bitter with sweet finish; some molassas, some booziness, oaky; Palate: full body with creamy texture, average carbonation with some lacing; flavorful finish; Overall: very complex and balanced; can actually taste the oakiness; intriguing flavor - different than most ales; a little twang that I cant place; would definitely buy again.

A nice, sweet ale and much more than I expected. Lovely color..light coppery gold. Pleasing aroma...taste is a surprise because is truly is awash with molasses sweetness. My personal preference is stout so I prefer a thick beer which this is not. Overall I am satisfied and this is in fact the second time I have brought this brew home.
Gylden brun klar med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter karamell, vanilje, alkohol og tindved. Smaker medium bittert, alkohol men vaniljesmaken runder av. Noe brent karamell. Medium lang intens

Bottle, 355ml. A clear ruby beer with a medium size white foamy head and some lacing. Aroma is of bourbon, spices, malt, alcohol and something that reminds me of white chocolate. Taste is bitter with a strong sweet double aftertaste. Some carbonation and astringency. Aftertaste reminds me of caramel.

Bottle, 355ml. Clear ruby with a creamy tan head. Dry, earthy aroma of molasses, roasted caramel, spices, bourbon. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Sweet malty and fruity character, with an exquiste sweet finish. Alcohol is very well masked. Complex and heavy, but tasty and utterly drinkable. Very pleasant.

355 ml, bottled. BB 05/12/2015. Pours clear ruby with a nice white head. Aroma: Strong malt, bread. Notes of berries and oak. Taste: Sweet, pleasant malty flavour. Notes of warming alcohol. Syrup tones, licorice. Some bitterness. Very balanced. Palate: Medium body, silky at first, some carbonation and pleasant long aftertaste with some alcohol. Excellent malty old ale.

Copper color, golden beige head. Caramel nose, syrup, wood, raisins, rich malty. Sweet malty taste, caramel, dried fruit, wood, alcohol, burnt sugar, dry finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

Rödbrun öl, lätt grumlig med beige skum. Söt sockrig maltig doft med hintar av alkohol. God lagom söt smak, lite karamellig med en ok beska. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark reddish colour with a creamy head. Aroma of molasses, berries and fruits. Relatively sweet notes with hints of smoke and oak. Some caramel. 
Taste of caramel, some molasses and some oak. Spicy flavour with some orange. Malt.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Color mogano chiaro con riflessi arancioni, limpida, schiuma ocra di media persistenza.
Aroma biscottato, toffee, uvetta e frutta matura a polpa gialla, liquorosa e leggermente vinosa.
Aroma inizialmente fruttato e liquoroso, in secondo piano note tostate; bellissima coda molto complessa che spazia da un amaro erbaceo e tostato all'uva passa e all'amarena sotto spirito, nota alcolica molto presente ma estremamente piacevole.
Corpo pieno, non molto carbonata.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo consumed at home Monday 19th October 2015.   Pours reddy brown with a light beige head. Big boozy nose. Strong toffee taste but the booziness shows again, real punch. Big beer but very likeable the barrel ageing works but after a while you feel that its a bit much. The sweetness is fine, molasses showing well. A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13 3.3

Bottle. Amber in color with a small head. Raisin soup, sweet brown sugar, some maltyness in aroma. Bit barley wine like. Sweetish in taste also, toffee and ripe raisins. Easy one to drink and quite tasty.

On draught at Nob Hill Bar & Grill, Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA. Pours a dense reddish amber with fleeting white head. No aroma in chilled glass. Medium-bodied with nice malty character.full mouthfeel. Late alcohol notes. Nice. No excessice oak character. No molassS sweetness.

Bottle @ home from Utobeer - Color: dark amber beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: very complexe nose. Sweet malt caramel. Sugar cane notes and small resin. Finish as alcohol. Taste: full body, sweet caramel malt. Good balance. Very amazing beer. Going to the barley wine style but more dry! Good bitter attenuation finish as alcohol. Aftertaste: sweet caramel and astringent by alcohol. Resin. Very amazing! Anyone but to try this!

Small, fizzy, pink, fully diminishing head, some lacing. Flat, medium orange body. Heavy malty aroma, with notes of cookie, toasted, molasses and caramel. Moderate hoppy aroma, with notes of herbs and grass. Light yeasty aroma with notes of dough and sweat. Notes of prune, tawny port, maple syrup, nutmeg, alcohol and medicine. Moderate sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic initial flavor. Long, light sweet, heavy bitter and light acidic finish. Medium to full body. Oily texture. Moderate alcoholic, moderate astringent, metallic finish.
Awesome complex sweet. Light alcohol flavor. Pretty clear in a weird reddish tan with tiny head. Aroma is kind of fruity sweet? Apples? Just a tad too sweet, not quite cloying. Really smooth body.
From bottle to tulip. Beautiful clear copper and tan head. Slightly boozy and rustic. Slight alcohol warmth. Moderate malt.

(Bottle) Clear deep amber brown with very thin tan head. Nice rich aroma - toffee, raisins, some tar notes. Lovely palate - full bodied, oily, slightly sticky with fine prickly carbonation. Great taste too - rich, complex and changing. It starts out very sweet, avoiding cloying by the rapid development of balancing flavours. The sweetness is toffee and raisins, the balance is provided by black treacle, burnt sugar bitter notes and by alcohol giving a taste balance reminiscent of a liqueur. There are some lighter fruitier notes too. Very impressive, and dangerously drinkable.
I really like this beer. Toffee and dates and other good stuff in the aroma. Wonderful maltiness with lots of stuff going on. Great!

9/20/2009 9:13:03 AM Bottle from Bierkoning. Beautiful amber body with thin head. Very sweet, reminds me of marsepin and cognac. Very drinkable with lots of caramel, toffee and congac in evidence. Syrupy texture and goes down very well.

Taste is malty with quite sweet aftertaste. Aroma has plums, caramel, ripe fruits. Flavors of malt, ripe fruits, caramel.
Draught at WilliamK. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, hops, mango, nuts and malts. Bitter finish with hops, caramel, nuts, mango and grass. Very nice old ale.

Pours a burnt amber color with a white head. Earthy, oak, caramel, toffee, biscuit, floral and molasses aroma and flavors. Medium full body with moderate carbonation. Caramel, oak and molasses finish.
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours. Copper. Taste is sweat with molasses. Roasted malts as well.
Slightly sweet with some piney bitterness to balance it out. Has some really nice caramel flavors, molasses, maple syrup, and some slight dark fruit. Not overly sweet.

Pullo @ Systembolaget. Kaatuu snifteriin punaisen kuparisena ja hiven sameana, noin kahden sormen paksuisella ja kestävällä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on sokerisuutta, alkoholia ja tynnyrin tuomaa puumaisuutta sekä vähemmän marjaisuutta ja vanilijaa. Maussa jatkuu sama linja, se alkaa puumaisudella ja marjaisella sokerisuudella, sitten iskee alkoholi ja lopussa kermaisempi vanilijaisuus ja lievä karamelli tulevat esiin. Suutuntuma on hyvin hyökkäävä, alkoholi tuo loppuun lämmittävyyttä. Melko viinainen sekametelisoppa, näin vahvalta oluelta odottaisi täyteläisyyttä ja lempeämpää maltaisuutta, nyt ilmeisesti kypsytys on ohentanut makua, muttei ole tuonut merkittävästi lisäarvoa.
@ Stordirren 15-9-14: lätt doft av kola. Smaken är mycket mjuk med söta toner av kola. Trevlig.

Flaska. Mahognyfärgad med ett stort lätt smutsat skum. Härliga dofter av karamell, vanilj, apelsin och läder. Smakinslag av karamell, vanilj, trä och alkohol. Mjuk munkänsla, men alkoholen bränner mer än värmer.
På flaska från systembolaget. Mörk bärnstensfärgad. Doftar sherry. Smakar syrligt äpple och sött på samma gång. En mild beska i eftersmaken.

Over the top toffee flavor...The aroma is very rich and malty. Taste is similar with a hint of booze. Perhaps a bit of age will mellow the flavor. Its all the sweet rich character I like about an old ale. This is a good one.

On tap at Babajan. Pours a mahogony hue with a small off white head. Sweet aroma, dark syrup, spices, malts, big toffee note. The flavour is also super sweet, notes of dark syrup toffee, bit of coffee, vanilla, malts. Very sweet but with enough to back the sweetness. Big mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Long aftertaste of christmas candies and dark syrup. Really nice to me, but if youre not a fan of sweet beer this is not for you.

Pours deepest red copper with a shortlived off white head. Boozy aromas of sweet malt, plums, dried fruit, port... flavours follow suit, with oak, molasses... soft carbonation, and a thick, sweet body. Fine sipping ale.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 The question was it bourboun or rum as a second perspective of this ale? Yes bourbon barrels and yes a super stuff. Thanks Jan!
