355ml bottle. Hazy dark amber color with red notes and off white head. Malty aroma, sweet, caramel, fruity, light wood. Heavy sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily sticky body with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 I just LOVE this beatiful beer! 

I pours hazy, dark amber/mahogny with a one finger high, beige head. 

Nose: Caramel malt, brown sugar, syrup, fudge, biscuit, plum, molasses, oak and dried fruit. A really peasant nose! 
Taste: Caramel, sweet cookies, malt, syrup, molasses, oak and plum. 
Mouth: Full body and complex texture. Medium to high carbonation. Smooth taste! 
  
As I said - Beatiful!

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 Marrom turva, espuma de pouca formação, pouquíssima persistência. Aroma intenso maltado, caramelado, levemente defumado, alcoólico, uva passa. Paladar bastante próximo ao aroma, dulçor intenso, amargor de difícil percepção. Corpo licoroso, baixa carbonatação. Aftertaste maltado, alcoólico, dulçor persistente. Ótima para harmonizar com queijo !
I have a problem with this type of beers. Its sticky and bitter sweet in a bad way. Cant notice any hops but plenty of head.
Flaska från SB. Rödbrun med beige skum. Doft av karamell. Smak av alkohol och karamell.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Creamy beige header.ämbetsman body. Smells hoppy, bit of citrus, salt, oak, caramel. Tastes caramel, salt, hops, byts. Sweet, salt and bitter.

Dark amber slightly cloudy brown, with little head at all. Nose is not strong , however molasses, a little chocolate , malt, sugar, caramel is there . Flavor is slightly woody, but lots of molasses, caramel, toffee, a little citrus and possibly dried plum.If you have ever been inside a sugar factory it will hit you ," thats what I can taste and smell ", Sweet and almost ashy smoky finish. Medium to heavy body. Rich and warming on a cold evening, lovely sweet flavour. watch the alcohol , it will sneak up on you . will visit this one again
Stor smag af modne blommer der slutter af med en anelse varme fra alkoholen. En rigtig nyde-øl.

12/08/2015 - 33cl bottle @Erwins platform on the Schelde. Thanks for sharing. Great evening
Hazy brown, lots of particles, little head. Fruity, some wood, caramel. Taste is softer than dirty bastard but mouthfeel is nicer, a bit thicker. Some wood notes, vanilla, a bit port.

330ml bottle from Stori Beer & Wine, Bala. Pours deep rosy mahogany. Aroma is rich sweet malt. Taste is rich and complex with an intense, warming malt that refuses to let the booziness take the reigns. Impeccable, delicious old ale.

Bottle.
Amber, red color, white minimal head.
Aroma of dry apricots, some notes of honey and licorice.
Taste alcoholic, sweet, black pepper strong feel. Bitter finish.

Reddish amber, thin uniform head. Plum aroma, very sweet. A bit overmalted, needs more balance...too sweet, fruity, mild caramel notes, no defined finish. I was waiting for something to turn the corner, didn?t.
Pours clear dark amber with small head. Sweet and sticky, with some bread notes and some alcohol.
How : bottle Appearance : clear amber, minimal white head. Aroma : dried fruits, oranges, caramel, grass, floral, sherry, some wood notes. Palate : medium to full body, soft carbonation.

(355ml 2015 bottle from Systembolaget) Pours a clear dark amber-red with just a few white bubbles. Aroma only moderately strong, caramel and brown sugar maltiness, clove, cinnamon, fruitcake, vanilla oak, hints of stewed dates/plums. Flavour sweet, brown sugar, toffee, vanilla, dates, golden raisins, some spices and oak. Dries a fair bit at the finish, bitter, woody, with a bite from a bit of hops and some alcohol. Fairly light bodied with very soft carbonation. A fairly sweet but quite oaky strong ale, but not rich or unctuous like a barley wine or even like many old ales.

2015 bottling. Pours a clear reddish chestnut or very dark amber with a solid 2.5 fingers of frothy pale khaki head. Subdued aroma even at room temperature, hints of rich malt, wet carton, some chocolate, caramel and a hint of herbs. Difficult to find any boosieness, but I find the aroma very muted overall. Full bodied palate, towards the sweet side with a slightly dank resinous quality to it. Rich milk chocolate. Moderate bitterness, but very little boosieness. Very well made. Will be interesting to see if the aroma develops with some ageing.

Pours a dark amber brown, with a fluffy white head. Nose is oaky, molasses, musty, caramel. Flavor is lots of oak, molasses, caramel, toffee, a little citrus, plum. Sweet and almost ashy smoky finish. Medium to heavy body. Rich and warming, lovely oaky sweet flavor. Really nice.

Bottle. Dark amber with thin or no head. Really sweet taste from the molasses and oak. Vanilla notes of oak. Not really a big fan of oak aged beer but in this it works very well. Guess the ABV supports the oakiness in a balanced way. Finish has a lot of malt and some light bitterness.
Bottle (12oz): lol ear light brown with small tan head. Aroma slightly vanilla. The taste also was quite oaky and vanilla. Pretty dry. Alcohol in the end.

Brewed with molasses and oak aged. 12 oz pour from room-temp bottle into sniffer. Reddish-orange, clear, off-white head. Nose is sweet, cherry, malty, a little brown sugar, a hint of wood. Full body and creamy. A little sharp in the end. A bit dry. Taste is nice. Oaky and malty up front with a notable boozy finish. Coffee-like bitterness.
Bottled. Pours hazy brown with a big brown head. Smells and tastes nutty, candy malt and a bit grassy hoppy with a similar finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear light brownish with a light tan head. Malt driven aroma with vinous notes, dates, prunes and sweet honey or syrup. Hints of wood as well. Taste is actually quite balanced. Starts out malty sweet. A neutral bitterness balances it out a bit. Finishes with a warming touch andva light sweetness. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Pours clear deep amber with a dense cream head. Bouquet of sweet vanilla oak. Upfront sweetness quickly followed by bitterness balancing it out. Long finish keeps that duality of flavour all the way. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Hazy red colour, big head. Aroma is dominted of fruits, citrus, flowery, seet malts. Flavor had a mix of vet woody, caramelly, smoked, sweet malts, salty, alcy in the end! Big body long smked/ woodu bitter finish.

This is a beer with thin creamy foam. It has a beautiful reddish brown clear color and smells really good of summer berries. The taste is rich and tart of rowan and has a very warm alcohol. Very vinous ale, which is really not at all reminiscent of old ale, but rather barley wine. The difference between the two types of beer is not always so clear. It is very vinous and clearly fruity ascendancy of acid fruits. I seem to be able to sense rowan berries and grapefruit, but also some fruit sweetness in the form of prune or plum are present in the final. It is undoubtedly delicious and delicate, and may be even better for long-term storage.
Bottle, pours copper colored with small white head. Complex aroma with malt, caramel, vanilla, sherry. Thick sweet palate. Taste sweet malt vanilla whiskey oak some alcohol.

From 0,355l bottle, BBD: 05.12.2015 Pours light cloudy brilliant golden amber liquid, small to medium frothy tan head, Aroma: candied apricots, resins, molasses, floral, warming alcohol, Taste: heavy sweet, medium bitter, no acid, sweet, candied fruits, citrus, lemon grass, floral, molasses, resins, warming alcohol, whiskey wooden taste, harsh bitter sweetness, Palate: full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, long sweet alcohol finish, Overall: perfect old ale, bit too sweet, but still very nice and tempting. Enjoyed.
Koperkleurig bier. Schuimkraag dik maar verdwijnt snel. Zoete smaak die overgaat in bitter. Apart. Ruikt vanille zoet.

Hazelnut colour, off white head. Aroma of dark sugar, liquirice, dried plums, vanilla.Taste is medium sweet and very well balanced. Medium body, oily to creamy texture, average carbonation. Very nice.

Pours copper amber with tan bubbly head which settles thin leaving a nice lacing. Aroma is strong on the caramel and malt, some vanilla, pine, spruce and woody. Taste is very sweet initially before settling back and the bitterness comes through giving it a nice drying pallette sensation. Reminds me of barley wine. Palate is smooth, noticable natural carbonation. Overall a very nice, slick and drinkable beer, especially considering the strength!

Sampled at Whole Foods, it poured a clear light brown colour with off-white foam, lasting with lace. Malty, bready like a good ESB, caramelly like a good Scotch ale, subtle nutty and toasty notes, complex, but perhaps most notably: very hoppy. Lots more hop bitterness and flavour than an authentic English Old Ale, but delicious in its own arrogant American way. I can totally understand why this one is so highly rated. Definitely something Ill buy again.

Bottle from Bierkompass!

Bottled 02/24/2009!
Pours ruby red with a small off-white head. Aroma of resin, plum, dark dried fruits and caramel. Taste has sweet malt notes, lots of caramel and brown sugar as well as dried fruits and lots of plum. Finish is strong malty, very sweet with brown sugar, fruits, caramel and an earthy undertone. Really nice one, which spent 6 years in the bottle!

Red brown color with foam ring and some particles. The smell is very sugary and creamy with a diffuse fruit note. The taste is weirdly attractive and a little repelling. Sirupy, sugary, fruity (raisins?), caramel, foresty, oily, smooth, round and I dont know what is weird about it. This beer is special and you should try it. Interesting and weird. The taste is intense and suddenly stops a few moments later in the mouth.

Amber color with big beige head. Caramel, tobacco, vanilla, some hops, something you don?t have in other comparable beers I can?t quite describe. Taste is caramel, toffee, more vanilla, piney, bitter boozy finish, plums. Smooth carbonation, thick mouthfeel. Awesome.

On tap at Kilted Mermaid. Pours a beautiful caramel color, tan head that dissapates rapidly leaving minimal lacing. Not much on the nose, taste is molasses and dark fruit. Overall, a really nice old ale.

I like this. I like old ales. I like those dark fruit raisiny notes in old ales. I like those tobacco like hop flavorings that skirt the edges of the ale-fruit. I like getting drunk on a Tuesday night for no reason. and fuck you.

Originally rated on 4/20/14. A viscous amber pour, some floating sediment, slight white rim of head. Smells almost like a barley wine, very sweet malty profile, caramel, plum, vanilla and booze. Tastes much like a very strong barley wine mixed with some scotch. flavors of bourbon, oak, vanilla, tons of barley, caramel, banana, plum, raisins. a full bodied ale with some, but not a whole lot of carbonation. Overall its very heavy, boozy, thick and rich, this would be much better on a cold dreary night instead of a sunny 80 degree afternoon.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2015 Bottle from Lockes Party Shoppe. Pours light copper with a foamy beige head snd a floral treacle aroma. There is a sweet dark molasses flavor with some carbonation and a dry bitter finish.
I am not a huge fan of scotch ales but this is not bad. Worth a try if you have never had it.

Vermilion reddish orange pour. An intensely complex beer with a rich, sweet malt profile. Alcohol is evident, gives an embracing warmth. Fair amount of bitterness, but it melds well with the sweetness of the malts. Flavors of molasses, caramel, butterscotch, candied sugar, hop spice essence, faint raisin, toffee, woody (oak). Lovely array of flavors smoothing over your palate with a loving finish. One of the best Founders beers Ive had, and Ive had a lot, and a lot have been very good, so that s saying something.

Lite amber gold color, no retention, good clarity, malt forward as the style should be, with Carmel, butterscotch aroma that is booze within whiskey undertones. Palate is more maple syrup than mollasses with a candied like sweetness. Strangely I dont pick up the oak or molasses independently but notice there combination delievers what I would describe as a bourbon like character. Very pleasant considering I like bourbon as much as beer. Nice delivery on the style but my rating reflects my gravitation to hops as opposed to malt forward ales.

12 oz bottle. Medium amber, with a creamy tan head and sticky lace. Sweet, rich, malty aroma, with caramel and toffee, a little raisin, and some mild hops. Smells like an aged barley-wine.  Flavor is sweet caramel, brown sugar, spicy hops. ABV is well hidden.

På etiketten sitter en väderbiten herre i ensamt majestät med sammanpressade käkar och ser purken ut. Och tur är väl det. Om han öppnade det där svalget skulle ett område med en radie på allra minst tio meter förklaras hälsofarligt på grund av alkoholstanken. Drick med andra ord Founders Curmudgeon med stor försiktighet, om du inte själv vill förvandlas till en inre sumpmark.

40 cl på fad, 9,8 % ABV, nydt på Ørsted Ølbar, 23. juni 2015. 
Kastanjefarvet og ufiltreret amerikansk Old Ale med minimal offwhite skumtop på maksimalt 1/2 cm, som hurtigt svinder til kant og overflade. 
Ret ny og ukendt - for ut - aroma af bl.a. honning. Maltnuancer af forskellige brødtyper. 
Smagen er præget af bitterhed, men sødmen spiller også en ikke ubetydelig rolle.
Solid krop med en pænt opskruet karbonering, et stykke over middel niveau, men det klæder den. Klæbrig konsistens. 
Afslutningen er bittersød på den bitre lækre måde, medium lang. 
En solid øl med en solidt bittert eftertryk.
Cranberry and apple aroma. Taste has noted of bitter berries, vanilla, wood and tart cherry. Finish is bitter cherry with a boozy afterglow.

Draught @ Taphouse w the CEO. Appearance: pours slightly hazy amber with ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, toffee, oak, 
raisins, whisky and some dark fruits. palette: strong aroma, average carbonation, full body, average to distinct malt sweetness, average bitterness, medium to long duration and an oily texture. Overall: nice complex "strong" old ale
Amber. No head. Malty. Lots of oxidation. Tasted like cardboard. Tasted at brewery.

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Alcohol, dried berries, raisins, sweet, caramel, light spicy, later whisky smokiness.
Appearance: Ligth hazy amber color. Medium, white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, dried berries, caramel, light whisky smokiness.
Palate: Medium-full body. Sticky texture. Long, light warm finish.
Overall: Very good, complex.

Nice sipping beer. Hints of sweet malt and oak. Pretty copper color with a thin head. Smooth character with some heft. Flavors matched the aromas with a slight burnt flavor at the finish. A little boozy.
Very nice pour! Great flavor, although I thought it could be a lil more balanced. Looks awesome in the glass, and held up well to the cigar I was smoking that evening. That?s a plus for me!
Great beer, great choice for a late night drink. A must beer to try after a bad day at work!
Cloudy brown reddish appearance, medium head. Strong malty and barley aroma, rich taste, smooth with alcohol well hidden. Very rounded and enjoyable.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2015 12 oz bottle, poured into an oversized wine glass at ~45 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a mostly clear ruddy amber, and forms almost no head. What does form vanishes completely in short order, in a puff of fizzing.

Smell: The aroma is subtle, barely there, likely due to the wide-mouth glass. It is mild caramel and sweetness, with very soft hints of oak.

Taste: And alas, my hop sensitivity strikes. This has an earthy, ashy bitterness to it which becomes virtually all I can taste. I can faintly, oh so very faintly, make out wispy ghosts of sweet caramel beneath the dirty ashes, but thats it.

Mouthfeel: Acrid and harsh are the only things I can describe this as, like most beers that trip my hop sensitivity trigger.

Overall: This is a beer Id cite as an example of where "old ale" and "English barleywine" are not necessarily synonyms - Ive run into fewer English barleywines that I can barely drink than old ales. This may very well be a tasty beer, but its one I cant enjoy.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Shared bottle @ Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear amber with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, dark dried fruits, oak, vanilla. Some sweetness, well balanced, bitter finish. Medium bodied, dry mouth feel.

Bottle at home. Beautiful hazy lightly reddish brown colour, beige foamy head. Sweet nose with toffee and caramel maltiness and some red fruits. Taste is big on alcohol and malty sweetness, candy cane, a little hoppy bitter too: rather one dimensional but nicely balanced. Finish is short and sweet, a little astringent. Sticky mouthfeel, medium carbonation and firm body.
Bottle.clear golden colour with no head.Aroma of brown sugar and syrup nice warming mouth feels and sweet mouth feels with note of caramel and dried fruits nice warming with sweet finish.

355ml bottle. Best sugars I ever smelt in a beer. Very good old ale example. Perfectly balanced. Far away from barley wine. Perfect on all of the stages. I actually had it in US several years ago, and now revisiting it brings back good memories.

Pours mahogany with a small beige fizz. Smells malty, caramel, toffee, and a touch of alcohol. Taste is sweet, malty, toffee, and soft red fruits. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Founders Curmudgeon Old Ale finishes with a soft candied fruit sweetness.

35,5cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks! Pours clear deep amber with an off-white head. Malty and caramelly aroma with notes of wood, vanilla, spices and bourbon. Sweet and caramelly with nice, but somewhat strange spicy notes and a certain bitterness. Too much on the sweet side, but still quite interesting.

On bottle at Sara. Dark golden color- some foam. Medium aroma intensity; malt, honey, roasted with barrel influence. Medium/ full body. Some sweetness. Very Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells like butter! Tastes like buttered rum slightly. Nice cloudy orange amber color. Flavor reminiscent of a Belgian in it's yeastiness. Yes it's near 10%
Sweet maltiness and syrupy texture in a black as night brew. Very potent stuff. I think the name should be changed to "GET OFF MY LAWN!"
bottle. very intense beer. Not familiar with "old style" - but reminded me a lot of a barleywine. Quite good
12oz bottle pours a reddy brown color without much head. Mild hops and lots of fruit. Malty.

355ml bottle at home. Cant remember where from, but was bottled April 2012. Pours amber, with a surprising amount of black floaters. Given its been sat in a cupboard for three months I thought any sediment might have settled. Clearly not. Thin ring of white head. Aromas of sticky toffee pudding, marmalade at the back, light booze note. Taste is toffee, nuts, boozy, almost dark sherry. Sweet finish, as expected.

Bottle share at Leightons, thanks to Fergus. Dark reddy brown, lightly sparkling, small foamy tan head. Aroma is caramel, dried fruits, light peach, a little sour. Body is medium, tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is toffee, light card, stones, gravel, twiggy, a little boozey.

Bottle split at Leightons Cloud base, thanks to Fergus, 05/05/15.
One Ive certainly had in the past but good to catch up with a rake.
Rich amber with a decent beige covering.
Nose is rich fruit, caramel fudge, dates, toffee, fruit cake mix.
Taste comprises rich fruit cake, sweet licks, toffee, dark fruit rinds, stewed dates, toasted brown sugar.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sweet licks in the close.
Solid stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottiglia 355ml @ sir william's pub.
Rossa scura senza schiuma.
Molto carbonata, dolciastra.
Frutta rossa

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Bottle. Pours adark amber color with a small head. Aroma of malt, dark fruit, and hint of booze. Taste of malt, dark fruit and spice. Mild bitterness and a dry finish. Moderate body, smooth with a bit of a boozy feel. Nice but expected a more robust beer.

Bottle shared at Leightons place. Sourced online. Nice bright orange, light amber coloured pour with a lasting halo of white head. Aroma is nice raisin, apple tart, caramelised sugars, little Warming alcohol, Flavour is composed of caramel, toffee, little solvent, spicy apple tart, little tequila, Palate is full bodies, moderate to high carbonation. Hot alcohol in the finish. Decent barley wine.
Balanced like a teeter totter with twins on it. I guess.... Its equal parts really bitter and really sweet.... The word roasty comes to mind... But yep. Good.

It seems this thing needs to mellow while sitting for a while. As served, it was a murky light brown with quickly dissipating off-white foam. Smells of cooked sugar, booze, and wood. Flavors are too varied. Some sweet molasses with alcohol and oak. Slightly rough finish/linger of woodiness. The first disappointment Ive had from Founders. Perhaps expectations are high here.
Deep amber color with thin white head. Aroma of spices , vanilla , caramel , dark fruits. Sweet , caramel taste with notable note of oak , some fruits , candies and hint of alcohol.

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Fergus. Pours mostly clear orange with mild particulate presence and a frothy off-white head. Lots of ripe and tangy fruits in the nose, some berries, caramel, spices. Medium to heavy sweet flavor with gooey malts, some cinnamon, rich berries, subtle spice, some leafy hops. Full bodied, lightly chewy, with fine carbonation. Finishes warming and lightly sticky, with some further spice character, toffee, bread, slight dates. Good stuff.

Bottle thanks to Fergus. It pours orange-amber with a small white head. The nose is sweet, juicy, lots of dried fruits, raisin, sultana, fruit cake, muffin, candy and spice. The taste is bitter-sweet, woody, leather, toffee, honeycomb, fruit cake, loads of dried fruits and hefty booze with a warming finish. Fullish body and average carbonation. Pretty big on the booze, but not bad anyhow.
Pours a rusty orange with white head. A barelywine type aroma and taste with raisins, dark fruits, and dark alcohol. Additional tastes of spices and honey. A nice citrus and spice aftertaste.
Pours cherry red with large head. Herbs, sweetness and bready wheat. Frizzly with a sweet after taste.

Poured out of a 12 oz bottle.

Good rich malt flavor with hints of raisin.
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Aroma is of sweet berries, caramel, vanilla, toasted coconut, and oak.The taste is of caramel, toffee, vanilla, berries, pepper, oak, toasted coconut,and alcohol.

Pours a red hued amber with loose white head which disappears quickly......aroma of honey, raisins.....taste is thick mouthfeel with raisins, figs, caramel, booze, slight bitterness in the end and slightly metallic.

Bottle from the Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Pours deep amber with a thin off white head. Aroma of pear drop and alcohol. The taste starts sweet with banana, caramel, pear drop, light spice, vanilla and some woody notes. Warming alcohol. Very tasty.
Tap. Insanely beautiful lacing. Faint nose of lightly sweet nose. Full body. Tastes of spices -- almost a Christmas ale with nutmeg, allspice. Touch of orange. ABV not overwhelming in taste profile.
Nose is intense plum/prune/vinous/synthetic cherry. Flavor is same... Oddly fruity for the style with caramelized/burnt sugar in background. Caramel cough syrup? Wtf
12oz bottle pours a dark amber with a thin off white head. caramel molasses and malt taste
Aroma of fig, raisin, other dark fruits, yeasty, taste is more dark fruits, molasses, yeasty, very thick on the palate, moderate alcohol, pretty good!

It has a decent body with nice fruits and a particularly grape skin flavor to it. The bitter hops arrive toward the finish and linger a while. It's similar to North Coast's Old Stock Ale, but to me it's not quite as good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: caramel, raisin, alcohol, 
Appearance: amber, clear, tan foam, 
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, malts, 
Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 

Great beer.

On tap at the Big Texas Beer Fest. Poured a hazy dark amber with a cream head. Taste of caramel malts, biscuit, slight oak, with a boozy finish. Lively carbonation, full molasses body. Final thoughts: My Grandpa was a curmudgeon too...crusty old bastard
Pours a rich Amber initial Cherry, malty smooth mouth feel with a bit of alcohol at the end

Bottled 1/13/2015. Lightly chilled. 12 oz bottle into tulip. Fairly dark but transparent amber in color with quarter inch white to off white head. Malty aromas of caramel, bread and cereal. Taste is malty, light to moderately sweet. Notes of oak, nuts and earthy yeast. Some hinting notes of vanilla. Medium bodied with a slick texture. Light carbonation. Lightly bitter finish. Interesting beer. Not bad. Not at the top of my list. Not familiar with the style.
Founders always had a way to make you buy more. I can only handle one at a time of this baby due to the thickness and abv. Good sweetness and spice which is balanced with hops
Reddish dark brown. Oak aged in whiskey barrell, so taste of vanilla, with woody whiskey flavour and cane sugar. Strong alcohol note, so perfect for winter time.

Best before 27/12/2014. The Bottle enjoyed at cosmic café in turku. Oak aged, whiskey, vanilla, woody,... Amberish color, reddish light brown. Taste is sweet and aromatic with whiskey flavour and sweetness of cane sugar. Strong in alcohol but warming and nice to be enjoyed in front of the fire place in winter time..

Bottle shared by rosskyle. Consumed during the Final Four. Minimal head on an amber/copper colored old ale. Aroma is sweet with bubblegum and tropical fruit. The sweetness surprisingly kind of disappears as the taste sip begins. Alcohol presence, little peat, and an underlying sugary quality as it progresses. Caramel and molasses. Finishes with an element of bitterness with a last second rush of sugar. Overall it has a higher alcohol double IPA feel to it. Very satisfying. Like a curmudgeon who has consumed his fair share of Werthers.

Look: pours an amber Coe. White head. Very clear.
Smell: very malty. Very sweet like syrup. Flowers. 
Taste: very malt forward. Extremely sweet. Syrup. Slight alcohol. 
Feel: medium bodied. Sweet all the way through. 
Overall: nice beer. Easy drinker but watch out for the abv.
First drank: mom & dads 4/4/15
Vintage: 2015

Pours a beautiful dark reddish brown color with no head. Aroma is booze, apricot, caramel, raisin, toffee, molasses, vanilla, slight hop bitter. Taste is apricot, caramel, cinnamon, raisin, toffee, molasses, oaky vanilla, slight woody smoke. Overall a great beer, very complex and sweet.

Deep Amber red color. Very little head. Sweet alcohol aroma. Very smooth texture with a clean finish. Carbonation initially hits the front of the tongue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Old rating. Excellent hearty beer. Deep copper pour. Sweet malts with dark fruit, prunes, vanilla, oak, and a little bitterness. Robust, tasty.

Pours copper-amber with a one finger off white head with pretty nice lacing. Aroma is of sweet malts, candied fruits, vanilla, caramel, apricots, floral hops, toffee, and some raisins. Taste is sweet malts, dark candied fruits, vanilla, toffee, brown sugar, bread pudding, herbal hops, floral hops, and some light booze. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi-moderately bitter, long, lingering, slightly boozy finish. Overall, a tasty, pretty complex old ale that is pretty hoppy for the style.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2016 12oz bottle poured into a snifter. Initial, bright aromas of sweet toffee with a floral and herbal note come through with a woody and vanilla supporting note. Secondary notes of sugary maple syrup / molasses also appear with some sweet citrus and berries, as well as a light, hidden alcohol undertone. It pours a hazy / murky orange bronze topped by an active, off-white soapy, uneven head that retains a thin ring and small splotch surface as well as a light, spotty lace. The taste is a medium high, malty sweet and complimentary medium waxy bitter. The beer is full bodied, malty, with a thick and sticky texture thanks to a near flat, light fuzz carbonation. Flavors of toffee, citrus, and vanilla are most noticeable with a finish that?s crisp, and fairly clean, with woody spice character and a light alcohol warmth. The aftertaste is a waxy citrus rind and herbal blend. It?s a sneaky alcohol content in that there?s only a faint hint on the nose, but it?s well hidden on the palate. It?s rather malty fresh, so it?ll be curious to see how age treats it. 4/201512/2015 - Initial leather aromas fade, replaced by intense toffee and raisin, then molasses and mild nuts and wood. The murky caramel beer has a tan soapy head with decent retention and a messy, splotchy lace. The taste is highly sweet with a medium bitter. It?s thick with foamy carbonation and a full body. Flavors of toffee, nuts, and molasses are most prevalent up front with a finish that?s slick with caramel and a subtle grapefruit peel and herbal note. The aftertaste is mostly a sweet molasses.
30.9.2014. Pours copper with small head. Brown colour. Aroma of sweet oak, caramel, dark fruits. Taste is sweet malty, dark fruits, hops.

Bottle. Cloudy crimson, topped with a dense layer of tan froth. Smooth yet light aroma -- maple, buttery vanilla, toffee, pancakes. The oak is more prominent and sharp in the flavor, as is a whiskey-like alcohol note. Maple is soft, as are French vanilla, fresh red apple and a late-arriving toasted bread note. Everything in here is subtle, creamily blended and very drinkable for its ABV. I kind of wish it was MORE substantial, actually.

Bottle. Clear copper with thin offwhite head. Not much for aroma. Faint dark fruits and alcohol. Medium body and carb. Sweet but nicely balanced by hops. Hints of fruit, oak, and vanilla. Great beer, one of my favorites.

355ml bottle. Amber in the glass with a white head. Very aromatic !! Fresh, sweet armoa of hard candy. Many flavors, dark caramel, sweet, brown sugar, plum, Jack Daniels, toffee and fresh sweet oranges. Long, malty, strong aftertaste. Oh wow what a good thing!

Bottle from Utobeer, London. Pours a hazy deep orange-hued amber body with a medium off-white head. Aroma is muscovado sugar, vanilla, grains, caramel, toffee and hints of herbs, rum and wood. Taste is brown sugary rum notes, caramel, toffee, bitter herbs, grains, alcohol and hints of nuts, vanilla and licorice. Full, near-oily body, medium carbonation. Quite lovely, albeit a bit sharp around the edges. Still, a high pleasant sipper and I suspect this one will age with grace.
Brown caramel pour. Smells of candied fruits. Taste is BIG sweet toffee and a strange yeasty aftertaste. Full bodied. Not my favourite Founders nor Old Ale. Okay.
12oz bottle. Pours copper bronze, minimal head. Sweet malt with a bit o hint of molasses sulfur aroma. Taste is sweet and beery. Not bad for malt liquor.

Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Copper beer, small head that reduces to nothing. Aroma of bourbon, malts and treacle. Taste is sweet treacle, malts, tawny port wine and a mild bitter finish. Sticky on the palate. Good. Added a few more points onto the score, it grows on you. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Hazy deep amber, small tan head. Dark fruit, raisin, caramel, brown sugar, hops, roasted malt and woody aroma. Medium to heavily sweet, a bit boozy (not much). Medium to full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Sweet finish. Very nice. (Pivoljub 0,33l bottle)

Off white head, 1 1/2 fingers in depth. Hazy and amber in color w/ dark red hues towards the center and top of the beer. The aroma is big on the molasses and oak!! Not getting much else. The taste follows the nose along with a sweet caramel backbone. Overall pretty straight forward in taste. Medium mouthfeel.

Aroma in this one is sweet malts with burnt sugar and alcohol. The taste is a very well balanced soup of heavy and sweet caramels, darker fruits, vanilla with a tad of wood. There is a trail of pine resins running through this one that tags along all the way through. Warming and malty. Im slowly turning into that dude on the label... Actually, he looks a little bit like my dad, so its not that far fetched.

Bottle. Reddish / brownish beer with a strong off white head. The aroma is strongly hopped, roasted and malty. The flavour is very malty and rich with heavy hops, bitterness and burnt roastedness. Overall a very nice strongly malty, hopped and roasted ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler from Red Star Craft House. Founders never disappoints. Copper colored, little carbonation. Packs a punch. More well-mannered than a barleywine, but they are close cousins flavor-wise. Bittersweetly malty with dried fruit and oak notes. Clean mildly bitter finish.
Sample at a tasting event. Brown body with a low head. Caramel, vanilla, oak, dried dark fruits.
Very nice and strong. Quite thick and with an strange taste like old ale, precisely. Nice to drink with some cheese.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle. Color matches the mahogany in the "man cave, off white head fades fast. Aroma is sweet, toffee, caramel a little vanilla, nice malt flavor. An easy drinker considering the ABV. A really nice beer.

355 ml bottle, from Voldby Købmandsgaard. ABV is 9.8%. 50 IBU. Cloudy brown colour, low beige head of poor retention. Sweetish malty aroma, notes of caramel and oak, hints of dark dried fruits and alcohol. Not as sweet flavour as I feared, malty and oaky, caramel and dried figs, well balanced with the hops, a nice bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. Would buy again.

Bottle from archer road beer stop, sheffield. Pale copper with small white head. Nice syrupy smell, lots of malt, bread and caramel. Sweet and strong with good balanced bitterness and warmth. Oily medium body and nice subtle carbonation. Very drinkable, a considerable achievement at this strength.
Appearance is small white head with hazy orange color. Aroma is sweet with some of that oak aging. Taste is spice with sweet malt with hints of the oak aging. Overall pretty good, but not great.

Very malty with high alc. 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark Amber reddish Orange hilites and rimm. Lacy offwhite head; aroma is sweet with bourbon notes; Flava is malty sweet bourbonish upfront some bitter hops later; feels thick creamy and slight fizzy bite; finishes grain dry and hoppy bitter some residual sweetness on the side

Pours slightly blurry, red to brown in appearance, no head. Smell is very pleasant! First a sweet floral scent, followed by a slight hoppy note. It finishes with a sour smell. After a while, the oak smell really kicks in. A very interesting aromatic mixture. Taste is very bourbon-like at first taste. Low carbonation only ephasizes the whiskey like note and makes it an unique beer. Excellent beer!

Pours a hazy amber with a thin head. Huge aroma of honey with some mild spice. Tastes sweet with lots of clover honey, vanilla, toffee, caramel, and light spicy hops. 50 IBU of bitterness is totally balanced beneath the malty sweetness. Very good! Nice honey flavor comes through with sweetness and balance. Slight warming of alcohol, but the 9.8% is hidden well. Another fantastic beer from Founders!
good stuff again sweet as hell...very good sippy warming stuff........ ......
Draught. This is a really nice old ale with nice deep caramel flavours and good alcohol warmth.

33cl bottle served in a Prearis glass. Pours dark orange/light amber with an impressive bubbly off white head. Aroma is of butterscotch and oak with a hint of vanilla. Taste is a little too sweet but not cloying. Complemented the (Chimay) cheese I was eating at the time perfectly but I would suggest a little on the sweet side for enjoying by itself. An impressive array of flavours with the maltiness and barrel notes giving way to the flavours promised in the aroma. Very good but could be better.
Bottle. Cloudy, amber-brown. No head. Aroma is dried fruit, alcohol. Taste is sweet dried fruit up front. Hints of alcohol with a dry finish.

Smells great, rich, malty, dried red fruit, caramel, brown sugar and a hint of alcohol head in the nose. Dark golden color, relatively clear, with a quickly dissapating head. Tastes quite nice if a bit syrupy. Upfront sweet caramel notes, melds into a syrupy sweet malty middle and a deeply bitter leafy hop finish. Rich and flavorful but could use some more balance. Length quite long. Thick bodied and average carbonation.

Very malty beer. Doesn't taste super strong but has lots of flavor. Has a noticeable hop balance but malt dominates. Almost has a bit of a raisin taste. May just be the tap or bar I had it from but had very low carbonation that died super fast. That detracted from the beer, but if that was just a tap thing it would be better. Still a strong malty beer that wouldn't want much of. Slight thick palate too. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355ml bottle from Alesela, Glasgow - clear amber, very thin disappearing head, malty, caramel, alcohol aroma, no lacing, sweet viscous, malty, low carbonation, one to drink slowly and savour
Stonefruit and spice aromas, with bourbon tinged stonefruit and raisins. Oak is present up front, sensational beer that has renewed my faith in founders

355ml bottle. Pours an amber colour with a moderate densely packed, tan head. Excellent retention and good lace. Aroma of malt, caramel, raisins, oaky whisky. A lot going on in this one. A nice level of sweetness with some dry bitterness in the finish. Full body, soft carbonation, smooth yet sticky texture and soothing level of alcohol warmth. Grab a good novel, your smoking jacket and relax in comfy chair with this one.
This beer was strongly malt balanced. It was sweet and had tons of molasses. Very smooth and easy drinking considering the ABV. It was unique but not really something I would crave often.
Aroma of caramel, fruits (citrus, apple, raisins), wood, leather. Very sweet and bitter. Long aftertaste. Vad it fresh and it wad great but a little bit harsh.

Bottle share from a friend. Aroma has malt, dates and grapes. Pours clear amber with a small white head. Taste has some malts and is bittersweet with some fruit. Palate is medium thick and lingers in the mouth. Overall an okay beer. Nice body but you could wish for more taste.

Clear ruby red with small soapy tan head. Lots of dried stone fruits and booze in the aroma, with molasses and malts as well. The taste has a big boozy hit, with molasses, sweet malt backbone, a little sweetened grapefruit and a long hop bitterness in the finish. Heavy bodied with a peppery sensation on the tongue. Its somewhere between a barleywine, IPA and red ale. Quite good but could hide the booze a bit better.

Excellent beer. Aroma is very strong alcohol and malt. Alcohol in the flavor too, generally dry finish. Id rank this higher, but its so damn expensive--its good, but Im not sure its worth the price.

Clean copper color, small beige head. Sweet aroma of caramel, vanilla, whiskey, dried fruits, spices. Sweet bitter taste has similar notes. Medium body and soft carbonation, warming touch of alcohol. Complex and interesting ale.

Tasted from a 12oz. bottle. It poured a clear copper with a frothy off-white to light orange head. Aroma is sweet malt, spiced caramel, and alcohol. Smooth yet bold taste of malt, liquor, and caramel. This Curmudgeon packs a punch. A nice warming beer to enjoy on a cold winter night.

Clear copper brown, with a quickly vanishing head. Big aroma of burnt toffee, smoky wood and traces of umami and nut. Medium body. There is some fruity, orange peel barley wine like flavour in the background, sitting behind dark malts and strong caramel. Boozy finish. Powerful, complex, one to take seriously.

Mahogany with fast-fading, coarse, off-white head. Fades to placid surface. Aroma is sweet wood, french toast with maple syrup, bit of blueberry. Flavor is caramel, some medicinal aftertaste (rather light) resulting in a short, unique bitterness. Yummy. A neat old ale. Some wood, but not too much vanilla in there. Body is medium-heavy, light-medium carbonation, moderate sized bubbles, yet some burn, oily/lightly creamy mouth feel.

Draft at Bricks. Pours clear copper with very little head. Nose is caramel and some whiskey. Taste starts with some caramel sweetness and fades into whiskey. Kind of watery mouthfeel but you can taste all 9.8%.

Bottle. A month to go until BB runs out. A bit hazy copper body with a medium head. Aroma has whiskey and some vanilla. This is very nice. Taste has smooth whiskey with interesting malts. Finish is sugary and very smooth, and at times feels too light. However, the alcohol is not very well covered in this light finish. A bit more complex than the two Bastards I tried before but still lacks roast/bitterness and flavour intensity to support all the booze.

Bottle from Pothole in Tallinn ( 4,60 I think). Pours a beautiful translucent, somewhat cloudy, coppery orange with a small light beige head, leaving some lacing and sticking around the edge. Nose... beeeaaaautiful, makes me twitch in excitement. Its got a strong whiskey-like oaky and peaty character combined with "raw" caramel, but also more delicate sweet aspects like vanilla, and tart red berries, indistinct spicy hops and some warmth coming from the alcohol. I honestly would just like to sniff this the whole night and then not show up at work tomorrow. Taste... equally mesmerising... Sweet like some plum wine, dark dried fruits there definitely, caramel too, raisins, alcohol, but also grainy malts in the background. Good bitterness giving it an extra kick.

Body relatively light, palate smooth and slippery, maybe even too much so for 10% - makes it kinda dangerous I think. Carbonation modest. Finishes with intense resinous bitterness amplified by alcohol, and somewhat balanced out by its raisiny sweetness. 

I love such stuff. A bit less complex though than for example Ola Dubh 16, but still terribly enjoyable.
Very mellow and drinkable for the style and high alcohol. Amber pour. Notes of honey and maple.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Hazy amber colour with a small off-white head.
Aroma: Sweet malt, caramel, fruit, spices, alcohol.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, malt, fruit, spices, some alcohol.

Copper, small beige head. Nose is fruity, lots of caramel, malt, spice, hop tones. Flavor is malt, caramel, sweet-fruity hints, hoppy bitterness and alcohol notes in the finish. Lingering caramel and hop bitterness. Medium mouthfeel, slightly oily. Nice.

Very tasty, malty ale. Pours out a murky, orange copper color with spare head. Malty, musty, woody aroma, fall leaves and decay. Taste is some sweetish malt, a hint of alcohol, maple syrup, toffee, caramels. Very delicious and very easy to drink. Gone before you know it....

Sample at The Answer The Old Ale poured a clear golden brown color with smallish head. There is some limited lacing. You detect sweet caramel malts and citrus. Your flavors are similar to the aromas. Hop bitterness builds into the finish for a clean, tidy swallow. This is my first Old Ale. The very smooth ale was well-balanced which hides the 9.8 % ABV very well.

Pours a reddish brown, with a fine, foamy, white head that dissipate to film in 2-3 minutes. Nose is malt and caramel with some floral hop hints. Taste is mildly bitter. Full bodied richness; lively carbonation. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,355L bottle. Pours red copper with light tan head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is spices, clove, hops, caramel and alcohol. Flavor is sweet, spices, clove, malt, caramel, fruits, and wood. Finish is fruity-spicy dry bitter. Overall: very nice brew.

Bottled from Systembolaget 
Hazy deep golden/copper. Small, bubbly head. 
Sweetish aroma with tidbits and fudge. 
Sweet in flavour with salty liquorice and sweet, dried fruits.
Tap@ olutexpo 2014. Deep amber, thick white head. Chestnut, caramel, hops in aroma. Flavor has nuts, caramel, alcohol, fudge. Long finish. Dark fruity finish, slightly boozy finish. Great.

Full bodied, some whisky notes. Smooth clean, nice.-- bb

Bärnstens färgad med ett brun-orange skum. Doft: Kola, nötter, kanderat socker, malt, billiga dadlar, frukt soda. Smak: Frukt soda, kanderat socker, rostade mandlar, mörk kola, delikat malt smak, lite trä, alkohol. Stark 7:a.
This pours a deep brown color with a slight head. The aroma is slightly sweet. The taste is smooth and sweet. A must try.

Pours dark brown, small head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, some coffee. Sweet with quite high bitterness. A lot of oak. Overall a good beer but the oak becomes a bit overpowering after a while.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Birra particolare e spettacolare. Il colore è già una particolarità: color ruggine, manto di volpe, tendente allarancione. Schiuma fine, poco spessa e poco persistente, di color giallo/arancione molto chiaro. Nellaroma si percepiscono chiarissime note liquorose, barricate nonché di succo di melagrana e di frutti rossi, leggermente aciduli. In bocca è un capolavoro. Il liquore barricato è ciò che prevale: Porto, Grand Marnier, whiskey si sentono chiaramente. Il dolce del maltato è predominante, ma alla fine del sorso si avvertono anche leggere note amaricanti e un leggerissimo salato, che rendono la bevuta ancora più interessante. Può essere paragonata anche ad una Barley wine, per il suo carattere liquoroso e "stagionato", avendo però delle sue note peculiari.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle served in a snifter. 
A: Pours a magnificent clear amber color forming a small but medium bubbled light yellow head. Low retention and only few spotty lacings left in the glass
S: Impressive smell sherry and woody. Delicious. Very sweet and fruity as well. Strong notes of oak, bourbon, toffee and caramel malts. Strong English Old Ale character. Notes of grapes and raisins
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of oak, toffee, caramel malts, crystal malts, bourbon, grapes and dry raisins. Light hops bitterness as expected by the style
M: Heavy, creamy and molasses body. Low carbonation. Sweet malts and woody aftertaste
O: Good drinkability. Classic English Old Ale. Just another masterpiece brewed by Founders
[ BA Review @ 12/24/2013 ]

On tap at Rattle N Hum, New York, NY. A dark amber coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Sweet, malty, caramel, dark fruit aroma. Tastes similar, slightly sweet, malty, caramel, a little dark fruit, slight treacle. Nice one.

Bottle from Drinkstore [270914]
Copper red, good colour, clear, frothy white head
Aroma of caramel malts, soft sweet molasses, dab of toffee, sweet quite complex malts
Taste of rich caramel malts, soft sweet toffee, brown sugars, little hops, good malts in this
Palate - soft carb, full body, quite sweet. Finish of warming alcohol, smooth texture, brown malts, soft sweet caramel
Overall - Good warming malts in this, came across as a malty barley wine

Poured from bottle, dark amber with almost no head. Aroma is strong with distinctive notes of dark bread, honey, resin and herbs. Taste is a real explosion. Full bodied and well balanced, notes of dried fruit, honey, pine and dark bread. Slight bitterness leads a long and lingering finish. Real nice one!

Aroma of treacle, reminds me of my mum baking cakes when I was a kid; looks deep brown, hint of gold, clear; negligble head and looks flat; tastes smooth; nice tingle of carbonation; lots of sticky malts; hint of whiskyish saltiness; ok, but far from amazing and difficult to plough through - would be better served in nips.

Tap. Medium ivory head, thick lace. Cloudy deep amber. Intence bready aroma. Full bodied. Very rich, strong and well balanced, sweet malts, hints of whiskey and turf. Excellent.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Banana, toffie and alcohol in the aroma. Heavy and intense taste of alcohol, coffee and light chocolate. The aftertaste has a good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Not really my beer but definitely drinkable. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Tastes a bit like dirty bastard but not quite there. Not bad on its own but when you consider that you also have dirty bastard to contend with, it gets a slight downgrade. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark ruby colour. Rich alcoholic, malty aroma, dried fruits. Full body, reasonably thick. Sweet malt, caramel, fruitcake and almost a bit of chocolate leading to a medium bitter finish Exceptionally well balanced, very well disguised alcohol. One of the most easily drinkable and deceptive beers of its strength. A fantastic beer.

Bottle at home. Pours dark amber with orangey tan head, frothy. Aromas of caramel, molasses, vanilla, ripe fruits, oak, leather, rum, hint of bourbon. Very nice, complex brew. Taste is medium sweet and light-medium bitter, with warm alcohol coming through at the end. Nice medium-full body and lovely mouthfeel. I like this a lot.

12 oz. bottle over a year old. Deep dark ruby color without any head. Aroma is mild port wine, raisins, light tobacco and dates.
The flavor shows a array of dark fruit notes with caramelized sugar, mild dirty notes of English malts. Mild spice notes toward the finish with toasted grain. Light tones of rum soaked raisins with a light mild carbonation. Body is medium leading on the lighter side with a syrupy texture.

Bottled:Deep redish amber with a thick head.Aroma is quite sweet and has notes of toffee, raw onions, blue cheese and alcohol.Thick and sweet mouth feel.Sweet taste of caramel an toffee leading to an alcohol bitter finish.Should perhaps rest in a dark cellar for a year or two before consuming.

Transfer from BA review on 11-23-13-

 Served on tap in a snifter

 Appearance  The beer is served a clear deep golden amber color with a small thick looking white head. The head fades rather slowly leaving a decent level of streaky lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is of a sweet caramel and a decent level of a bready smell. Along with these aromas are some notes of darker fruits with some raisin and prune as well as some other sweet smells of toffee and molasses. Along with these smells are some oak and booze which combined with the rest to produce a sweet, warming and malty aroma overall. 

 Taste  The taste begins with a rather sweet and smooth taste. The taste is largest of a smooth bready and caramel flavor with hints of light roasted and dark fruits within. The roastiness get slightly stronger as the taste advances with the darker fruits of raisin and plum getting stronger as the taste advances as well. Some more boozy flavors start to work their way in more toward the middle of the taste with some nice molasses sweetness coming to the tongue as well. With the booze and the sweeter flavors that come to the tongue more toward the middle, and a little bit of an oaky, rum like flavor, that comes to the tongue at the end, one is left with a nice smooth and sweet warming flavor to be left on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel For a brew of almost 10 % abv it is very drinkable yet appropriate in style. The body of the beer is on the thicker side rather nicely accentuating all the sweet and malty flavors of the beer while the carbonation of the brew is on the lower side, which allows all the oaky, sweet, and malty flavors tons of time to linger on the tongue.

 Overall  A very enjoyable sweet and malty brew. Just what an old ale should be.

Pours a hazy amber into snifter. Aroma is full of toffee, orange peel, and molasses. The molasses is at the forefront in flavor. The oak also comes on strong which I like. This is initially sweet on the palate but is well balanced with a complex spiciness and slightly acidic. A vanilla richness lingers on the palate. This is a top shelf ale right here.

Amber red in color... Aroma of molasses, vanilla, toffee, oak... Flavor is caramel, toffee, molasses, coconut, vanilla... Oak on finish... Really good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2017 "this is close to nailing the style right on the head. wonderful complex malty sweet aroma. flavor and feel are very nice, but not quite up to par with the smell due to the alcohol presence. roasted malt, plum sweetness. good brew."

Poured a very clear dark amber color with a minimal head. Aroma of fruit and bourbon with some coconut and vanilla notes. Kind of smelled like a pina colada at first. Light tartness in the aroma. The flavor led to more coconut, bourbon and malt. Light alcohol with a nice warming sensation. It was more like drinking a coctail than a beer but it wasnt bad because of that. Medium to full bodied

Pours a decent bubbly head, with an amber, rubinred color.

Aromas of caramel malts with a lot of toffee and a small raisin infusion, while cane sugar and molasse build the foundation with hints of vanilla and rum on top.

Begins sweet, with bready hints, which get swallowed by even sweeter sugar and molasse. These stay in balance with wooden, leathery, heavy malts, wrapped up by a slick bitterness. Has an oily, spicy maltiness to it, with vanilla and cream underneath, which defines the character of this brew. It is still pretty sweet on the palate, but without loosing its balance, as it finishes with a gentle, hoppy bitterness of matured hops and oaky hints. The alcohol gets perfectly hidden by the sweet malts, creating a smooth mouthfeel with a slick finish, while being medium-bodied.
Bottle pour amber copper. Nose toffee, molasses, and slightly boozy. Taste similar to the nose, sweet malt, and some alcohol. Mid palate light bitter and hint of tannin. Finish revisits the toffee.

Complex rich beer with very good balance. Lots of alchol but yet balanced. Hints of aniseed and cinnamon howering over malt molasses and oak 
This is for you if you like big brooding beers.
Bärnstensfärgad med litet ljust skum. Doftar grönsaker och spritigt.. Smakar bättre med maltig dominans men väldigt söt och lite alkohol.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a light amber colour with white head. Aroma of caramel, hops and brown sugar. Favour is sweet, caramel, malts and dried fruits. Finish vanilla and bourbon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 7, 2016 A: Red copper coloured with a one finger white head. N: Paprika, burnt butter, molasses, chlorine T: Liqourice, grapefruit zest, molasses O: Quite sweet and bitter. Decent.

Rich, sweet, salty, Tobacco, molasses, dark fruit, rich and rewarding.
Copper colour, medium tan head, lacing.
Heavy sweetness, salty, mid-bitter, warming finish.
Fullbodied, soft carbonation, warming and salty finish.
Solid.

12 oz bottle. Pours opaque amber. Aroma of caramel, alfalfa, raisin, salty ocean breeze, molasses, wood. Flavor is caramel, molasses, raisin, bread, peat. Strong maltiness with a caramel/brown sugar sweetness.

An explosion of grape upon first taste. I prefer this flavor to the raisin that is commonly found in these types of beer. The fruit tastes more alive. Strong caramel nose with secondary licorice Boozuness is obvious and not recessed. Very sweet though with almost no bitterness. You can tell it s not a barley wine because the hop flavor doesnt really exist much here. I like that about it though. Malt purity

A well crafted and interesting beer. Dark fruits, vanilla, whiskey, maple syrup. Only complaint is that its overly sweet, almost sickly.. hence the lower score. You have to be a sweet tooth too really appreciate this one.

From 345 ml bottle. Pours a clear brick red with some orange highlights and a creamy off-white head. Aromas of soft fruit (fresh pear, apple), flowers, raisins and caramel. Taste is sweet malt and caramel at first before a light almost peppery bitterness creeps in. Some slightly hot alcohol emerges as well. Lingering fruity and spicy finish. Excellent example of the style.

355ml 2014 years vintage brown bottle, label has nice artwork of a curmudgeon, poured into a snifter glass. Appearance is clear burgundy colored with a small beige head that dissipated quickly, leaving no lacing. Aroma of raisins, apricot marmalade, toffee and vanilla. Flavours of raisins, apricot marmalade, vanilla, toffee, caramel and oak wood notes. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, slightly sticky texture and soft carbonation. Founders Curmudgeon Old Ale is an exceptional Old Ale, balanced and with a well masked alcohol without being too sweet.

Light amber colour, white head. Aroma of caramel, hops and brown sugar. Sweet flavour, caramel, malts and dried fruits. Finish vanilla and bourbon. Nice!
(from 355mL bottle @ RBBWG III, Gent 2014. Thanks for sharing, who-ever brought it!)

355ml bottle. Cellared for over a year. Pours visibly thick (complete with accompanying glug) with a cloudy rosy beige body, and almost no head. Smells great. Sultana raisins, caramel, dried apple, light buttery oak notes, and light butterscotch. Full bodied and sweet, with woody notes, a light floral note, noticeable medium bitterness, caramel, and raisin up front followed by some more pronounced metallic hopping, dried fruit, and lingering woody notes in the finish. Not picking up much in the way of molasses though. Very much comes across as a barley wine, and a good one at that. Well balanced with no one flavour taking over the spectrum. A repeat purchase for sure.

My first Old Ale and I think Im in love. I didnt know quite what to expect but I wasnt prepared for all of the sweet, malty goodness and boozy complexity. Im getting ahead of myself, though. The body is amber-brown and the head is impressive for such a high ABV. Aroma is malty rich, boozy, and has touches of oak - very much like a Barleywine, which makes sense. Flavor has dark fruits (raisin, plumb, black berries) and sweetness (brown sugar, molasses, vanilla, maple syrup, caramel). This is a delectable (yes, delectable - Im pulling out all the fancy words) ale. It was a privilege to bust my Old Ale cherry with this brew.
@ Havregatan. Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget (35:-). Sweet malty and caramely with a lot of bourbon, wood and dried fruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet and light spicy.

Bottle.

A- Perfume, marshmallow, roses, alcohol, vanilla, woody, caramel, sweet, malty.

A- Dark amber color, clear liquid, off white head.

T- Roses, slightly sweet, malty, roses, bourbon, rich.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, strong smooth finish.

O- Wow. That is all I can say. This very much resembles a barleywine. Very rich and complex and oh so delicious. There is an aroma and taste that I cant quite place a finger on but its a good feature. If all Old Ales are this good, I need more. Then again, its Founders and they seem to do things right.
0,33l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours clear amber with a low head. Aroma is malts, molasses and alcohol. Flavor is malts, alcohol, molasses, smoke and hops. Good.

Pours clear caramel with a low off white head. Aromas of caramel, raisins, figs, dates, toffee, ripe apples. Taste is caramel, figs, brandied apples, toffee, dates, slight smoked notes. Mouthfeel is quite thin with low carbonation.

Luktar både sött och salt. Även smaken har lite havsvatten i sig. Annars påminner det om tunn belgian strong Ale men med fyllig kropp. Det är tydligt fokus på malt. Lite överskattad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

@ Nedre Mölla 12/9-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Caramely, wood, sweet, notes of raisins. Taste: Caramely, sweet, wood. Body is light full, the finish is bitter and caramely with notes of wood.

Pours a redish brown body with a thin head. Faint malty aroma. Well balanced malty taste with tones of sugars and wood.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A Founders old ale stílusban készült főzete színében borostyán, illatában szivárványszínű. Az egyik kedvenc illatszerekezetem alapjaira épül, melyben megnyugtató egyveleget alkot egy bársonyos, marcipános édesség, kevés vanília pár csepp alkohollal, intenzív vajkaramella és egy árnyalatnyi tölgyfahordós aroma sejtelmes kombinációja; a felépítményt mindenesetre az illatos komló és telt maláta alkotta váz tartja egyben. Visszafogott szénsavtartalmú, selymes testében cseppet sem meglepően visszaköszön az előbbi kép, ízhatás tekintetében mintegy két részre osztva az élményt, melynek első felében a malátás krémesség csemegeszerű ízjegyeket produkáló, a sziruposság határát el nem érő jellegét csodálhatjuk meg, ezt követi aztán a karcos, de tartalommal teli utóíz, melyet a komló élesítő hatásának köszönhetünk. Voltaképpen ez esetben is felismerni véljük egy barley wine-anya és india pale ale-apa házasságának gyümölcsét személyében, a két stílust egyaránt kedvelőket tehát semmiképpen nem érheti csalódás fogyasztása során.

355 ml bottle. Clear amber with white head. Smell is sweet caramel malty with roasted tones and dark fruit and figs. Taste is sweet alcohol and fruit and dried fruit. Sweet with medium bitterness and low carbonation.
Bottle 33cl @ Kultainen Apina. Pours clear amber, small white head. Caramel, ripe fruits in the aroma. Plums, dark fruits, sweet malts in the flavor.
Bottle shared by pinkzambia Clear amber with just a brief trace of a white head. Rich carmely aroma of sweet maltiness. Rich and smooth, nearly barleywineish and a little ABV burn. Very nice
Great creamy head. Slight alcohol flavor. Some caramel notes. Not much hops.
Bottle from BarleyWine, CPH - dark amber coloured pour with a small white head. Fruity spicy malty aroma and taste, dark dried fruits, toffee and caramel, warming boozy finish.
Bottle: Clear light brown color with a small white. Sweet alcohol aroma of bourbon, leather. This is like whiskey not like beer. WOW. Cousin of barley wine indeed. Very tasty!!!!!!!
Solid oak taste,easy sipper with the malt background does let the the oak taste stay in the back of your mouth
(Bottle). Tart aroma and taste of fruit, butterscotch, marzipan, mushrooms and figs. Damn! This is not my kind of beer! Too much butter toffee !!

Bottle from SB cons 2014-09-05 Göteborg
AR: rasins, plum sauce, caramel fudge, almond liqure
AP: amber clear, stouthy ofwhite foam
F: almondy liqure, rasins, vanilla bourbon, plum sauce, rich carbonation , medium bitternees, warming feeling - great brew , please store me!

Flaska från systembolaget. Vätskan är bärnstensfärgad med beiget skum. Kraftfull doft av russin, smörkola och fat. Smaken inte riktigt lika kraftfull men mycket angenäm av ovannämda dofter. Trevlig beska och bitterhet som avrundas med den knäckiga fatkaraktären.

Half at craft beer festival. Pours dark amber with wispy off white head. Aroma is whiskey, oak, treacle, honey. Flavour is light whiskey, toffee treacle malts. Light carbonation with a really sweet wood aftertaste. Nice.

Bottle. Nose is rich molasses, brown sugar, marzipan, slight brandy. Taste is rich, vanilla, brandy butter, brown sugar, booze, leading to dry leather and oak, some dark chocolate and earth then an oily pine finish. MOuthfeel is slick. 

An outstanding beer that is maybe just a touch to bitter in the finish for my personal preference.

Bottle. Pours brown with thin white head that dissipates. Sweet cherry aroma over light carbonation. Sweet fruit flavors in the malt. A bit too boozy for my taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Deep amber, thin cream head and medium lacing. Incredibly complex aromas of molasses, cherry, marzipan, brown sugar, caramel, oak and a lick of alcohol. Malty front, followed by an oily/pine hop middle and finish with a long moderate bitterness. The oak was present but the alcohol dominated to the beers detriment

355 ml bottle shared with Calm_Dreamer and #Electron. Dark red to light brown color with a nice 2-finger off-white head. Aromas of red wine, vanilla and some oak. Taste of slight caramel, some dark fruits, red wine, vanilla, oak. Sweet aftertaste. Medium to full body with medium carbonation.

It pours amber with a tan head. It does produce a fair amount of lacing as the head disappears. It has a brown sugar aroma mixed with caramel and spices. It has a strong taste of molasses and brown sugar, with oak flavors that compliment the flavors well.
Delicious. Started off peculiar. Molasses was especially nice in the after taste.
Amber pour with a thin dirty white head. Caramel, vanilla, dank, woodne barrel, grass, booze, slight pine. Syrupy with soft carbonation. The booze is there but doesnt overpower.
Pours dark orange with a small head. Aroma is rich caramel, molasses and raisin. Taste has raisin to start with a strong woody molasses and alcohol finish.
Pours a dark brown color. Notes of molasses, licorice, dark chocolate, and earthy hops, Silky mouthfeel with a long finish.
Tap at Teurastamo, Helsinki. Colour is orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Dark fruits, raisins, sweetness and malts.
Pours a dark brown color with little to no head. Aroma is sweet and malty. The taste is sweet and thick with sugar. Lots of caramel and scotch ale type flavors. Decent.

Smell is old stale malt. bandaid, gooey, caramel. Pretty smooth given the ABV, but not my favorite smell at all and flavor either. Decent, and better than the dirty bastard but far from anything id have again. kind of fruity, caramelly flavored malt. I can see how some would like this.
Really nice, holding up even at the end of a night of great, and usually big beers. The malt is dominant and rich but not cloyingly sweet. The alcohol is warming, not burning.

Copper-ish color. Nice-sized head, average retention, and thin, inconsistent rings of lacing. Smells like whiskey, brandy, or rum - and chocolate, of all things, along with the accompanying molasses. Maybe some fruit and cake, too. Well, that sure is different. Taste: mega boozy malt bomb. Oak. Very tart! Nose burns after first taste. Second taste: similarly potent. Also noticing lots of acid. Says it has the sweetness of a barleywine, but its not that heavy-bodied despite everything else going on. Wow. Definitely not having an entire bottle of this tonight. A small pour is more than enough. Some neat things going on here, but its all rather over-the-top. Recommended, but with plenty of caution. My eyes are even watering.

Bottle. Pours a clear, but bright amber/orange with a thin, off white film head. Aroma is large. Sweetness, dark fruits, vanilla, caramel, and barrel notes. Taste is sweet but drinkable. Dark fruits, caramel, vanilla, and an alcohol warmth at the end. Not really an alcohol taste though. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Smooth texture in the mouth. Very slightly syrupy but not overly sweet with a semi dry finish. Overall very nice. Great sweet, dark fruit flavours blended with awesome barrel notes.

12 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a hazy golden brown, with a moderate khaki head which quickly fades into a disc on the surface, leaving good lacing. Nose is malt and dark fruit. Taste follows the nose, with a hint of hop bitterness on the finish. Very smooth, well-balanced old style alt. Hides the 9.8 % ABV well.
Pours clear light brown with a white head. Aroma is Aroma of dark fruits, roast, and molasses. Taste follows nose

Superior old ale that has a lot going on and stays just on the right side of sweet. Pours the colour of caramel with a solid plug of foam. Sweet and spicy on the nose - potentially too sweet for my taste but reserving judgement at this point. Chewy toffee dominates. Also sultanas, ginger powder and a winey note - Faugeres? First sip, and yep, this is sweet. Damn you, molasses. Soft, smooth palate - lovely. Flavour emphasis is very much on the malt. Restrained oak - tick. Come to think of it, the molasses is reasonably restrained, too - half a tick. Overall, quite a sophisticated flavour profile. Chewy toffee, dried fruit, light oak and brown sugar. A dessert ale but quite satisfying. (355ml bottle from Leura Cellars. BB17/6/14)

On tap at Founders. Oaky sweet, mild hop character. Dark coppery amber clear with thin lacing head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Starts sweet with alcohol. Bitter notes with big malty finish, light bitter undertones. Light bitter after.

Aroma is malty with a bit of the oak.
Taste is also malty with the oak apparent; the oak gives it some nice spice, vanilla or cedar? Sweet from the alcohol content.
Good and interesting, though not great.

Poured from a 2012 bottle so it's about 2 years old for me. Poured a deep murky amber with minimal head that dissipated quickly. It's not exactly inviting. Smells of booze, caramel, and a bit of butter. Tastes surprisingly smooth. A wonderful beer to sip slowly, savoring it.
355ml bottle. Pours dark orange with a small head. Aroma is rich caramel, molasses and raisin. Taste has raisin to start with a strong woody molasses and alcohol finish.

Craft old ale (though more an English-style barley wine to me) with thin, snow white, coarse, quickly opening head and murky copper colour. Very rich vinous and fruity aroma of pear, chocolate, rosewater, gingerbread, honey, mango, strawberry, amaretto, rosé wine, sage, white pepper. Fruity taste with some candi, bit earthy, fresh citrus notes, but also a lot of brandy-like alcohol that comes up quicker than expected, though nowhere becoming astringent; flat carbonation and therefore a bit thin body, even watery, unexpected in view of its strength, nutty maltiness, spicy finish with strong, citrussy American hoppiness and of course the warming alcohol. Complex and interesting, but not entirely flawless.

Bottle (2012, opened in 2014). Pours orange/amber with no real head. Aroma is honey, floral, blood orange. Taste is thick, gloopy with lingering sweetness. Again, lots of honey/sherry flavor here. I wouldve called this a barleywine in a blind taste. Perhaps some oxidation issues with this bottle. Malt is quite sweet but there is some balance.

Bottle, pours amber, minimal head. Sweet, rich, brown, alcohol warmth. The oak is subtle. Good mouthfeel from the carbonation. Drink just below room temperature. Deceptively easy to drink for a high alcohol beer. Reminded me of some high alcohol rich darker Belgian beers. Another very nice Founders brew.

355mL bottle BB 17/6/14
Good looking beer - deep teak body, some clarity, with small but dense beige head persisting.
Rich aroma packed full of dark earthy caramels, toasty oak, dried apricot & raisin, rummy boozy with undertones of aged mustiness you get in older beers.
Palate is thick & oily without being cloying, restrained carbonation, lingering long on the finish.
Oak comes through more on the body; toasty, slightly charred, notes of coconut & butter, with dark rum & bourbon complementing rich unctuous toffee & earthy dried fruits. What starts quite sweet & luscious finishes dry, warming & spicy.
A great example of an Old Ale - right on the money & delicious!
Hazy darkish amber pour with a tiny ring of lacing. Aroma of dark fruit and malt. Flavor is dark fruit, pine and caramel. Surprisingly dry and smooth. Nice.
Fantastic aroma and very nice looking beer. Nice head and a beautiful copper color. Finishes great. Another Founders classic.

Poured from the bottle into a dark foggy red color with a thin off white head. Has a dark fruit aroma black cherries and alcohol. A slight spiced syrup flavor towards the end. Heavy carbonation. Very drinkable for the abv on the higher end. An interesting beer overall. Also paired really well with my blackened catfish. Good stuff.

Poured from bottle into snifter, little to no head, clear deep ruby orange in color, boozy aroma. Definately tastes like most old/strong ales I've had with a smokey and sweet touch. Not bad, not chuggable, should come with a cigar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle.
Pours an almost clear deep amber, with a small off-white head.
Rich, complex aroma, caramel, malt, molasses, wood, vanilla, dried fruit, hops, fudge, candied sugar.
Off-dry, medium to full bodied, mid bitterness, creamy CO2.
Complex, balanced taste, caramel, vanilla, wood, candied sugar, nuts, fudge, hops, tannins.
Wonderfully balanced and complex. I wonder what a few years ageing will do to this beer? (2014-07-22)

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear copper pour with a foamy beige head, aroma has dark fruit and a hint of pine, taste has resinous pine, caramel, some spice, winter fruits, a hint of spirit. Grows as you drink it.

Rcvd in trade. 
This was poured into a snifter. 
The appearance was a nice hazy amber color with just a film of lacing that quickly died and left a bubbliness of sorts along the sides of the glass. 
The smell has a really nice oaky bourbon aroma letting in some light vanilla to entangle itself throughout. There was some light cherries at the end. 
The taste was sweet and had a touch of hot from the strength of the beer. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with not much of a sessionability about it. I sipped it for the most part. The carbonation was super smooth almost as if it wasnt there at all, but I could tell it was slightly there. 
Overall, I could be wrong but the last time I had something from Founders, I thought they would stamp the bottle with a born on date in green. There was no date to be found. Honestly, Im not too worried but think I may have gotten an older bottle due to the slight lack of strength of the booze and the subdued carbonation. If anything, this one aged was absolutely excellent and definitely welcome this again and see if I could get a fresh bottle just to compare.

Deep amber pour with no real head. Dark caramel, burnt brown sugar, dried fruit aromas. Sweet, caramel fudgey taste, toffee, vanilla, dried fruit, woody flavours. Not boozy, really well balanced. This was great, and even better as it warmed up slightly
UPDATED: AUG 11, 2014 Draft at Founders. Pours a dark amber. Aroma is caramel and brown sugar. Taste is similar to the nose and is quite creamy.

BOD 4/13/13. Pours a deep amber with a heavy deep dark ruby hue. Weak head and lacing due to the alcohol content. Heavy nose of dark malt (caramel), molasses and dark fruit sweetness over alcohol with bourbon and oak notes. Light carbonation. Almost full bodied with a nice smooth creamy texture. The complex flavor profile is well balanced. It begins with sweet dark fruit flavors (fig, plum and raisin) which flow into a significant bourbon element. As the bourbon fades, oak and vanilla present themselves over a molasses note. The finish is smooth and leaves you with a light alcohol burn and a touch of hops. This is the Olde Ale standard, IMHO.

BOD 4/13/12. Similar head, but hazy with flocculants. The nose is similar, but quite subdued. Bourbon is the most prevalent while the dark fruits have receded. Same body and carbonation. Like the nose, flavors have also gone downhill. Age has decomplexed the flavor profile. While still outstanding, it just doesnt reach out and grab you. Everything is there, but in a subdued fashion and more of a blended presentation rather than a progression on the palate. On its own, I would give the aged version a 4.1.

Bottle, 07/11/2014. Pours ruby brown, nearly clear with slight haze, light wispy head. Aroma is fruity malts, touch of cotton candy, caramel and with mild orange hop character, slightly grassy, mild wood finish. Taste caramel with piney hop middle. some roast adding to moderate bitterness, fruity undertones, some booze and vanilla, wood in the finish. Medium thick body. Nice.

Bottle bier huis ossett. Red colour no head. Aroma is caramel molasses vanilla some wood notes bourbon. Taste is same great malty backbone decent lingering bitter finish with alcohol warmth. Nice smooth body and mouthfeel. Really good old ale.
Orange- red color, small head died fast. Lots of molasses and alcohol in the nose. This is a good beer but a little hot for my liking. Im hoping this will benefit from a year or two in the cellar.

Pours a translucent rusty red brown with a soapy yellow tan head that settles slowly. A bit of wet, short-lived lacing. Aroma is earthy oak, malts, molasses and darkfruits. Taste is a nice balance of dank and musty oak, sweet molasses and vanilla and prunes and a bed of bitterness. Finishes with a warming swarm of alcohol. Super smooth. Best of its style that I've had. Yum.

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a very clear amber with only a very small sticky head. Nose is heavy sticky molasses, brown sugar, caramel and slight oak. Taste is much the same. Very thick and sticky. Toffee, caramel, oak and vanilla dominate. Slight heat from the alcohol rounds it out. Would probably benefit from ageing.

355l Bottle from Beers of Europe website:
Strong with lots of sweetness & sugar plus some treacle. Strong caramel malts & oak just about mask the alcohol completely, only a touch comes through. Toffee, dark fruits & earthy hops all make an appearance & the beer is quite complex. Rich smelling & rounded out with some background fruits & hints of vanilla.

Deep caramel amber with a thin, 0.5cm foamy head thats slightly off-white with okay retention given the abv. of the beer. It sits as a fine lacing just about covering the surface & theres some sediment at the bottom of the glass.

Sweet & malty with caramel & toffee coming through alongside sugar & some alcohol that seems a touch stronger than the nose hinted it at. Dark fruits & pleasant oak & vanilla come through with some plum & raisins at the end.

Smooth with a medium to thick body that hints at being creamy. Soft carbonation & hints of alcohol from the start. Very sweet, rich, complex & definitely strong but there is enough going on to help it down easier than expected.

A beer that I really enjoyed and one that Im glad I let sit for a while before opening up. Despite the strength of the beer it was one that went down pretty well with a great balance between flavours & I could see this being one that I would pick up again in future, assuming of course I can find it easily enough.

オールドエー  
甘くしたブラ&

Bottle from Bier Huis, Ossett. Clear, burnished copper colour. Minimal head. Gingery, syrupy, sweet malt. Orange spice. Taste is sweet, spicy, herby, toffee dry. Palate is sticky, slow moving, sweet creaminess. Big, long, spicy bitter finish. Huge. Sticky. Lovely.

Amber brown pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla and slight fruit. Taste of malts, caramel, toffee, prune, figs, vanilla and faint fruitiness and oakiness. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, nice beer.

Deep amber/red pour, slightly hazy with very little head. Lovely aromas to it, deep honey, caramel, and top-shelf booze. The flavor is all sweet malts and alcohol, pleasant but a little cloying. Very little hop presence, true to style but surprising from Founders. Thick, sticky and lightly carbonated mouthfeel typifies the style. All considered this is a decent sipping beer, seems like it would be great in a snifter by the fire.
Oaky woody malt forward. Bitter on bacj end and lots of malt. Not what I expected but another solid beer from founders
Brown pour, small tan head. Great aroma - prune, toffee, a bit of alcohol. Absolutely fantastic flavor. Oak, chocolate, prune, raisins, alcohol, figs, toffee. Smooth and chewy. Knock out of the park.
Bottle at home. Pours amber, nose of toffee, caramel, berries, taste is dry, rich caramel, fruity.
