Cerveza tipo barley Wine. Un sabor potente 9.8 abv pero ala vez muy equilibrada! Un descubrimiento. Muy recomendable.
malt raisins caramel, deep sweet taste smooth body, nice malty nose, awesome.
Dark copper with a light tan head. Strong, full, powerful. Deep malt with raisin and caramel. Long finish.

Barleywines must not be a style I enjoy any more, because I havent found a decent one in a while. Unfortunately, because I like Founders so much, this one joins the list. The beer poured a dark amber color with a small but cascading laced head. The flavors were extremely strong and extremely malty. There was also an abundant of sour and grassy hops. I found this beer way too malty and sweet.

I havent rated this!!!????

Fresh bottle which makes a huge difference as the result of an aging experiment. 

Boozy. Earthy. Molases sweetness. Like dates. Or raisins. 

Looks amazing. Pours like a red orange. Nice head. 

Taste is sweet. Some dates. Like earthy. Almost like a tartness. Like a good barley wine. (Unlike a bwine this does not get better with age) its got booziness but its smooth. Yeah man. 

Palate is smooth. I mean its perfect. Full bodied but still sort of lighter. I mean... And this is why I love founders.... This huge beer is a favorite of my newbie craft beer lover who only likes light beer. (Ironically same with devil dancer)


This is one of my favorite beers. Its a big beer that you can drink on a weeknight. Super potent and flavorful but easygoing enough. The beer by which other old ales are judged. 


As noted: drink fresh otherwise this beer is gross.

35cl bottle. Amber orange, thin white head. Caramel heavy aroma, with berries, figs, and sweet shortcake, touch of oakiness. Lovely deep caramel in the taste, lots of red berry, shortcake malt, light pine, some light vanilla, spices. Long berry, caramel and light pine finish. Medium/full body. Slight booziness. A lovely fireside beer, more good (and amazingly well-priced) gear from Founders.
Slight caramel aroma in a medium brown cloudy ale. Very malty like a barleywine but not nearly as smooth. Strong flavor but a bitter finish.

Pours a medium amber brown with a short tan head. It has a great malty, woody aroma and a flavor of rich malt and oak with a slightly hoppy backbone and rich finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle into a tulip glass. Pour is a dark honey amber. Aroma is strong, with the oak and rich malts. Taste is very strong with a nice sweetness over the crisp Oaks and thick malts. Finish is very full bodied. This is a world class ale.
Nice mahogany-amber pour. Sweet aroma of caramel and some nuts. Flavour is malt, toffee, vanilla and some light fruits.

330 ml bottle from Redmonds. Toffee coloured pour, clear, foamy off white head, doesnt last, settles to a residue. Toffee, butterscotch, caramel, oak, brandy in the aroma - extraordinary! Flavour is more of the same, sweet, luscious caramel, toffee notes, some alcohol warmth. Thick, lush mouthfeel. Very low carbonation, long complex finish. Wow.

Aroma: Caramel and nuts with hints of fresh bread.
Appearance: Dark amber with tan head that dissipates quickly.
Taste: Light sweetness balance by a light sourness.
Palate: Full body, creamy sticky texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: A bit too malty for my taste, but still a really well developed beer. Quite nicely done.

dark copper pour, small tan head. Molasses, caramel, and alcohol in the nose. Sweet. Middle is full bodied with a solid mouth-feel. Finish is more fresh caramel, with a hint of wood, and finally some drying hop bitterness. Went really nice with a lamb hot pot!

12oz bottle. Pours a reddish clear color with a small off-white head. The aroma is quite interesting, its very smelly with gingerbread and other spicy notes. Taste is very good, matches aroma. Lots of complexity, alcohol is insidious. Resinous mouthfeel. Not my favorite, its borderline skunky, but interesting enough to keep me coming back for another!
bottle shared with pal nams josh haks drive at club w, dark potent, but smooth, I like it

From a bottle at a dinner party. Founders really can do no wrong for me.
Pours a reddish brown with a small white dissipating head. Nose is super malty, caramel, sweet, molasses. Taste is really smooth- the 10% alcohol is hidden well- although it is there in the finish if you pay attention. Taste is tons of malts- although it is not overly sweet- with earthiness, pine, vanilla, bourbon, and citrus coming to the party. Subtle and smooth. Kind of makes one wish for the local watering hole in a sea faring port on a cold stormy night.

Nice looking mahogany-amber beer with a thin foamy off white head that lasts a short while before settling into a thin surface film. Rich nose of toffee, stewed stone fruit, and sweet vanilla. Flavor is a bit sweet, but not overly so, with flavors of caramel apple, molasses, dried fruit, and light oak. This is then counterbalanced by a touch of bitterness that leaves a pleasing aftertaste. It hides its alcohol well. Quite enjoyable

No to mamy niezłą zielarnię. W aromacie przeważa melasa, jest anyż, jest spora słodycz, sporo innych, niezidentyfikowanych nut. W smaku gęste, wręcz lepkie, doskonale zamaskowany alkohol. Jest melasa, piołun, spora słodycz przypominająca marmoladę, wyraźny karmel, gdzieś w tle nuty owocowe. Świetna kompozycja, choć ziołowo - chmielowy finisz ciut za długi.
Very rich and sweet with a smooth velvety texture and honey aroma. Pours a dark amber with a small head. Tastes like a barley wine to me, good but can get overwhelming after a few ounces.

Pours light brown, very minimal white head, has the ale look, citrus smell, the taste is sweet, hoppy, citrus . Its a cross between a Scottish ale and a Baleywine. I have been looking forward to this, not disappointed.

Pours an amber-brown with a thin white head. Smells of chocolate and caramel are strong at the nose. Has a medium-thick body, medium bitterness, and a pleasant chocolatety aftertaste. Definitely would recommend, but is on the stronger side.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Hotel glass
From: Whole Foods in Tempe, Ariz.
Price: $2.59
Purchased: May 15, 2014
Consumed: May 16, 2014
Misc.: N/A

Poured a caramel, amber clear color with about one finger of bubbly, off-white head. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom. Average foamy layered lacing along the sides of the glass. Below average-to-poor retention on the top of the glass.

Had to work for the smell, but got apple juice, dark apple, green grapes, fruity aromas, floral notes and some sugary honey.

Tasted much, much better than the smell and a lot different. Got oak, molasses, vanilla, dark apple, fruity notes, light butterscotch, booziness and still some sweet honey.

Medium body. Oily-to-thin texture. Soft carbonation. Long, boozier finish.

This beer was just OK. I was hoping for more, but it was missing something. Cant quite put my finger on what.

Thanks Malster85 for this extra! Wonderful stuff. Pours a gorgeous honey color with white head. Sweet and malty aromas... Honey and vanilla too. Fairly soft palate.. Sweet bready flavors that finishes boozy. Excellent. Very drinkable.
Dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringe Schaumkrone. Geruch süß malzig, fruchtig, holzig, leicht alkoholisch, genauso ist auch der Geschmack.

Dont you just love it when you drink a beer not expecting to like it, but walk away with a new favorite? I. Loved. This. Beer. Big caramel, molasses, and dark fruit up front, giving way to slight bourbon, oak, pine, a touch of vanilla, pine and earthy hop spice. Super subtle alcohol burn and citrus rind on the finish.

Fruit. Sweet. Malty. Pours a dark orange amber with a thick slowly fading off white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Thick full mouthfeel. Very smooth. Clean. Sweet. Molasses. Earthy. Oaky. Slight bitterness on the finish with the slightest lingering warmth. Very nice.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. It pours medium copper to dark amber with a modest off-white head and a slight cloudy appearance. The aroma is subtle all around but the malts tend to be the main ingredient with a slight alcohol buzz. Molasses sweetness. Oak. The body is medium to full and fairly smooth. The taste is where it all happens with those sweet molasses fired malts expressing themselves exponentially and a slight alcohol burn but nothing offensive. Mildly bitter. A fine drinking experience.

Bottle; poured an amber color with a whitish head. Aroma of booze, caramel, molasses, booze and cookies. Flavor was not as robust, but good. Cookies and molasses, some booze; a bit dry, could use some sweetness for balance. A bit of earthiness in the finish.

12oz bottle - pours a reddish copper . Raisin fig and oak aromas . Taste is molasses , toffee and a touch of alcohol . Ages very well . Delicious . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gold -Copper with orange sparks.
Woody with a nice mouthfeel (not cloying)..Very SWEET (seems Rum)
Very good beer.

Old Ale is not a style that you tend to see many of around Founders has put together an offering that showcases the sweetness and caramel feel of this molasses forward beer. This is oak aged, which adds a woodsiness and underpins the heavy malt feel here.
12oz bottle, appearance is deep amber with thin khaki head, smell of clove and caramel, taste of sweet molasses with slight bitterness and alcohol warmth.

12 oz bottle. Tasted on 5/1/14. Beer from Beertopia Omaha, NE. Beer pours to a deep amber/red color with a small off white head. The aroma has a sweet, caramel, biscuits & some earthy notes. The taste has a sweetness followed by cloves & a earthy note. Not my favorite style of beer but very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an orange copper reddish color with a khaki head. Aroma of malt, sweet notes, bready notes, vanilla notes, Palate has not a lot of carbonation and is sweet caramel bready notes with vanilla and molasses. Good but its a bit thin for what it is, IMO.

Squat US 12oz bottle. Great label featuring an old chap who appears to be constipated and without hygienic paper products. Not sure what hes sitting on. Clear, orange-bronze beer, respectable tea-stained head. Malty aroma, pleasantly floral-toasty-woody, date/raisin/prune fruitiness... almost suggests a spiced ale of some sort. Woody bitter, sweetish as it warms, as with the aroma, the flavor profile suggests that it would be a suitable backbone for *ahem* pumpkin beer or winter warmers. An implied allspice, and some faint mashed banana(? - weird) tones. Definite vanilla tones. Mouthy body, the alcohol-spice bitterness grows and starts to cling - which is really its only flaw. Warming. ABV was masked well, but I could definitely see this base with barrel aging. Market Square Liquors.
Very sweet smell. Molasses lead malty and biscuit finish. Pretty good mellow. Doesnt drink as strong as one would expect a 9% to drink

12 ounce bottle poured into a Belgian snifter. Golden orange/amber color with just under a finger of off-white head. Big raisins and dark fruit on the aroma along with toffee, caramel, candied fruit, brown sugar. Tasting notes of dark fruit, raisins, caramel, toffee, bitter pine, light oak, molasses. Medium body with a dry finish. Syrupy mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Pretty smooth for the ABV.

Unique aroma. I think someone else said "toasty apple", which is a good description of the unique character in the aroma.

Color is a dark amber / copper. I had thought an old ale should be slightly darker, and I think a little darker color would add to this by adding a sort of old, woody, seafarer sense to the beer.

Oak, molasses, and malt blend well. Its nice to get a unique flavor that can be a little subtle.

Good beer all around, and nice to have as a change of pace, but if I were looking for the malty, caramel-ly flavor in this beer, Id probably go for a Dirty Bastard.

They obviously brew way better than I do, but if I made this as an old ale and tasted it, Id think that I needed to darken in a little and raise the oak and molasses flavors slightly.
Clean copper appearance with low carbonation. Smells like sweet smokey apples. Thin palate with bitter boozy taste. Another fantastic beer from Founders!

Bottle into snifter glass, hazy coppery-amber color with off-white head. Aroma of rich heavy malt, caramel, brown sugar, cocoa, oak and vanilla. This to me seriously smells like the beer version of Woodford Reserve bourbon. Taste is as malt intense as the aroma adding notes of dark dried fruits (raisins mainly, some fig), cookie dough, bready, molasses with faint earthy hop bitterness. Heavy body, low carbonation, soft, slick with sweet boozy finish. Pretty intense old ale, a pleasant malt bomb.

Appearance: pours with a huge light tan head that settles into a very high density, the beer is very clear and a nice bare color, nice head retention 
Aroma: amber malt, some nuttiness, pretty faint under that head
Taste: light malt sweetness, has an alcohol warmth to it, bread, some spice, caramel, hints of grain
Palate: soft carbonation, very heavy and thick mouthfeel, alcohol on the aftertaste
Overall: you know this is a serious beer when you drink it, hides the very high abv pretty well, pretty unique beer

Bottle. Love the sweet to oakey flavor. Beautiful cloudy amber color with a sweet oak smell. Great old ale thats got a smooth and creamy feel. Another Founders brew thats incredibly smooth for a high ABV offering.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Tap from Lazy Dog shared by jheath99. Aroma of flora and hops. Taste of hops and malt with a citrus flavor. Tangy aftertaste. Medium-bodied.
This is definitely a great beer as you would except from founders, but Its no backwards bastard.

From bottle. Pours a clear copper orange color with a small yellow-tinted head. Almost no lacing. Aroma is caramel and dark sugars. Taste is sweet and malty, with dark sugars. Very smooth. The alcohol is hidden well. Medium mouthfeel and a sweet finish with a hint of bitterness. A very nice old ale.

Founders Crumudgeon Old Ale has a thin, cream-colored head, a clear, brilliant, apricot-orange appearance, some bubble streams, no sediment, and very sparse, spider web lacing left behind. The aroma is of rich, sweet, malt, vanilla/oak, and light rum. Taste is all that, with some good, balancing bitterness and apparent wood. Mouthfeel is rather light and watery, and Founders Curmudgeon Old Ale finishes alcohilic, sweet, and contemplative. The worst one could say about this beer is that it is delicious. RJT

A - 4.25 - giant white fluffy head on this guy, kind of a copper, orange, brass but very clear color. Light for an old ale. 
S - 4.5 - Lots of sweet malt, dark fruits, caramel, oak barrels, chocolate, cookies
 T - 4.75 - oak, caramel, toffee, vanilla, cream, figs/raisins/dark fruits, lots of malt, mostly dark and breast, very complex, sweet booziness. 
M - 4.75 - pretty heavy. Alc is present but appropriate, aftertaste is breast malt, bitter, and dark fruits
 O - 4.75 - super intense beer. Took 2 to even comprehend the flavor. Id love to see what old curmudgeon s better half tastes like!

Aroma- Brown sugar,malt,oak,fruity
Appearance- hazy amber, very little head
Flavor- rich malty caramel, nice bitter bite,slight smoky oak.
Draft - Spices, orange and fruity esters. Cloudy copper with a thin beige head. Floral, orange and a bit of boozy sweetness. Different and nice.

Pours a clear copper with a hint of ruby when backlit. Head dissipates quickly to a ring of bubbles along the glass. The aroma is booze, banana bread, and allspice. Flavor is complex - malt, oak, vanilla, with the molasses masquerading as toffee. I am reminded of a bourbon-soaked banana-nut bread, if there is such a thing. This is recently bottled, and will definitely come into its own with aging.
2014 Vintage

Sugary aroma. Slightly cloudy red pour. Single finger head. Thin mouth. Taste is full of caramel and alcohol. Sugar and candy dominate here. Very sweet. Lots of alcohol burn. Hints of vanilla. I wasnt crazy about this.
Yum. Murky brown pour thin tan head and big molasses caramel aroma, sweet. Molasses caramel dark fruit hints of toffee? Some maple. Medium body light carbonation. Very nice.

I believe this is my first Old Ale. Drinking out of a DFH signature glass. Pours a light amber with a small head and lots of bubbles clinging to the side of the glass and rising. Slight sweetish aroma that Im not going to pretend to tell you what it is. Taste has a bite, must be the alcohol content. Cant put a finger on the flavor other than alcohol, if bittersweet is a flavor than thats what Ill call it (that does not mean I dislike it). For me it is a different style than Im use to and I dont know how many more Old Ales Ill run into but I think there are other styles I prefer tasting over this. Founders is one of my favorite brewers and Im glad to have the chance to taste this ale.

The aroma is hard to place - sort of like a scotch ale with its maltiness, but a little more spicy. Pours a great amber color with a surprisingly large off white head that takes a while to dissipate. The taste is malty but not sweet, instead bitter with some boozy undertones. Very drinkable for 9.8% ABV. Call me crazy, but I found it to taste like an imperial IPA crossed with a coffee stout. I dont always like oak aging, but it really comes across nicely in this one, enhancing the aftertaste considerably. The palate was slick with a bitter and slightly oaky finish that lasts until your next sip. I was reluctant to try this because it says it is similar to a barleywine, which I am not a fan of. The barleywine characteristics in this one are slight, and overall its a must try. Founders, you have impressed me once again.

What an amazing beer, pours dark amber with an off white head that persists through, smells of loads of caramel and sweetness in general, taste of vanilla, molasses and some caramel sweetness, the back is brought up with some alcohol to balance,

Bottled 2/06/14 and poured 4/15/14. $3.49 a single.

Appearance: Pours a "quiet" red/orange color with a nice off-white head and lacing at the start.

Smell: Wow. Dark fruits, barrel, molasses sweetness, oak... just as I expected from the label and style. Theres also a slight hint of booze as well.

Taste/feel: Just looking at it in the glass, it looks sweet. Thats probably just because I know theres molasses in it though. This beer is sweetsweetsweet, which you should figure if you know the style, see that this beer is brewed with molasses, or see that the IBUs are "only" 50 IBUs. Molasses, candied dark fruits, oak, rich and heavy caramel malts with a bit of a toasted malt aftertaste with an underlying subtle bitterness to keep it from being sickly sweet. Just looking at it in the glass should give you an idea of how it feels. Very mild carbonation with a pretty full body. Some would call it "flat", but its a mild carbonation that Im liking for this beer. Also, the body is big, but its not to the point where its syrupy/cloying. Then again, the nice depth of flavor also helps that. Dont get me wrong, it IS a very sweet beer, but its not a chore to drink by any means. 9.8% is hidden perfectly as well.

Overall, an incredibly tasty choice for those who dig a big, bold, malty, sweet beer. It may not be something that Id personally drink very often (Im already a "ticker" as it is...), but there is absolutely no denying that this is a phenomenal beer that warrants a try to any beer aficionado. I may go buy myself another single just to see how this thing ages. It is sweet as hell, but it is equally as tasty.
Bottle @ home. Amber colour, beige foam. Complex fruity aroma with notes of stone fruit (plums, apricot), caramel, brown sugar and spices. Sweet with light bitter finish.

Hearty aroma of molasses, brown sugar and hints of cask aging. Orange with medium hazing. Very sweet flavor, recalls spiced rum at first and bourbon on finish. This isnt too profound though, just enough of a hint. Smooth and a rather easy drink - not to infer t is light though. Another winner for Founders.

Bottle to pint glass. A-malty, sweet. M-close to a Barleywine in profile. Nice old ale. F-sweetness and a thick coating. Really good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beer Swap Saturday, thanks boss! Pours orange amber with a scant white head. Aroma has caramel malt, red fruits, cinnamon, clove. Flavor is warm and cinnamon/nutmeg spicy with a caramel molasses backbone thats not too cloying. Nice.
Caramel, oak, molasses, cider and golden raisin flavors. Strong alcohol bite at the finish. Hints of cinnamon and spice. Good feel. Not fond of the boozy flavor but still good.

4 pack bottles from Proof. Deep copper pour with thin dirty white head that leaves a ring. Aroma is caramel, apricot, sugar. Tastes are caramel, molasses, vanilla, plum, leather, oak. Lots happening. Even and hides alcohol well - just a background warmth. Drinks a little easier than it should, though still a sipper.

Bottle. Pours deep red, dark cherry wood - no head - looks amazing. Aroma is sweet malty syrup, and oak (probably molasses but I cant say I directly know what they smell like). The taste follows suit and adds dark fruit (raisin, plum, fig notes) butter scotch, maple syrup, and booze. Very complex flavors. The mouthfeel is very rich, creamy, and heavy with very low carb. Overall excellent
Pours reddish brown. Like an Irish red. Very little head. Aroma is nondistinct. Sweet fruit with slight hoppy and alcohol finish.

Pours dark mahogany/ reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma of rich malt, oak, sweet, toast, and a hint of alcohol. Flavors are molasses, oak, yeast, very rich malts, slight burn, some bitterness. Smooth full body. Extremely tasty beer.
Bottle. Caramel colored thin white head. Sweet malty caramel. Booze. Light smooth finish.
Pours caramel colored. Great taste of the molasses powers through, very rich and silky to drink. Great beer to enjoy in slow sessions.

Malt bomb! The smell is malts, caramel, molasses, and a little nuttiness. Taste is amazing. Tastes of maple, caramel, raisins, malts, oak, and no taste of alcohol, but does give a nice warming sensation going down. Another amazing offering from Founders.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The Old Curmudgeon pours a clear ruby red color with a small beige head that doesnt last long. The aroma is raisin, caramel and earthy. The flavor is earthy, raisin and caramel. Overall this is a nice brew.

Poured from a bottle into a Founders Brewing Co. snifter clear caramel.
Aroma is sweet-so sweet with some booze reminds me of maple syrup.
Flavor reminds me of a strong barleywine with more malt. Rich & thick. So nice and well done. Each year I look forward to this brew & each year I am happy to consume. Satisfied.

Big sugary aroma with slight alcohol. Caramel malty taste with a lingering hop bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle. Pours a thick, cloudy dark orange, tiny off white head, sweet aroma of molasses, strong warm oak barrel flavours and a sharp alcohol punch. Its not a beer to be slammed down fast, but prefect to savour.

Bottle from Maltitude. Poured into a glass, appearance is dark amber with little brown head. Aroma is sweet blend of malts, with notes of caramel, maple syrup and brown sugar. Smells nice. Taste is very malty, again caramel malts, hints of molasses or maple syrup, some roasty / toasted notes as well. Slight bitterness, but not a huge hop profile detectable. Easy to drink. High ABV is not noticeable. Palate has low carbonation, robust mouthfeel. Not bad, a little too sweet for my taste.
Good beer as is expected from founders. Nothing to be said that hasnt already been said... sorry.

12 oz bottle purchased at Johns Grocery ($4.49) and poured into a snifter at home. Brown appearance with a small tan head and light lacing. Aroma of caramel, molasses, dark malts, chocolate, earthy hops, oak, dark fruit, toffee and licorice. Similar flavor, rich and malty with medium sweetness and minimal to light bitterness. Full body, slick and smooth with soft carbonation. Pretty complex, a great sipper.
Golden in color and a bit hazy with a thin head. First sip bites with a 9.8 APV. Smoothes out after a while. Fruity but slight bitterness. Bourbon overtones. Definitely a sipping beer.
Amber brown in color with a thin head. Pour is slightly thick and mouthfeel medium. Caramel, molasses, oak. Delicious.
Poured a really pretty garnet colour with a whispy head. Malty nose. Boozy in the mouth but, not super hot.

Clear, dark amber. Small white head. Sweet malt aroma. Taste is malty, with wood and tobacco, well rounded. Malt and sweetness well balanced by the bitterness. Low carb, long finish, bitter and perhaps lightly sour.
Heavily malty and boozy ale. Particularly sweet with dark sugars. Very delicious.
Bottle from SJ. This brew had some complexities to it, but it was blended well. Nice notes of wood, caramel, sweet malt and hop. Definetely had some booze undertones to it.
coffee, banana, smoke, amber, minimal head, tan foam, light sweetness, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

A mid amber orange coloured beer with a weak white head. A syrupy malt aroma, caramel, and a vinous, Port-like sweetness. A full-bodied mouthfeel. A huge, malt taste, vinous and raisiny, plus caramel and toffee. The alcohol makes an appearance, that tempers the sweetness with a refreshing sourness. The sweetness takes over again in the finish.

Appearance: Hazy copper/ruby with short lived thin ivory head.
Aroma: Pine, syrup, treacle, fig.
Taste: Medium sweet, low bitter and sourness.
Palate: Thick smooth texture, light body, low/average carbonation, butterscotch, vanilla, treacle, fig finish with an alcohol warmth.
Comments: Very tasty.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. All hail the cumdungeon. Clear amber pour with a slightly sticky beige head. Nose is full of coconut, deep molasses and caramel. Seems very oaky with plenty of silly sweet vanilla. Taste is sticky toffee, honeycomb, molasses, vanilla and light coconut. Plenty going on. Fair kick of heat to finish with. Quite sticky sweet. Very solid

Pours dark copper with a large off-white head.
Nose shows vanilla oak notes, sweet rich molasses, chocolate malt, hazelnut and sweet caramel.
Similar woody and vanilla oak characters as flavours alongside some light roasted malt, booze and heaps of sweet syrupy malt.
Nice moderate carbonation and syrupy body.
Has a pretty good aroma that sweet and full of molasses. Taste is similar and malty.
Pours cloudy amber with off white head. Smells of caramel and sweets. Tastes sweet, alcohol, light bitter, and light sour. Has a thick mouth feel with light carbonation.

Bottle, 2012 vintage, poured into mini snifters. Aroma is completely oak forward, with some toasty character, deep earth, some malted sweetness, woody, slight oxidized note. Pours a reddish brown with some clarity and small amount of bubbles concentrating to the middle of the glass. After a big the bubbles disappear, leaving a still looking beverage. Taste is up front oak, with some molasses, dates, must, light caramel, some paper, and lots of alcohol spice, tannic. After taste is mostly a boozy burn. Body is thin with soft carbonation. Overall I think this may be a bit oxidized and too boozy for my palate. The oak character is nice at first but it dries out the tongue and leaves too much of a tannic bite.
Bottle aged a year - Aroma is boozy cherries. Pleasant amber hue with minimal head. Flavors of red fruit, mild sweet caramels and a faint hop backbone. Mild carbonation. Really great stuff

12 oz bottle from 2013 release. The pour is a nice deep copper, with an off-white head and a spotty lace down the side of the glass. The aroma is quite complex. There is a bit malt character throughout it. I like the toffee and molasses and how they provide a great sweetness throughout the nose. There is a subtle smokiness and some light oak on the back end. The flavor is just as complex. There is again, that big malt note on the front end. The molasses offers a great thickness and sweet flavor. The toffee fades through a little bit of an oak before the little bit of an alcohol burn sets in. The mouth feel is a touch thin, but the aftertaste is great. Not the best old ale out there, but it's a good one 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours really smooth with a dark amber hue and little head. Floral aromas and deep malt up front. The taste is sweet with a little hop zing in the beginning and the oak really shines lightly, but in a good way in the end. Good stuff.

bottle. A ton of sticky sweet malt in the nose with some wood and light fruit notes. slightly cherry. Flavor is strong malt and slightly salty. A full mouthfeel but not cloying. a slight astringency and drying sensation from the wood. helps to add complexity and balance to the beer. pretty solid and drinkable. no sign of the nearly 10% abv.

12 oz bottle with a bottled on date of Jan. 2013. 
Pours murky orange-brown with a small, weak head. 
Aroma: sweet and boozy with a clear trace of oak.
Flavor: Mildly sweet; pretty good until the finish and aftertaste, then notably better. 
Feel: medium-full body; slightly harsh (ABV); warming.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2014 Tap: Dense copper color with a small, off-white head that fades quite quickly, though the collar thats left still leaves behind nice splotches of lace. Aroma is a little more basic & plain that I was first expecting... Toasted maltiness, light caramel, toffee, & a big sweetness throughout. Somehow the molasses & oak are lost on me. The taste, fortunately, delivers a little more. Big malty base; toffee, caramel, very light molasses with a warm & toasted breadiness all around. Heavy oak on the back of the tongue with appreciable alcohol heat. Mid-palate shows some sweet & faintly tart fruits; apple, grape, & ripe raisins. I get some subtle cinnamon-like spiciness with a bit of bitter, floral hops in the finish. A nice beer, though perhaps a little bland for what my expectations were.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2015 355ml bottle @ home. Bottled 041312.
App: Clear, but with minor particles, redish amber with a fluffy yellowed head. Nice lacings.
Aroma: Sweet sticky caramel, spun sugar, old leather, dried fruit, some kind of berry jam, chocolate, oak and some vanilla.
Taste: Same sugary caramel sweetness with dried apricot, litchi, grapefruit and some figs. Chocolate, soft vanilla and leather notes and a smooth woody finish with some licorice root in the after taste. 
Palate: Medium to big body with soft carbonation and oily silky texture.
Overall: Very soft and drinkable. Sweet but not cloying. The barrel aging is delicate. I found it a bit tame. Maybe it should have been either older or younger. I was missing some bitterness. Edit 2015-10-17: Felt more of a chocolate character to it this time.
Draft to glass at the Vintner. Beautiful transparent pour with a nice red hue. Mild head with great lacing. Smells like a dry barelywine. Tastes of yeast, dates, and molasses.

Really enjoyed this. Pours a murky amber with a good but smallish beige head. Rich aromas of vanilla, bourbon, malts, caramel. Complex. Taste is superb with sweetness perfectly balanced by the bitterness. Very smooth. Full body. Excellent.
Bottle. Pours murky amber with almost no head. Aroma is figs, raisins, caramel. Taste is sweet caramel,

Bottled 26 April, 2012; drank 27 January, 2014. I have never seen a beer with this much spent yeast in it. (If its this old, pour it slowly and let the sediment sit in the bottle. (Its not bad for you, just kind of unsightly.) The color is a murky red-brown. 

Aroma is 100% soupy, taffy malt. 

The taste is nutty chocolate, mocha and a dusty molasses. The malt is sugary. Earthy basement flavors bring up the rear.

Its halfway between a barleywine and a chocolate stout. Best sipped slowly, at room temp, from a snifter. Considering its a Founders, there is a distinct lack of hops. Its intense, and gives a quick buzz, but its not their most complex or their best.

Really enjoyed this one. Pours reddish copper color with little to no had. Sweet biscuit, malt aroma. Heavy molasses, toffee, vanilla taste. Very sweet but not cloying. Full bodied little carbonation. No real bitterness. Dry finish. Really liked this.

12oz bottle. The pour was a murky caramel brown with a slight reddish hue and an average (1-2 fingers) off white creamy head that was mostly lasting, reducing to a puddled film and medium collar with excellent sheets of sticky lacing.

The aroma was of a toasted biscuit malt and a sweet doughy yeast with notes of caramel, toffee, molasses, vanilla, dark fruit (raisons & cherries), oak cask and a little above mild scent of alcohol.

The taste was malty sweet with a decent touch of caramel and toffee early on, and then progressed with a mild yeast presence, a touch of molasses, a light fruitiness, a hint of oak with a sweet alcohol finish. The flavor lasted an average duration after the swallow, with the malty sweetness and a slight alcohol warming left to linger on the taste buds a bit longer.

Mouthfeel was medium in body and syrupy in texture with a nice soft carbonation.

Overall what is there to be said but This brewer does it again". This is a really good brew, with a great balance and awesome taste... 
www.facebook.com/KAJIIsBeerReviews

Wow.... Simply wow... Founders continues to impress... Well balanced flavorful and about as strong as you could want a beer with compromising and flavor... Mwwwa gotta love founders beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Pours a murky copper amber, with lots of sediment and a small off-white head, which lasts fairly well and leaves a little lacing. Berry notes, nutty malt and dark rye bread make up the aroma. Quite strong pine and spice hops up front give way to toffee and nutty malt in the mid-palate. Mild berry notes and more spice hops make up the finish. This is a decent beer, but to my mind it is a little over-hopped for an old ale.

Quite dry and sweet - caramel, biscuit and raisins from the malt. What stands out is certainly the ease with which it goes down given its strength. Ive had plenty of imperial stouts at this ABV and you feel them in your throat. This is subtle!

Bottle from West Lakeview Liquors, Chicago. Pours clear copper with lacing. Fruity English ale aroma with light vanilla and toffee. Taste of cherry and other fruits, toffee, vanilla, sweet with a light bitter finish and a boozy burn. Full body. Delicious!

Bottle from Earl of Essex. Bottled 2012. Pours a dark reddy brown with a thin white head. Aroma is caramel and not much else. Medium body, mild carbonation. Some cherry, caramel, dark fruits, boozy heat, sherry, dark fruit. Pretty smooth actually. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Old ales have to be made a certain way for my palate to really enjoy them. I also find that having some well made dark chocolate handy also enhances the flavors. This is a sipper from a tulip glass, finishing off a nice meal in the dead of winter. Fire in the fireplace, something good on the tv, under the blankets kind of a beer. Nice

Bottle poured into a snifter. Appearance is amber with a small, diminishing white head. Big aroma of caramel, raisin, malt and hops. Full-bodied taste with caramel and maltiness with a very bitter finish. Very good, does not feel like 9.8% at all.
This is a great old ale from a stellar producing brewery. Aromas are very similar to barleywines but the taste is sweeter in my opinion. Get your hands on one if you havent already.

Oczekiwalem po tym piwie o wiele, wiele wiecej, widzac oceny na tym portalu. Niewielka piana, a wlasciwie prawie jej brak, lekkie nagazowanie kolor bursztynowy z drobinkami osadu. Kolor najladniejszy z tego wszystkiego bo wpadajacy jeszcze w odcien ciemnej pomaranczy, no i etykieta tradycyjna. Smak tego starego ale jakos bylo dobre i smaczne ale tak srednio bez rewelacji. Slodkawe na poczatku i alkoholowe w koncowce. Zdecydowanie nie te smaki ktore sie spodziewalem po tym Old Ale.
Bottle. Color amber orange with small head. Aroma malt, roasted, caramel, yeast. Taste sweet, caramel, alcohol.

12 oz bottle into tulip. Bottle from early 2013. Minneapolis. 

Appearance: Copper/brown in color. Mostly transparent, other than haze from unsettled sentiment. Small head that quickly disintegrated into a ring of foam.

Aroma: Very rich. Caramel, raisin, oak, coffee, spice, bourbon. Pretty complex. True to style. 

Taste: Sweet and with a balancing bitterness. Really nicely done. 

Palate: Full body. Very smooth texture. Long, warming finish. 

Overall: A really nice beer. Lots complexity in the aroma. The taste is very well balanced. Fine texture. Very pleasant to drink.

Just poured into tulip glass..rusty,burgundy color with thin head..great aroma of fruit, caramel, wood and all spices..excellent flavor..malty all the way..lingers really well on the palate..reminds me of a barleywine..av winner top to bottom.

Botella de 33 cl 9.8 vol. en el lupulo feroz en octubre de 2013. Color ambar muy oscuro con poca espuma. Aroma dulce y a madera con sabor también algo dulce al principio a pasas añejas seguido de madera de bourbon. Poco Amargor y retrogusto principalmente a licor de bourbon que se va acentuando según va calentando así como también va cogiendo más espesor. Muy recomendable
Packed with sweet spices in both aroma & taste. Cloudy red. Smooth & full bodied, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 Bottle pour to snifter. This was a 2-year old bottle. Red-amber with suspended particulates, almost no head. Thin, warm finish. More subdued, smoother than fresh. Fresh is brash dark fruit, malt, booze. This is more subdued and smoother. Like the fresh version, this vintage grows on you as you get to the second half of your glass.

Poursa a cloudy brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, light roastiness, woody notes with some fruit and yeast. Taste is medium to hight sweet leading to a sweet and lightly woody finish. Awesome stuff.

Copper/amber pour with a white head. Lots of sediment with this one. Aromas of dark fruit and brown sugar. Flavor has a big sweet malt presence with notes of fig and plum. Slight warming from the abv but for the most part its well-hidden. Solid brew.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Poured a crystal clear medium amber with a frothy off white head. The aroma is rich fruity malt, sweet treacle and alcohol. The flavour is medium sweet, light bitter with a smooth rich fruit alcohol liqourice palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation and a long bitter finish.

From a 355ml bottle on 30/12/2013. Pours a cloudy orange with the smallest of heads. Smells of vanilla, biscuit, caramel and wood. Taste wise, this is an interesting brew, with quite a bit of subtlety and complexity. Theres lots of subtle yet intense sweetness, including toffee, caramel, honey, stone and citrus fruit, which is set off against a lovely big slightly alcoholic bitterness. Has a syrupy texture and low carbonation. A superb big dessert beer.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 Spiritus malt aroma. Clear rich amber colour poor head & lacing. Malt coriander herbal flavour. Smith palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 East of Everything ontap(13-Nov-2014) Plum spiced vanilla cinnamon aroma.Brown, low head&suds lace.Big rich vanilla spice plum whiskey flavour.Sweet plum&vanilla finish& warm cinnamon vanilla aftertaste.This barrel beer has plenty happening.

If you like whiskey or barley wine, this one is for you! Aged in oak barrels for bourbon, you will feel the taste immediately. High alcohol content, pair it with heavy food dishes, like a steak.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home (bottled 04/13/12). Pours a hazy amber with no head. Sweet aroma of honey, fruit, and some alcohol, bit bourbonny. Also quite a sweet taste with a warming alcohol feel. Bit of bitterness in the aftertaste. Really nice (dessert) beer.

Poured to NB globe.
Bottled: 02/04/10

A: Pours a firey orange. No head until I agitate, then a thin sheet of off white foam. Pretty beer.

S: One of the oakiest beers Ive ever smelled. Smells like the barrels didnt even have anything more than light toast. Woody. 

T: Bitter, caramel, oak, wood. Very, very woody. Wow, dunno if Im gonna be able to finish this one. Not because its bad, its just so strong.

M: Medium body, low carb. nearly flat. 

D: Its a bigger beer than I had anticipated. However, I think with an additional year under the belt, this beer would even out nicely.

Serving type: bottle

02-08-2011
Deep orange sparkle with a deep magnolia head which thins in time. Nice glossy whisps are left. Good biscuits nose with firm roast& restrained fudge. Nicely soft, chewy and morish.

0.355l bottle. Cloudy ruby body, thin beige head. Aroma of caramel, toast, roasted malts with some fruityness. The taste is very toasty with lots of caramel and roasted malts. Its also very fruity. I think its a bit too bitter, but I still like it.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 This is sweet and malty with a yeasty squeeze. Vanilla and biscuit also apparent. Very soft for the alcohol content.

Just shy of cool and into a tulip. Misty russet orange with very little carbonation. Sloppy, shortlived mess atop manages a little lace. Twiggy, acridly bitter herbs tickle the olfactories with a good breath of oak, vanillin, molasses, butter, soy milk (?) and just a touch of caramel. Boozy and sweet with a tang that twists the mouth into a spasm. Bitter, sharp backend with a finish that is like sucking on a toothpick. Hot alcohol burns all the way down. Oaky, molasses notes are rough and rugged whilst it is buttery and oily in mouthfeel. Linger of vanilla bean. Smoke and rubbery phenols just add to the chaos. No integration of flavour but plenty of flavour to be seen. Id like to say it was interesting to drink but at all enjoyable. One to lay down for a few years me thinks. (12 fl.Oz, BB 17/06/14, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

12 oz. bottle. Pours a medium, tiny bubbled, well retained, ivory head, with extensive lacing, over a dark amber (SRM 15) lightly particled body.....nose is treacle, with light plum, golden raisin, lightly vinous, hints of oak......taste is lightly sweet with tones of toffee/caramel, light fruits including plum, fig, lightly nutty, finishing dryer, with light bitterness and oak.....mouth feel medium, sticky, alcohol warmth present, carbonation low with light acid. Rich, nourishing, warming, complex, make this a classic example of the style. The only flaw is the particle laden body, but how was it stored? BJCP 9/1/16/5/8

Bottle from De Molen web shop.  Hazy dark amber color with medium white head. sweet aroma of honey, bee wax, sweet biscuity malt, some fruits. Extremely sweet taste with honey, sweet molasses, bee wax, caramel, vanilla. Too much on sweet side for being enjoyable.
330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique. Cross between a brown ale and an IPA. There is a hint of each style in this beer. Carries a big heavy hit of alcohol.

Bottle. Pours unclear amber with a quickly diminishing white tiny head. Aroma is very malty with toffee, biscuit, booze, vanilla, orange, flowery and light peppery. Taste is near heavy sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic. Body is medium+, texture is light syrupy, carbonation is soft+. Finishes sweet, boozy and mouthdrying .

Dark amber appearance, cloudy and presence of little bubbles (carbonanation), presence of floating sediments. On nose dry dark fruits like raisin, plum, oak, strong caramel and a deep sweetness, alcohol. On mouth it is fullbodied and dry, malty, hints of fruits, caramel, toffee, woody. Bitter and dry aftertaste.

Dark amber with a nice pillowy tan head. On the nose aromas of leather, sweet malt, alcohol and barnyard develop. Light slick in texture with a full body tasting medium sweet with notes of bitterness at the back of the palate. The finish lingers pleasantly on the tongue for a pretty good while. Nice Ale!
Pours orange, with a very small white head. Aromas of caramel, roasted malt, raisin, candy. Sweet with a smooth mouthfeel. Little discernible bitterness.
Has a malty aroma, with light hints of fruit. Feels heavy like molasses, and has a lightly sweet molasses and malty flavor. There is a hint of bitterness at the end. Very enjoyable, complex ale.

on draft. poured a dark ruby red color with a bubbly white head that quickly dissipated. the aroma of lots of sweet deep malts was forefront on the nose. maybe some dark fruit adjuncts in there are well. the flavor with the alcohol well hidden was sweet malts and fruits and very smooth.. no bitterness bite at all. deceptively good.

Deep amber color with a nice little off-white head. Had some floating yeast sediment; not just little specks, but a big goober that I spooned out of my glass. Was a little turned off but the beer tasted fine so I marched on. Sweet aroma, great taste and a sweet finish. This was from a 2013 batch, cant wait to see what a little more time does to the rest of them.

Creamy dark amber, almost red liquid. Virtually no head. High sediment present. Aroma is caramel, alcoholic, corn, sugar; rich, complex and powerful. Palate is full, creamy. Low carbonated. Finish is very warm, nively bitter, long and powerful. Taste is sugar, alcohol, caramel; leaves a lovely warming sensation.

2/11/2010. From bottle. Pours light orange with a short white head. Aromas of light malt, fruit and some caramel. Sweet malty flavors with fruit showing well. The high alcohol content is muted. Very good.

Dark golden colour, with very little head.
Big sticky date pudding aroma, chocolates and caramel, golden syrup and liquor.
Drinks like syrup, thick and caramel. Sweet candied fruits, apricots and orange.
A nice bitter sweet hop finish, a little pine and citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur ambre clair, reflets oranges. Nez sur le sirop, le sucre, la marmelade dorange, appelle une bière épaisse et un peu acidulée. La bouche est sur le caramel, très confite et sucrée, beaucoup dorange, un côté aigre-doux, un peu dacidité. Texture épaisse, sirupeuse même. Un peu damertume en fin de bouche. Lalcool ne se sent pas. Finale assez longue, un peu amère, aigre, toujours de la marmelade dorange, un peu dépices. Mais ça devient vite écoeurant, trop de sucre

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2015 355ml bottle, pours light golden brown with no head, just a little lacing. Aroma is  caramel, toffee, biscuit, bourbon, dried fruit, floral hop. Medium bobied, sticky texture, medium sweetness and long bitter finish.

Bottle at home from aleselahazy amber with yeast floaties and cream tinted lacing. Fairly sweet toffee apple nose. Full bodied, low carbonation, sweet toffee, slightly creamy mouth feel. Well hidden alcohol, slightly malty. Sticky weetabix short finish

On draft at brewery, tan head, cloudy red brown color. Fruity nose, some red malts, slight pine. Immediately sweet, fruity hops. Hops matched and outdone by a complex sweet malt base, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, oak. Slow finish with hints of liquor. Well done unique beer.

Pours a nice hazy copper red amber with low light tan head. Aroma of caramel and toffee, light butterscotch, overripe tropical fruit, sugar and light soy. Taste is sweet, boozy and caramelly, with just hints of bitterness in the finish. Very alcohol warming. Body is rich and very, very creamy with soft carbonation.

Bottle, 12C. Amber with a modest beige head. Muddled aroma of bourbon, grapes, toffee, raisins. Syrupy mouthfeel, lowish carbonation. Sweet with toffee and dried fruit, orange peel. Finish is fairly bitter and a little hot. Haphazard.

Bottle from Barleywine, Copenhagen, enjoyed at home
Deep copper red, tanned head. Smells of malts, dark fruits, fruit peel, vinous tones, almost a hint of sherry. Moderate sweet, quite dry, some dark fruits, oak and sherry. Very nice old ale

Ok but not really my thing. Pours reddish brown with decent head and lacing. Very malty and oaky. Sweetened, caramelized malt and wood on the finish. Bitter but mostly sweet on finish. Soft carbonation. Texture a little on the syrupy side. Bottle.

A - pours amber orange with 1 finger off white head. S - brown sugar, candied sugar, bitter hops, cereal grains. M - med full body, average carb, thicker end. Round and quite smooth. T - grains, brown sugar, candied sugar and bitter orange marmalade. Caramel malts. O quite good 3.6

Bottle. Aroma of pleasant vanilla malt and light oak. Pours an awesome deep ruby with very scant fine white head and fine sediment. Lacing is also scant. taste is sweet malts followed by oak with light booze then sweet finish. Well balanced. Mouth-feel is light to medium. Do not feel the 9.8 ABV. Oak age does not overpower the beer itself as it often does. Gotta try this
12 oz bottle. Dark brown pour with a thin off white fizzy head. Aroma of earth, faint bourbon, brown sugar and molasses. Thick, sticky mouthfeel with a lasting bourbon finish.
From bottle. Pours a reddish brown in color with thin head. Aroma was dark fruit and booze. Taste follows with addition of malt and a slight earthy note.

Tried this at a tasting in Amherst WI. I thought it was pretty good. My mom, whos not much of a craft beer drinker, really liked it. She must have gone back for 5 or 6 glasses of it. Of course now I see that it is almost 10% ABV so I understand why she was acting a little loopy.
121013. Bottle at home. Pours clear deep ruby with a nice head. Aroma raisins, malts. Some plumes. Slightly too sweet but very nice overall. Might age well. Not Bad.

Bernsteinfarbig, kaum/minimer schaumkopf, süsslich im aroma, antrunk malzig, karamelnote, hopfig blumig, abgang prickeln, würulzig feinherb.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish color, opaque and a tiny head which immediately disappears. Complex pack of aromas with notes of caramel, honey, cocoa, red fruits, butterscotch, cinnamon, hazelnuts...the mouthfeel is equally complex, with the same notes of the aromas, but butter and biscuit, too, perfectly balanced with an orange peel bitterness. Perfectly structured, low carbonated and high bodied, with a velvety and creamy texture. Almost a barley wine, it is really a superb, extraordinary beer.
Great burnt ruby/burnt amber color, with obvious hints of depth. Classic old ale taste; musty yet enticing. Enjoyable for sure.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear amber beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: herbs, caramel, wood, florar, slight hop.
TASTE: sweet, caramel, herbs, bitter, little dry, some malts, marzepan, wood, candy sugar, molasses.
Very nice malty smooth easy to drink. Light on the mouthfeel. Very easy to drink and tasty too.

From 12oz bottle which was bottled on 2/15/13. This "version" was "Brewed with Molasses and Oak Aged." It pours a deep, slightly cloudy reddish amber color with a very thin tan head which rapidly dissipates to a thin ring. No noticeable lacing. Low to medium carbonation and the head is comprised of very dense bubbles. Mouthfeel is slick and slightly creamy. Very nice. The aroma a sumptuous portent of the awesome taste which is to follow. Primarily the nose follows the taste except there is no detectible hop aroma. Taste is moderately sweet without being cloying. Flavors of carmel, dark bread, molasses, figs, vanilla bean, and raisins dominate balanced by a very modest bitterness from the roasted malt and the 50 IBU's of bitterness contributed by the hops. The oak bourbon barrel overtones are quite noticeable and add in a very positive way to the aroma and taste of the beer. They are perfectly integrated into the nose, the taste, and the finish. The finish allows a little more of the hop bitterness to linger but there is a nice sustained carmel sweetness providing a perfect balance. The 9.8% ABV is well hidden, with the beer providing only mild alcohol heat. A very drinkable beer that is complex yet perfectly balanced. This may be one of my top ten favorites. This beer could be reasonably categorized as a barley wine rather than as a classic "Old Ale" such as Theakston's Old Peculiar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer pours decently with a nice heavy amber color to it, pours with a small off white head and leaves minimal lacing on the glass. The beer has a heavy blended sweet smell to it, notes of caramel, malts, dark cherry, vanilla, and raisins. The beer tastes great with a nice dark malt, caramel, and dark fruit taste to it (plum and raisins) and a mild booze flavor on the back end. The mouthfeel is decent with decent carbonation and aftertastes of mild bitterness from the fruit flavors. Overall, the beer is decent with great dark fruity notes and a great blend of flavors that work well.

12oz bottle (unknown vintage, label says brewed with molasses and oak aged) pours chestnut reddish brown into tulip with good 1.5 finger head. Nose is fruity, spicy, cinammon, maple, bready. Mouthfeel is creamy, rich, malty, smooth. Taste is maple, earthy, smokey notes, dark fruits, hides the 9.8% extremely well. Finish is bitter oaky maple, molasses, gingerbread, with some trailing sweet notes. Quite good!

355ml bottle. Hazy, orange/brown with almost no head. Nose : tart, sugar, honey, orange, vanilla, chocolate, dried raisins. Cooked fruits. Sip : thick, oily and low carbonated. The body does remind of a barley wine. Cloying sweet with tart and booze notes. Cooked fruits, whisky. Chocolate, Malaga ice-cream. It never really stops to be cloying sweet with sour and booze. Overall this is a nice discovery.

A mahogany body with a fast fading head. Aroma had notes of wood, caramel malts, molasses and alcohol. Flavor had good balance seemed to have a sweet presence overall but there was a nice bitterness to it. A nice oak flavor reminiscent of a barely wine. Alcohol added both flavor and a nice warming quality. Nice mouth feel. Almost syrupy.

small fothy light brown head. virtually none lacing. fully diminishing. clear thick amber body. aroma: alcohol, honey, cask wood, molasses, moderate roasted malt. if: moderate sweet light bitter. ff: moderate sweet bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation, moderate alcoholic finish. Maravilhoso amargor amadeirado, toques alcoólicos lembrando conhaque, deliciosa cerveja, forte aquecimento alcoólico, dulçor de melado, base maltada, 19,90, lembra barley wine em alguns momentos, baixa drinkability,

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh). 

Pours a dark orange, maybe even a darker bronze, with a finger of off-white head. I have a cold, so cannot catch much of any aroma. :-(

Slightly bitter and harsh malt taste. Not my favorite Founders brew. I'm hoping the bottles I've had aging come across a bit better.

355ml bottle @Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. Malty, caramel, some alcohol aromas. Pours hazy dark amber with little vanishing off white head, poor lacing. Medium to full body, average carbonation, okind of oily, sticky texture. Taste is malty, caramel, thick, alcohol. Some fruity notes. Not so well balanced, alcohol not so integrated. Warm aftertaste. Rich an heavy palate.

Bottle from fish and beer, copenhagen. Hazy dark red color, some white bubbles on head. Aroma is some sweet berries, wet wood, malts, plums. Interestin sweet taste, wood, many sweet notes, cherry, low co2.
Sample pour at tasting 2012 version..aroma is big and bold with booze and woody notes.mouthfeel is surprisingly smooth yet full bodied with obvious warming presence..very tasty indeed..

12oz bottle dated 4/19/12. Poured into wine glass.

Appearance: Cloudy topaz. Thin white head. Sporadic lacing. Aroma: Scotch, Cherry, Butterscotch. Taste: Cherry scotch that eases into a mildly sweet butterscotch. I know that butterscotch is usually regarded as an off flavor, but I like it in this beer lol. I think this bottle was improperly stored at the HyVee I found it in. Palate: Thin but slightly sticky.

Pours a muddy amber color with little head. Has a sweet taste (maybe some vanilla in it...but sweet malts and caramel or toffee too), but with an oaky presence. Initially I think of bourbon age due to the oaky flavor and the hint of alcohol, but further drinks disproves it. Low carbonation. Has a sticky mouthfeel that I enjoy. It is a sipping beer. Had it on bottle and on tap.

A bit murky orange-brown coloured beer, a good head. Nice mixtures of malts, sweetness, slightly some wood. There is alcohol inside that gets trough somewhere near the end together with a nice biterness, but afterall it does not kick in hard. Even better as expected. Really tastefull and a nice mouthfeel.
Amazing. Amazing. Amazing. Dark fruity aroma. Not overly sweet palate. Pours a beautiful dark auburn color. Finger width head. So pleasantly surprised by this craft.

Red-amber bdy, glowing, light hazy and with stable beige lace (which I would have liked bigger). Leaves, dark fruit, dark spices, sweet malts. Really quite nice. Even better though is the taste, with powerful rich swetness balanced by piney hops. Warming alcohol burn in the end, which fits the style well. Bit of a spice-bitter aftertaste. Powerful stuff for a rainy autumn night. Also pairs well with food, with its vineous and sweet character. Very nice, fits my taste very well. (355ml bottle from Dranken Geers)

Bottle. Orangish colour with a light beige head with medium lasting. Aroma is light caramel, toasted malts and spiced. Flavor is quite similar as aroma with slightly hints of wood, mild sweet with a light bitterness in the final.

2012 bottle. Pours a slightly hazy dark honey/amber color with a small off white head. Very sweet and malty nose, lots of dark fruits, caramel, some light spices, and a touch of alcohol. Dark fruits are strong on the taste as well, some caramel and molasses, candy sugar, smooth, sweet, a few "holiday" spices I cant put my finger on, and very malty. I need to try this fresh again to compare the two, though this is pretty damn tasty.

det här var lite av en besvikelse, men bara lite. Smaken var intressant och komplex med toner av aprikos, malt, örter och något som skulle kunna vara någon form av konfektyr. Kroppen var bra och stabil men balansen uteblev helt, dock var det synd att alkoholen sken igenom lite.

bottle at home. pours a copper / amber color with a white head. aroma of a lot of toffee, and caramel. strong smell of the alcohol. taste of malts, toffee, caramel some fruits. sweetness kicks in in the aftertaste. unique taste of al the sugars etc... would like to taste more of those founders beer. if someone would like to help me out... let me know please.
Mycket sötma här. Både i aroman och smaken. Man skulle nästan gissa på att det legat i ett whisky fat ett tag.

341 ml. bottle sampled @ t Antwaerps Bierhuiske. Thx! Pours dark amber, head is mainly off-white bubbles. Nose is lovely and trumps taste. Smells of sweet maple fruits, caramel, toffee, rich with a hint of oak and some sugar. Taste is a bit lesser, sadly but still good, tuned down compared to the smell. Tastes of sweet caramel malts, toffee, slight fruits, vanilla, hints of oak, molasses, vanilla and some candy sugar. Little carb. & body is a bit watery sadly. Overall very enjoyable still. I have had some mixed feelings about Founders  mainly about them being good but not as good as their reputation  this edges me again a bit closer towards appraisal.

Bottle. Pours cloudy light brown color. Aroma is very malty, bread, caramel, toffee. Medium sweet taste. Full body, thick and smooth texture. Can definitely taste the alcohol in the finish but it is quite subdued. Enjoyed the oak flavor. Nice ale overall.

bottle @ bierhuyske . 
pours light clear brown . no foam 
smells sweet,
 soft carbo . sweet, grainy . bit alchohol warmth . very nice !

9.8% just 30 NOK from Kihosk. Rich orange gold  color with an off-white head. Malty rich aroma, toffee... Nice bready mouthfeel, sweet, figs, plums, light caramel, candied fruit. Really good stuff with a full body. A great beer.
Bottle, pours a nice reddish brown, vanilla and caramel and some oak in there a nice full mouth feel and nice offering.

From a year old bottle I had cellaring. Pours a dark reddish brown with thin head. Aromas of oak, vanilla, caramel, alcohol & some fruit. The palate is thick and the alcohol is evident with a lot of oak & dark sugar but not as overpoweringly sweet as I remember this being when I first tried it. The flavors have rounded out nicely over a year. Very powerful & strong ale with strong character.
Had 4 pack with mander-head. Just had a truffle so its hard to rate. Nice copper red colour. Good make background. Reminds me of a red type ale.

Reviewed 8-19-10

Poured from a bottle into a brandy sniffer.

Ap: Hardly any head, with a burnt orange appearance.

Ar: Caramel, dark fruit (raisons, figs, dates) with a little bit of oak. The alcohol is hot!

T: On my first sip, I tasted nothing but oak and alcohol. More bitterness than sweetness. Later, I detected maple and brown sugar. Is there bourbon in this?

P: The alcohol burns the mouth, which I did not find pleasant. The texture is very thick and almost chewy. 

O: The ABV is definitely detectable and then some! Even though this style is supposed to be kind of hot on the palate, this overstays its welcome in that department. Once my mouth got used to those flavors, it got better.

Overall: Ive had this one a couple of times before and I really want to cheer for it each time because Founders is one of the best in the biz. However, even after analyzing it in my session, this still remains one of my least favorite Founders brews.

Sweet malt notes dominate; molasses, brown sugar. Some hop notes at the back, a faint hint of alcohol. I just had an AleSmith YuleSmith Summer IPA right before this, its killing my palate, Ill have to rate this again

I expected to love this beer. Oak aged an molasses in beers I something I enjoy. I feel like it falls short of my expectation. The molasses is a bit overwhelming and it almost makes it somewhere between bitter and sour. I would say it tastes like a Wake Up Dead that went sour. Still better than most but not what I was expecting.

(tap) clear dark amber colour with a small tan head; aromas of toffee, stewed fruit; complex, rich, balanced flavour; very nice

Dark orange with thin white head. Caramel and some pine hops. Toffee notes with a bit of booze burn. Oily on palate with slight hop bitterness. Also tried a bottle of this a year old, which lost some hopiness but was very smooth. Great Beer
Fantastic. Oaky. Really nice. Rated this with another app and BeerBuddy unfortunately won't let me import comments.

Excelente old ale americana, perfeita pra arrebatar o frio paulistano! Cor vermelho-âmbar, licorosa, pouca formação de espuma. Aroma de conhaque envelhecido em carvalho, intenso. Na boca, desce aveludada com ótimo corpo, com predomínio da forte carga de malte, mantendo o dulçor acentuado da breja. Amargor bem balanceado, com álcool bem inserido, aquecendo o final. Excelente breja!

A dark copper beer with a beige and medium head. The nose of toffee and red berries, wood and some strawberries. The aroma is brittish style and despite of strong sweetness the nose is elegant and interesting. Taste of strong toffee, wood, earthyness, richness of alcohol, interesting marzipan in the end. Overally, quite dry despite of strong toffee, thus the hops are there. Medium+ bodied, smooth and pleasant to drink. Sophisticated, strong brittish ale, the great balance.
12oz bottle. Pours a deep amber/copper color with a thin off white head. Lots of floaties. Aroma of oak, caramel, and sweet fruits. Big oak taste, with hints of molasses, honey, and caramel.
Bottle at World Beer Fest in Cleveland, barleywine, strong as heck, 9.8%, but good sipping beer.
Color ámbar oscuro con tonos rojizos. Espuma marfil escasa. Aromas dulces, resinas, barrica y madera. En boca domina un sabor a resina y madera combinado con una acidez equilibrada y seca.

Bottled, 355 ml.
Pours an opal reddish brown with a small beige filmy head on its top.
Intensive malty and dried fruity nose.
Aroma ruled heavily by molasses, honey and in alcohol dipped dried fruits underpainted by some toast, citrusses and herbs, mouthfeel is syrupy, somewhat sticky.
Long, dry and intensive sweetbitter, fruity finish with liqueur, nuts and spices.
Fine one.
12 oz bottle from The BeerHive in Pittsburgh. Rich, heavy, fills the belly with goodness. Fans of the heavyweights should find a lot of pleasure in this one.
Pours rich hazy mahogany, aroma is sweet malt with oak, taste is similar with a light bitter finish, tasty!
36cl, American brew, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, malty/sweet and slightly fruity/woody, balanced, cloudy, small head, good brew, yet expensive!
Reddish, amber pour, smaller white head. Boozy aroma with caramel, malt and basement? Taste is sweet, malty, boozy. Palate is good, but definitely feel the alcohol. Nice beer, but just one a night.

12 oz bottle. Pours a rich looking orange/amber with a one finger off white head. Not much in the way of lace or head retention. Heady scent of caramel malt, molasses, dark fruit, oak and a touch of booze. Flavor is a nice balance between the sweetness of the malt bill and the bitterness of molasses. Flavor is also reminiscent of chocolate covered cherries. A bit of a booze bite, but not to much. Full bodied palate with a bit of a burn. Gut warming. Very nice!
Bottle. No head. Pours cloudy Amber. Aroma malt, roasty, oats, toffee. Obviously malt heavy, hard to smell the alcohol. Strong molasses taste. smooth malty sugary goodness.
A close cousin to barleywine... alcohol taste overwhelms the other flavors more and more with each sip.

Bottle from CBX. Clear amber pour with a thick tan head. Rich malty aroma with toffee, caramel, toast, oak, black tea and brown sugar. Smooth, silky palate with flavors of rich caramel and toffee, hints of fudge, brown sugar, plums and toasted bread. Warming finish. Although Im not really a fan of this style its a great complex beer.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a slightly hazy copper, with a thin wispy off-white head and good lacing. Smell is of dark fruit, oak, caramel and alcohol. Taste is bold and oaky, smoky sweet with caramel and a hint of vanilla and fruit. Nice alcohol kick on the back end that mingle with a touch of hops. Mouth feel is thick. syrupy, slightly viscous. A really nice brew, reminds me of a tamer version of the Immort Ale. The price may steer some people away.
Bottle. Pours slightly transparent amber with slight creamy head with decent lacing. Aroma of alcohol, wood, and raisins. Taste of alcohol and raisins very prevalent.

Deep red color. Aroma: Caramel, dark berries, earthy, bread and vanilla. Taste: Caramel, alcohol, raisin, woody and and a slight hint of coffee. Soft carbonation with a smooth, not-long-lingering finish. Easily drinkable with a high ABV, but its pretty one-dimensional. It tastes pretty good, though.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. This is a hazy orange-amber beer with sweet currant and red fruity flavours, warming caramel and fruity notes and a creamy vanilla finish.
Bottle at home. Clear orangey with a small beige head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel) and hoppy. Flavot medium to heavy sweet, medium+ bitter, some alcohol. Almost full body. Missing complexity.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.
 Mahagóni vörös színe van, belül opálos, ködös. Habja vékony, bézs színű, krémes és viszonylag gyorsan elillan. Illata mazsolás, aszalt fügés, whiskys, karamellás, vaníliás, malátás és mézes, melaszos. Íze tele van aszalt gyümölcsökkel, melasszal, mézzel, igen malátás, karamellás zabkekszes, whisky likőrös, vaníliás, kissé fásan fanyar, édes pipadohányos és egy kis komlót is érezni benne. Olajos, kissé tapadós, testes, moderáltan szénsavas és jól elvan rejtve benne az alkohol. Utóíze keserédes, mézes, kissé száraz és fásan fanyar. Finom, odafigyelős sör, én elsőre azt mondtam volna, hogy ez egy barleywine. Vigyázat, sunyin üt!
Bottle. Clear amber colour with small white head. Malt, dark fruits, caramel aroma. Malt and sweet caramel taste, honey and dark fruits. Medium body.

Bottle

Appearance: Dark orange/amber with nearly non-existent head

Aroma: Booze, vanilla, bourbon, mollasses, oak

Taste: Dark malts, vanilla, slight back of the palate tinge

Palate: Lively mouthfeel. Warming finish and aftertaste

Overall: The malt backbone stops well short of barleywine class, resulting in a really smooth, flavorful, warming beer.

Pours a pretty medium amber/copper with hues of light red coming though with a smooth creamy head. Aromas of oak impression, vanilla, caramel, toffee, brown sugar. Flavors of wood/oak in front, caramel, cocoa, slight fruity hops, slight hint of whiskey, and just a faint trace of alcohol. Medium sweet, and lightly bitter.

Very cloudy carmel brown. Thin mist of white on top. Peaty oak essence overall. Bright citrus hop scents and syrupy molasses. Thick creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation, finish is similar to aftertaste of whiskey cocktail, kind of sour. Flavor is sour and bitter, perhaps like a pale ale with citrus hop flavor aged in oak barrels. Decent but nothing that blew me away. Very peaty, scotch-like.

Bottle at Schouskjelleren, june 14th 2013. Dark amber body, good fluffy white head. Aroma of raisins, bread, oranges and oak. Taste is sweet, lots of caramel, syrup, vanilla, raisins, with a good earthy bitterness in the background. Sweet caramel and alcohol finish.
Poured a reddish brown with minimal head. Aroma of alcohol soaked fruit and caramel malt. Medium body, flavour of honey sweetness and

Far and away my favorite Old Ale. Faint malt aroma that is surprisingly reserved. In appearance - I swear its red, but its brown. Tastes like strawberries without the sweetness - which is lovely. On the palate - wheres the booze? Incredibly hidden heat, but not warming. Never had it tasting as good as my most recent glass - far more mellow than usual.
reddish amber colour, moderate yellowish off-white head; floral honey aroma with rich maltyness and caramel; taste of honey, malty sweetness maybe caramel again, and hints of alcohol; great old ale
Pours a reddish brown color with minimal off white head that quickly disappears.  Aromas of caramel, bread, and cereal.  Flavors of some oak and a mild burn at the finish on a sweet backbone.

Good carbonation without any head. Nutty Caramalty. Some yellow fruity notes like   Fresh blumes. Round  sweet taste with oak-like finish. Intense brew.
Bottle. Pours hazy reddish brown with almost no head. Aroma of wood, leather, caramel and dough. Heavy body with soft carbonation.

Pours a slightly hazy amber with minimal off white head.  Strong aromas of oak, whiskey, and alcohol, as well as molasses, butterscotch, licorice, vanilla, and a bit of nuttiness.  Taste is a bit less than the aroma, but the alcohol is much more well hidden on the tongue.  A bit of oak and malt on the tongue.  Really big beer, with a syrupy mouthfeel.  Long whiskey and molasses finish.  This one is highly recommended.

Copper color-poor head with some lacing. Smells like bourbon. Nice malt, bourbon flavor. This one tastes strong. One is adequate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at CBC 2013.

Reddish colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, oak, alcohol, spice and tartness.

Hazy red pour.  Thin white head.  Nose is of floral pears and apples in oak.  Taste is round, hiding a bit of tartness from the straight oak aging.  Finish is long and on the side of the tongue continuing on the sweet tart side of things.  This is an a gratifying sipper.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013 Very nice aroma of raisins, figs and dark fruits. The taste is similar with some additions of oak. The oakiness gets a little bit dominating for my taste. Should maybe have been a little sweeter. Anyway, I really liked this one!
Sweet malt, molasses, oak and alcohol. Nice complexity and dry finish. Easy to drink despite the high ABV. Good Beer

pours copper with minimal head.aroma of dark cherries,molasses,oak and pepper.flavor is spot on with the aroma.full bodied,light carbonation and has an oily mouthfeel.slightly boozey and nice warming effect on the palate.finishes sweet with a little pepper at the end.another top notch beer from founders.had this before but first for me to rate it.cant say a bad thing about it.nice all around

Pours reddish brown with a small white head.  Aroma of sweet malts and carmel.  Taste is awesome and complex.  Smooth, yet strong malts, sweet molasses, wood, bourbon, and raisins.  I dont know why I waited so long to buy this beer.
Full bodied, nice sweetness that I assume came from the molasses, great beer overall
On tap @CBC13. Clear amber brown with white head. Aroma of caramel, malt and syrup. Taste is sweet and caramelly with lots of malts and some dusty basement notes.

12oz bottle poured into a snifter. Pours a reddish brown with a decent amount of head. Sweet malt on the nose, maybe a hint of caramel. Like its description, I found it deceptively smooth for the 9.8% abv. Medium body, not a very complex beer but a quality beer to sit back and enjoy. Malty with a very slight bitterness on the finish.

Midway put on a 2012 keg in celebration of ACBW.  I have a couple at home, but they are destined for a trade.  Pours brown with decent head and fabulous lacing.  Smell is more grassy than I would have expected.  The sweet molasses flavor carries much of the weight for this old ale.  My own conventional wisdom figured the palate would be thick and viscous, but it had lively carbonation.  Good beer, a little sweet for my hoppy American sensibilities. Draft - Midway Pub - Atlanta, GA

Dark Hazy Orange all around. Has an aroma of oak, chocolate, caramel and citrus hops. Flavor is strong oak, caramel, citra-hops, caramel and a very strong malty backbone. Body is heavy but carbonation is light; Very very thick thanks to the molasses but a pleasure to drink! I think I may have found my new favorite beer from Founders!

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 First impression - thats how old ale should be to me. Pours deep amber reddish, cloudy with little peaces of yeast all around. Head is little, beige, no lacing. Taste is sweet malty profile with almost no bitter; overall dry palette, at the beginning spicy, later just yeasty astringent ( a bit reminds me Mikkeller/Lervig Double Eye PA). Palate - above medium body, thick texture, long light dry finish. A bit reminds me of Belgian style yeasty strong ales, like dubbels but not dark malt flavor. Enjoyed every sap.

Spout is orangish copper with a thin off white head. Nose is caramel malt, molasses, and sweet cane sugar. Taste is nice and extremely malty with notes of sugar, brown sugar and toffee with a little booziness due to the 9.8% abv.  Mouthfeel is medium with no discernible aftertaste.  Very nice beer for sipping on a cold day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.
Pours amber with a tiny off white head.
Aroma is very malty, sweet and with some marzipan and syrup as well.
Taste is a hefty malt bomb with sweetness and some raisins/figs, at the end theres chocolate and slight alcohol. Very well balanced.
Mouth feel is sticky. After taste is quite dry and bitter hoppy.

Sample at CBC 2013, Saturday.

Clear brownish with a medium head. Aroma and taste of malt, syrup, dried fruit, toffee and some light spices. Very drinkable.

Aroma is dominated by malt notes with only a slight earthy, dank secondary hop note. Malt has nice dark caramel notes, some toffee and a noticeable chocolate character. There is also notes of toasted bread, raisins and cherries. A light vanilla note is also present. 
Pours a fairly cloudy burnt amber with copper and brown notes. Quite a bit of what looks to be chill haze. Head is a thick light tan color but it quickly recedes to the edges. 
Flavor is similar to the aroma and is dominated by malt. Lots of toasted bread along with caramel, toffee and chocolate. Mid palate you get a moderate bitterness that helps balance the sweet malt and a touch of an earthy hop flavor. The finish has a bit more chocolate notes as well as some dark fruit. There is quite a bit of raisin and cherry along with fig. Nice, balanced vanilla and oak note also in the finish. A touch of alcohol spice in the finish. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium low carbonation. Astringency is low an alcohol warmth is moderate. 
Overall a very enjoyable old ale. Very well balanced with nice malt character and just the right amount of hops and barrel note. The malt has great complexity and the beer doesn't finish too sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rusty red with a small head. Malty and sweet with a small hop bite. Good example of the style

Pours brown with a small light tan head. Aroma is malts and maple syrup.taste is nice. Sweet syrupy malts up front, chalk in the middle, and a significant bitterness in the finish. Flavors, though not overly specific, are balanced and blended well.

Draught @ CBC 2013

Pours clear reddish brown with a foamy white head. Aroma of caramely malts and syrup. Taste is sweetish and caramely with lots of malts and syrup. Finish is sweet and malty with some syrup and caramel. Quite sweet and malty.

12 oz bottle, Andersons.  Red-copper pour, diminutive tan head dissipates into nothing and cannot be easily revived.  Aroma is weaker than expected; peppery spicy, wood, brown sugar candy, booze.  Flavor really heavy on the malt; oak is more evident here; light vanilla and caramel; blatant alcohol warmth but no astringency and probably could pass for a lesser 7% beer.  Nothing here blows me away but this is well done.

Musty, aroma reminds me of the smell of old peoples houses that I recall from collecting ad a paperboy.  Great memories, terrible olfactories.  App- Clear copper, small head, lasting lace. Taste- quite sour.  Overly bitter and sour tastes make for a puckery feel.  Endearing flavor, but takes a while to get into.  Clean brew, but not smooth.  After"feel" is pasta-starchy....like al dente spaghetti with no sauce.
Not a success, but I am still a fan of founders.
Bottle, pours a clear copper with white head.  Scent is sweet malt, maple.  Taste is very sweet and malty, caramel with hints of vanilla, wood.  Goes down pretty easy for the high abv.

Bottle from somewhere in Ohio. Snifter. Poured an amber color with a medium white head. Aroma is basically malts with a hint of yeast and bread. The taste is very malty with an almost thickness to the body. Mouth is modest alcohol taste for a 9.8%. Slighty sweet as well. Lots of sediment in the glass. Good real old style ale.

You can really taste the molasses. There is a thickness to the taste and a syrupy appearance as well. I'm enjoying this beer. Not legendary but not ordinary either. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for seiPhone
Quite tasty, hides its alcohol relatively well. Some hoppiness, bitter. Creamy. No sourness. Very complex. Id love to try a "half" version of this.

Pours dark amber with a thin creamy head. Smell is malty caramel.
Taste is light roasted malts with a note of bourbon on the finish. A good example of an old ale.

Mmmm, the label is dead on with the malt barleywine analogy.  The pour is a somewhat cloudy copper with a very thin white head that leaves next to no lacing.  The aroma is bursting with sweet malt.  The taste is similar with a huge malt taste up front followed by a hint of bitterness in the finish that provides an excellent balance for this beer.
