Its smooth and robust & certainly lives up to the founders standard!  Very good!
12 ounce bottle.  Pours reddish brown with a small biege head.  ARoma of malt, fruit, caramel, and florals.  Taste is caramel malt, dark fruit, nuts, oak, spice, and some alcohol.  Very nice!
Smells of sweet malt, oak, a little bit of vanilla, and a bit of hops.  Taste is rather complex: Sweet malt, bright fruity cherry, oak, vanilla, some hop bitterness.  Thick, sticky mouthfeel

Bottle poured into pint glass. This is a dark copper beer with essentially no head. The aroma is incredibly rich with caramel malts and a slight toffee scent. The taste is similar to the nose, with an earthy quality to it. It doesnt taste as strong as I expected, and theres a unique sweetness to it. It also feels lighter than I thought it would. Overall, I approve.
Tap, butcher and the boar. Dark red brown, mocha head. Nose is funky, caramel roasted malt, rich. Taste is boozy, big malts, cereal sweetness.

Tap at Oak St. Reddish brown pour with a big cream colored head. Aroma has a lot of sweet caramel, bread, some fruitiness. Taste is wood, earthy, caramel, some booze, and a little vinous. Creamy texture. Really nice beer.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 4/6/2012.  Pours fairly cloudy red-orange color with a small dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers.  Light spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass.  Aromas of big raisin, caramel, toast, toffee, molasses, oak, biscuit, nuttiness, and toasted earthiness.  Incredible aromas with great complexity and balance of malt notes with light-moderate oak character that does not overwhelm.  Taste of raisin, caramel, toast, toffee, molasses, biscuit, nuttiness, oak, light chocolate, light clove, floral, and toasted earthiness.  Fair amount of earthy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, toffee, biscuit, molasses, oak, nuttiness, light chocolate, and light earthy spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic balance and complexity of malt notes with moderate oak presence; with a fair amount of hop balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a moderately creamy and fairly slick mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an incredible old ale!  Awesome complexity and balance of malt flavor with moderate oak presence; and very smooth to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle pours redish orange lively thin white head nose was grassy but smokey dry yet rich in fruit notes with little boozey end taste was actully less malty than i thought it was going to be nice hop flora no real molasases i tasted but very good
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange/amber without any head. Slight lacing. Sweet, juicy molasses aroma. Taste is lightly citrus, sweet, syrup. Syrupy mouthfeel. Dangerously smooth drinking.

Hazy amber with thin off white head. Bit lacing.
Aroma.. intense malty, quite fruity, caramel, bit vanilla, decent hops, bit alcohol
Mostly sweet with quite low bitterness. Smooth.
Not my fav from founders, but drinkable and pleasant.

From a bomber. Pours hazy opaque reddish brown with minimal light head. Tastes like wheat, grapefruit, herbs, with hints of sweetness. Smells like herbs and light hops. Medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle. Pours murky, dark amber with just a trace of fizzy, off-white head. Aroma is cereal and cookie malts, caramel, figs, dates, floral hops, and light booze. Flavor is sweet malt dominate with supporting dark fruit and berry esters, light floral hops, light yeast, and some booze; dry, lightly sweet finish. Medium/full body and low carbonation.
Tap: pour is copper with thin off white head...Nose is caramel, bitter, cracker...Taste is vanilla,caramel malt,bitter,dry,roast,honey
Smak och doft av malt, humle, karamell, brunt socker, ekfat och toner av vanilj. Lagom söt med en avrundande god beska och fruktiga toner.

On tap at Founders. Copper pour. Nice lacing throughout. You get sweetness and molasses in the aroma. More of the same on the taste but really nice caramel malt flavor.  Balanced nicely with a touch of hop bitterness in the finish.  This one went down way to smooth for the ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rich, cold amber. White ring head. Old paper and oak aroma. Medium-light body for such a strong beer. A little alcohol in the nose. Smooth balanced flavor with, caramel malt well balanced with light bitterness. Good, strong ale.

Half snifter pour of deep golden amber with a light off white head.  Nose is sweet malts, raisins, plenty of caramel and toffee.  Smooth.  Tastes of plenty of sweetness, caramel and toffee.  Some sweet fruits including raisins and alcohol.  Not well hidden.  Not a bad one though, just a little sweet.

Murky orange ish brown, ice tea like color. Very little head. Smells of oak, brown sugar, caramel, pumpkin spice, booze, earthiness, apple. Sweet molasses comes through on the taste with some brown sugar all smothered in oak, caramel, fairly boozy, little to no bitter. Little intense at first with a strong sweet, mellowed a little by the oak, booze is fairly apparent. Good overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 bottle to an oversized wine glass. Color is a dark amber/copper with very little off-white head.  Aroma is sweet malt and molasses.  Taste is the same with the pleasant sweetness coming up front and giving way to a little roasted oaky flavor at the end.  Only a slight bit of alcohol detectable.  Medium oily mouthfeel and decent lacing.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
a sweet sugary honey molasses aroma...brown and amber clear color mild lacing..taste...a nutty caramel flavorwith some hop balace,,in a good way..overall..it went down fast

Pours a hazy orange thats just on this side of brown. Virtually no head. Oak, raisins, and must in the aroma. The flavor is mostly oak and molasses. Bit of punch from the 9.8% ABV. A touch of bitterness from the hops at the end. Its a sipper, but something different comes out with every sip, including maple syrup.

Spend a lot of time enjoying this one.

I call this a light barley wine. Nice full malt background and a tad sweet, not too syrupy. Good drinkability for close to 10% ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Pours dark amber with very little head. Nose is very boozy with lots of oak, burnt sugar, and smoke. Mouth is oily which is not an ideal characteristic for me. Strong malts on the front with the booze on the backend. Finishes bitter with a bit of licorice. Least favorite of the Founders but I think its more because I dont love the style.

Pours a pale golden color with an off white head. The beer was poured very carefully, so there was very little head. The aroma was mild with notes of vanilla. Oak barrel and vanilla flavors are accentuated by the silky smooth mouthfeel. This is a very mild, pleasant, drinkable beer despite its higher ABV.

12 oz bottle.  Served in a snifter.  Pours a deep amber with very little head.  Malty, oaky aroma.  Full-bodied, sticky mouthfeel.  Initially, the flavor of alcohol dominates, with caramel undertones and hints of wood.  The boozy quality gives way to the bitter presence of hops, which lingers for a while in the finish.  An interesting brew.  I dig it.

Pours a clear copper from the bottle with thin ring of off-white lacy head that sticks moderately. Aroma of oak and vanilla, brown sugar, booze and a hint of peppery spice. Taste follows, but booze is covered by nice notes of vanilla and molasses. Bittersweet finish, pretty damn good.

On tap 4 oz. pour at Meridian Pint in Columbia Heights, Washington, DC.

Very hazy orange-red copper with a fine pale khaki head and excellent lacing.

Mild aroma of caramel, spice, booze, orange, raisins, bread pudding and tropical fruit.

Taste of caramel, orange, booze, raisins, tropical fruit, grain and earthy hops.

Full/medium body and high/medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a (2013) bottle into snifter.
Appearance was a dark amber color with a 1 in off-white head.
Aroma was of maple and oak 
Mouthfeel was a light syrup consistency 
Taste-malty, biscuity, a hint of maple sweetness
Overall- a great beer, similar to a Barleywine.  Booze is well hidden here. For $16 a four pack, I cant say I would buy more than one a year but its a nice pick up.
Pours a clear red with barely any head.  Smells of oak, dark breads, vanilla, hint of alcohol.  Taste is sweet, mildly bitter - a lot of oak, vanilla, malty.
Pours a dark caramel color with small head. Aroma of brown sugar. Sweet, smooth caramel malts, maple sweetness. Very good.

Shared from a growler filled today. Poured a light amber color with a small head. Aroma was sweet, malty and yeasty. Taste is lightly sweet with a mild hoppy dry finish. A great beer to drink slowly and is even better once it warms up.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber color with a thin off-white head, dissipated quickly, decent lacing though. Nose is toffee, figs, vanilla, peaches (this has bourbon notes through and through even though I know it isnt barrel-aged). Mouth is full-bodied and creamy, a bit on the sweeter side, lots of malt and caramel, more vanilla and figs, bitter finish, with some ABV warmth. Really nice. This is easily my second favorite Founders beer after the Backwoods Bastard... and it isnt that far off the #1 spot.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2014 Thursday March 21, 2013 12oz Bottled 04/13/12; Vibrant amber to copper pour with a smallish, late forming very light khaki head leaving ecclectic spotted lace; light fruit, oak, and alcohol notes dance over pudding, toffee, and marshmallow, some toast, light smooth leather, and charred oak are introduced in the taste and finish out the medium, somewhat creamy ml mouth, soft heat; complex, yet restrained and welcoming

-

2012, 2013, 2014 vertical

Clear, vibrant, cherrywood bodies offering a short fading bone white head, eldest completely dissipating, middle vintage retains a solid, medium sized ring for about 20 minutes, current vintage includes a ring plus a perforated island

12
Citrusy cherry over vibrant clean maple with biscuity accents, offering a clean expedited finish of subtle gooey marshmallow and date, the most sophisticated of the bunch

13
Initially fishing dock with earthy esters, as this one breathes and begins to articulate itself more enjoyable notions of barrel and peat appear along with toasty marshmallow, a few solid moments of finishing residuals, the most rustic of the session

14
Citrusy notes, caramel and cereal with earthy, herbal hops and biscuity undertones, less distinct, more depth, and extended mildly drying herbal residuals with underlying marshmallow and date, the most herbal of the group

Each vintage offered a smooth, medium body with restrained, but present carbonation

12oz bottles served at 55° into 15.25 Spiegelau Soiree snifter
Bottle. Dark caramel and redish with no head. Sweet caramel, toffee and slight alcohol.
2012 into a wine glass. Dark brown appearance. little head. Very sweet nose, loads of caramel. Taste is sweet yet floral. very boozy. finishes sweet swell. more of a barleywine than old ale.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Lots of caramel malt and very sweet. Maybe overly so. Lots of heat which balances it out a little. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
roasty, toast, earthy, woody, amber, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, medium body, soft carbonation, long finish,
Shared from a 12 oz bottle.  Pours a dark amber with a thick off white head.  Malty aroma.  Flavors of caramel, raisin and intense focus.  Bitter aftertaste.  Quite tasty.
Bottle. Thanks Eric! Copper with a little head after poor.. smooth with hints of oak and molasses... great beer!
2013 Bottle pour.  light on the head. aroma is faint booze.  color brownish red.  Tastes bitter with some bourbon hints.

Pours brownish orange. Little or no head. Sweet malty aroma of fig, dark fruit. Taste of sweet malt, some dark cherry and corn syrup? Mouthfeel is thick and heavy. Probably from the molasses. Mouthfeel is similar to a heavy stout, like Ten Fidy. Kind of sticky, sugary. No hint of alcohol, even at almost 10%. Super smooth, easy drinking. If you are looking for a sweet, thick malt bomb, then this is your brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 bottle from polomagnifico.  Thanks, Ryan!  Deep toffee brown with a pillowy fading head and no lacing.  Nose of toffee and some dates and bread dough.  Full bodied, almost chewy.  Toffee, tobacco, and sweet malts, but very balanced and alcohol well integrated.  This has aged very well.  Very remininiscent flavor profile to Great Divide Hibernation, but where that is dry and more on the tobacco/leather side, this is a sweeter riff on that theme, more like a barleywine.  Very enjoyable.  Nose is a little flat but a great package.  Prefer it to Backwoods Bastard which I find a bit hot and sweet.

Try it. Deep amber with white head. Aroma...the molasses stands out. The taste...reminds me of black strap rum (which I love), but the ale does not pull it off for me. Maybe it is an acrid taste/feel I get from the oak. It is worth a try,just not a second try for me.
Bottle->snifter.  Pure amber with faint offwhite head.  Aroma is malt and dough.  Taste is boozy malt, withh sweet dark fruit.  Flat, bitter, and unimpressive.

Poured from a 12oz bottle. Pours a deep amber color, with thin white head. Aroma is molasses, a bit of spiciness. Notes of caramel, sweet molasses, vanilla, slight alcohol burn. Oaky finish. Has a rather light body, light carbonation. I am enjoying this at the moment but I think it will be better with some age.
Had a 2012 vs a 2013.  Age really helps this one.  Almost barley wine like.  Sweet spicy candy like. Very smooth and easy to drink.  This stuff is good fresh but doesnt compare to a little age.

Poured clear, a beautiful copper/ruby colour with a thin tan head; aromas of slightly spicy dark fruit with hints of sassafras; taste of delicious butter toffee, and sweet caramel, mingling with a slightly grassy bitter finish that lingers nicely with the malt forward flavours; palate is delightfully smooth and creamy, with a medium to full body and mild carbonation. Very enjoyable, this a very well crafted old ale -- a favourite for me.
Bottle. Pours a hazy amber with very little head. Taste is woody malt, whiskey and finishes with some nice heat. Solid beer and at a good price point.
bottle. Deep amber with minimal head. Slightly fishy odor. Thick and chewy. Mild alcohol warmth. Flavor not as complex or interesting as I was hoping for.

The appearance is not much to go crazy over. The aroma has a rich sweetness to it. I picked up on malts, carmel, and dried fruit. The flavor is very smooth and drinkable. I could taste sweet caramelized malts, oak, apricot, and plums. The finish is smooth, syrup like, malty, and full of sugar sweetness. My palate was effected mildly. Overall this was a fine beverage for its style.

Copper/ rubby color with a compact off-white head. Aroma is strong caramel/ sherry notes with some dried fruit, nice. Sweet flavor, with nice dried fruits and nutty malts some slight peppery alcoholic notes. Medium to full palate, silky mouthfeel, warming but not overly alcoholic with a nice bittersweet aftertaste. Another winner from Founders.

12oz bottle poured into a snifter. Pours a reddish brown with a decent amount of head. Sweet malt on the nose, maybe a hint of caramel. Like its description, I found it deceptively smooth for the 9.8% abv. Medium body, not a very complex beer but a quality beer to sit back and enjoy. Malty with a very slight bitterness on the finish.

Pours a clear deep amber orange color with a smallish off white head that dissipates quickly to wisps of foam on the surface. The aroma is sugary and malty with a clear bit of ethanol. Brown and caramelized sugars among dark pitted fruit and a solid hit of alcohol with little to no hop nose. The flavor is sweet with the rich dark sugars that were present in the nose. Added bonus is rich milk chocolate melded with dark fruits and again tempered with a hit of ethanol. Medium to thick body with a light level of carbonation and a sweet almost syrupy mouthfeel. Good beer, I could drink it, but I was expecting a bit more from Founders, this one didnt wow me.

The color of this beer is beautiful, for it is a brownish read with a medium-large cream-colored head; also, the aroma is very subtle with nutty malts and clove undertones. Once sipped, the boldness of this beer is apparent. The taste is mildly sour, mildly umami, slightly sweet, and slightly salty; the rich taste is matched by the rich palate that combines heavy body, creamy yet oily texture, soft carbonation, and a long, astringent finish.

Bottle. Pours dark orange and red with a small, quickly-receding head. Aromas of dough, dried, fruit, plum, cherry. The flavor is sweet, very malt-forward, with mild bitterness. Not super complex; drinkable, enjoyable, but not mind-blowing. [1108]

355 ml bottle.
Originally rated on 20100313.
Pours dark copper color with a small head. Aroma of ripe fruits, some licorice, caramel malts and some syrup. Flavor of dark fruits, sweet malts, syrup and some licorice notes. Decent.

A 12 oz bottle, bottles on 4/19/12, drank on 3/9/13 so nearly a year old. Pours an orangish brown color that is quite cloudy. No head whatsoever, just some slight foaming. Figgy aroma very similar to a barleywine. Some alcohol in the aroma as well. For me, a much more pleasant taste than barleywines. A hearty malty-sweet taste. Probably not my favorite founders but delicious for the style.

Pours a dark amber with a minimal head that vanishes quickly. Smells of sweet bread and dark fruits greet the nose. Very clear and clean pour with a small head that follows. Big malty flavors with some sweetness and alcohol fight for space on your tongue. For me this is a slow sipper. Palate is thick, it might be the best part of this beer. Full bodied with a great mouth feel. I didnt think I would like this beer but it really is wonderful. Im almost certain that Founders can do no wrong, maybe I need to try Dirty Bastard again.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2013 Pours very nice dark burnt orange with a small amount of beige fizz. The aroma is lightly smooth sweet grains and some oaky vanilla. The flavor is rich with a lot of grain shown but it doesn?t come off too sweet, too bittering, or too strong, very smooth earthy quality. The oak is what pops first with a bright wood and moderate vanilla leaving a pseudo whiskey feeling on the palate after it?s gone. Lingering red grape, apple, and a sort of plum thing linger with the oakiness to mellow into a wonderful smooth delicious beverage, so easy to drink at 10% I have to slow myself . The carbonation is lower which fits well and makes it feel like a snifter type of drink. Thank you again Founders. -- aged one year-- smooth grains more sweet with tasty berry fruit notes from yeast. Minimal hops with a nice dry oaky grainy finish, smooth on all accounts.

Draft at blue monk, sherry or whiskey looking pour, light carbonation, little head. Medium aroma of toffee, caramel malts. Pretty bitter upfront, toffee, caramel, light medicinal booziness towards the finish.

355 ml. bottle poured in to a snifter. Dark, amber colour with a small, off-white head. Rich, sweet aroma with heavy caramel malts, vanilla, oak, dark, dried fruits. Resin hops. A hint of licorice and whisky. Taste is sweet. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finishes rich and sweet with lots of malts, a slight hint of booze. Well made old ale, close to a barley wine.

Pours dark reddish amber with a tiny off white head. Aroma of ripe plums, caramel, mellow toffee, weak hops in the background and some wood. Very gentle and smooth aroma. Taste of sweet ripe fruits (plums, dates and a hint of apple pie) dry wood, a little bit of hops, toffee and butterscotch. Nice and well hidden alcohol.

Pours a deep rich copper color with a sticky two finger eggshell foam. The nose has lots of vanilla, maple, date and toasted malt. The palate has a nice balance with trace sweetness but much more old wooden earth notes. Rustic malts and a boozy bitterness.. with a clean long finish that emerges with traces of dark fruit. Another nice beer from Founders.

Poured from a bottle into a founders glass. Dark brown ruby pour with a small white head that laces a bit. Tastes heavy on caramel, malt, some bitterness, and lots of oak. A bit smokey, but not off putting. Real nice.

355ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga, MelnaZiema2013)
Sweet malty aroma. Disgustingly boozy sweet body. Nice malty finish. Desperately dull, nothing can escape from the blanket of sugar and alcohol that smothers it.

Bottle received in a trade from BlackIPA, thanks man!! This one packs 9.3% ABV so who knows when its from, but Shawn told me it was aged 4 years so this must be correct. Pours a nice and clear maple syrup brown with a sticky brown-ish (think light brown sugar) head. First whiff is full of sugar and spirits (whisky) notes, was this barrel aged? A really nice introduction anyway! Venturing into taste and flavors I can say that it is really sweet but not over the top. Body is full with a light carbonation so this is definitely a sipper. Alcohol is partially hidden, but it does make itself known. Lovely!

Pours a dark muddy brownish orange with virtually no head. Nose is sweet and fruity with a good amount of malt along the way. Taste is very sweet and fruity as well with abundant caramel, with abundant malt and very well disguised alcohol. Finish is dry, more of a sipper paired with a dessert. Quaff Score 7 / 10

Bottle @ Home. Pours a beautiful golden amber with a small creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malts, brown sugar, dark fruits, vinelike, little alcohol. Flavor is rich malts, caramel, brown sugar, riasin and other dark fruits, little bitter, just a tad boozy. Medium to full, soft carbonation, lightly warming alcohol in the finish. 100213
Beaucoup de finesse et de complexité pour cette old ale .. Levure , caramel,très plaisant !

Bottle. Red grapefruit type of color. Small to tiny head. Caramel, sugar, more sugar, sweet, malty aroma. Sweet, sweet, sweet, sweet flavor. I really cant say anything else cause sugar blast in this beer is overwhelming. Im not fan of sweet, so probably problem is in me, not in beer.
Rich malt aromas of brown sugar, dark fruit, and a touch of a vinous quality.  Brown to deep brown with not head.  Sweet malt with earthy hop presence. Full bodied with a long sweet vinous finish.

Pours a hazy amber color with some below-surface activity that lasted quite a while. Off white head leaving some lacing. Aroma has sweet earthy malts, hoppy citrus fruit, some spices, peppermint and vanilla. Taste is of sweet toffee, overripe fruit, lemons, wood and some whiskey. Layered syrupy texture. A bit of sourness with a stronger alcohol presence becomes more apparent through the glass. Finishes with some length; sweetly with some alcohol.

Une belle petite bouteille offerte par Patrick.  Bière orangée avec une mousse beige. Le nez offre des effluves sucrés, du caramel, des épices, du toffee, de la vanille, de la tire dérable et des notes fruitées de levure. Très complexe. En bouche nous sommes dans la décadence, du caramel, de la tire dérable à la limite du barley wine. Très bon. 8/10

Une bouteille offerte par tom10101.  Un liquide plutôt ambré qui se coiffe dun petit col mousseux.  Un nez dense mais peu complexe par sa structure maltée et par la présence dun alcool fruité.  Une bouche dégoulinante de caramel, de sucre dorge et de toffee avec ses mouvements fruités et son souffle vanillé.  Une impression sur le palais qui mest appréciable.  Un corps bien roulé avec une texture en sirop.  Un apport minimal des bulles.  Une finale longue, lourdement maltée et franchement alcoolisée.  Définitivement une bouteille à partager.

Flaske innkjøpt i København: Rødgylden, uklar og med kortvarig skum. Lite aroma, men noe rosin/engelsk karamell uten å være søtladen. Smaken er også moderat søt, men balansert av litt nøtter og røstet malt. Overraskende liten munnfylde for et så sterkt øl. Tørr og faktisk litt surt avslutning, men jeg blir ingen surpomp av dette, nei. Vitaminene varmer i magen, så dette er helsekost.

Bottle (2011, I think).   Poured a medium amber color with minimal white head.   Aroma was a bit sweet with a hint of alcohol.   The flavor was some caramel and malt with just a touch of hops.  Id get this one again, it was pretty good.

Carmel, slight sweet, faint bitterness, but not overly hoppy, overall a good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Fresh bottle on 3/28/15  -  Appearance is very similar to earlier reviews.  Aroma of toffee, brown bread, toasted malt and some pine.  Taste has a good deal of malty toffee sweetness along with earthy molasses, tannic oak and some piney hop bitterness.  Finishes with lingering pine and earthy bitter. Mouthfeel is semi slick with a medium/full body and low/moderate carbonation.  A tad on the sweet side and a bit too much bitterness.  I prefer it with some age. 2 year old bottle drank on 11/17/14:  Pours a murky orange honey color with a light tan finger of head that disappears quickly leaving little lacing.  Aroma is a bit sweet with toffe, toasted malt and mild spices.  Taste is somewhat sweet with some caramel and dark molasses.  Has an earthy spiciness and a flavor sort of reminiscent to burnt marshmallow along with a bit of booziness.  Finishes with some earthy roasted flavor.  Medium bodied with low carbonation.

First review 1/13/13: Mild bitterness with somewhat spicy and sweet taste.  Low carbonation.  Not bad for a darker beer.  (3/5 stars in other app.)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Half bottle at Chez Hoser. Copper-amber with hint of red, a host of suspended tiny particulate and a thin white skiff.  Big boozy bourbon and Brown sugar nose. Thick malt flavour with tasty dark sugar notes. Warmth for a cold night. Like a warm boozy desert.

Poured from undated 12 oz bottle into snifter.

Appearance was a very hazy, dark orange. No appreciable head, and what there was vanished quickly. Aroma was sweet, slight alcohol, raisin date fruit notes, some breadiness, some caramel, whiff of vanilla. Immediate taste was bitterness with some acidity underneath, then sweetness. Malty, caramel, maybe fig, sweet grapes, maple syrup notes, and more vanilla than the nose. Sweetness builds, vanilla and maple notes linger. Soft and smooth on the palate, not too carbonated, some tingle from the alcohol. Some syrupy sticky sweetness stays on. Overall, warming and fun to drink. A lot going on, but seems well blended. Would have again.

Aroma:  some caramel, hints of alcohol, vanilla, cocoa, bourbon, bitter apricot, cream soda, moscato grape.  Appearance:  dark orange-red.  Taste:  somewhat sweet, bitter stone fruit.  Palate:  solid, medium-full body, rich and complex, light sweet lingering flavors.
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2014 Dark amber . Sticky head. Aroma of dark fruit. Same in the flavor, nice sweetness and some alcohol. Chewy full body. Wonderful oak aged character.

Bottle, 2010 ed. Pour is dark copper/almost ruby with a big tan head, good retention/some lace. Aroma is maple syrup, waffles, peat, caramel, earth. Taste is sweet, maple syrup, caramel, some peat. Hops seem to have disappeared. Palate is soft, creamy, a bit sticky, sweet finish. Interesting beer, probably better fresh in retrospect.

Pours a deep, coppery orange with practically no head.  Looks just beautiful in the glass.  Minimal lacing.  A sweet, aroma of brandied fruit, oak, vanilla, and leather.  Taste is quite sweet, with an even mix of maltiness and alcohol that does call bourbon to mind (albeit far more drinkable).  Mouthfeel is slightly thick with a light, fizzy carbonation.  Despite the high alcohol content, there is a rather tame finish to this beer, deceptively masking its potency.  In sum, a fine beer that will appear to those who love scotch ales, old ales, and barleywines due to its oak-aged nature and alcoholic sweetness.

Bottled. Pours clear and orange amber with a small beige head. Nose of peach, citrus fruits and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with a little bitterness and alcohol notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft CO2. A pleasantcand smooth brew. ★★★
Bottle pours nice red brown clear tab head smells tastes of booze caramel toffee bitter spices maybe cherry. Thin. Weird first bite then smooth then bitter. Not really a big fan of this one.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2015 Beautiful aroma of eggnog, cinnamon, toffee, white chocolate fudge, vanilla horchata, brown sugar, old leather, and booze. The pour is deep amber with no head. The taste closely mirrors the aroma, being mostly sweet and mildly bitter, with a splash of alcohol. The finish leans dry and woody, with a slight oaky tartness that dies slowly. Syrupy palate with minor, prickly carbonation. Balanced, flavorful, substantial. Perfect for a winter evening by the fireplace. Oh, Founders, how I love you. Lovely!

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2012 Pours ruddy orange with a thin whispy head. Not getting alot from the nose but the taste is pleasant. Light but malty with plum, molasses, fig, and raisin. A hint of oaked vanilla lingers on the palette. Nice.

8/XI/12 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from Biernavigatie (webshop, NL) @ home - bottled: II/24/09 (2012-1256) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Pretty cloudy red amber to brown beer, small off-white head, unstable, bit adhesive, lots of sediment floating around. Aroma: cocoa powder, caramel, dried fruits, raisins, port, little dusty. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: raisins, little sweet, port, bitter touch, chocolate and caramel. Aftertaste: bitter, wood notes, chocolate, malt, little hoppy, earthy flavour. Great beer.

Hides the alcohol very well....dangerous!  Pours cloudy orange with no head.  Sweet caramel aroma, with a hint of malt.  Taste is huge caramel notes with a touch of citrus hops.  Finish is very sticky.

12oz bottle thanks to somebody here who sent it to me as an extra. Amber color, short head. Smells rich, booze, malt, candy, good. The flavor was nice old ale with a bit of alcohol, toffee, really quite nice. Overall, Id buy this if I could and wouldnt mind another bottle. Founders makes some quality beers.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-06-2011 04:01:49

Bottle. Pours a clear reddish-amber with a small white head. Sticky sweet aroma, of malt, candied citrus, brown sugar, wood. Taste is very sweet, of malt, brown sugar, candied fruit, herbs. Lingering sticky sweetness. Tasty, but very sweet.

bottle poured into a tulip. Pours a copper red with an off white head and amazing lacing but lots of sediment floating around. Aroma is molasses, bitter citrus, and some malt. Taste is sweet, orange, grapefruit, malt, dark fruit, and brown sugar. full body mouth-feel and sticky with little alcohol showing through the sweetness

Flaska på Monks Wallingatan 2012-11-06
Halvstor, kryddig arom med inslag av källare, träfat med vaniljton. Visst alkoholgenomslag. Tendens till rökighet. Förvånansvärt tunn.
Dåligt skum men en vacker bärnstensfärg med lätt dis.
Smakrik och komplex. Örtig och jordig på samma gång. En stor vanlijton slår igenom lite för mycket, däremot inte den starka alkoholen förvånande nog. Kunde varit mer fyllig.
Eftersmaken är aromatisk med inslag av lakrits.

Bottle 355ml @ home
Pours slightly hazy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, raison, plums, dried fruits, wood and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long very smooth, caramel, vanilla and dried fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat.

Pour is a gorgeous reddish brown with a small head. Aroma is sweet caramel malt and alcohol. A bit thick with good carbonation. Flavor is sweet and complex. Vanilla, caramel and alcohol are up front with a nice hop and honey finish.

Maybe its just not the right flavor for me.  I can tell its a quality beer but it just seems to sweet for me.  Not sure whats up. Would definitely drink it again but not something I would seek out.
En botella.Color cobriza ,aromas a maltas,cuerpo medio alto,alcohol bien escondido.interesante

Rare air here.  Shockingly smooth considering the high alcohol. Complex.  Taste starts hints of cloves and earthy notes.  The middle is honey.  The end has a pleasent hoppy bitterness. Nothing over powers.  Excellent!

Ar: Raisins, sugary malt, ripe pineapple.
Ap: Copper, a little hazy - almost no head, just a wisp of foam.
T: Vinous and burnt caramel up front, fair amount of sweetness - firm bitterness with a pronounced herbal flavor - grape, orange peel, and raisin - noticeable, but clean, alcohol heat - finish is tannin and herbal bitterness.
P: Medium-full body with medium carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: Big, hearty beer - complex fruit and wine flavors mingle with a big grip of malt.

On tap @ Toronado: Poured a medium amber hue with a tiny layer of film head across the top. The aroma is spicy and sweet with a scent of cinnamon or frankincense but does have a nice malt bill holding it all up. The drink tastes watered down but does have a balanced taste of slightly spiced hops and caramel/toffee like malts to keep my interest but not enough substance to make this a memorable old ale style. Maybe I need to taste this from the bottle to change my mindhopefully I get that chance one day.
12 ounce bottle. Poured cloudy without head. Lots of caramel and toasted malts. A big malty beer with grainy notes. Some fruity characters. A nice beer but it is not blowing my mind.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2013 This is a re-rate.  Got a bad bottle the first time, I think.  Pours deep amber brown with a small yellowish head on top.  Aroma is molasses, oak, HUGE malt, and actually a bit of dark fruit.  Very low carbonation, and a thick viscous mouthfeel.  Flavor is all malt forward with a definite oak presence.  Sweet and sticky, with the sweet coming from a combination of caramel malt and some fruit flavor.   Will certainly warm you with the alcohol, though it isnt too assertive.   I can appreciate the massive malt presence, but Im not sure I believe this is "balanced", as Founders claims.  Still not a huge fan of this one, but certainly better than the first bottle I had (that one got a 1.8).  Up front it is a bit much, but it can grow on you a bit as you sip through.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 Bottle in trade from Suttree. Thanks! Clear dark  copper-orange with a big resilient beige head. Aroma of bread, caramel, oak and some spice. Taste is malty, woody, boozy, pretty bitter and a little sweet. Medium-full bodied and a touch syrupy. Honestly, good stuff for sure, but perhaps a bit overrated.

Cloudy reddish with a viscous foam that melts to a film. Nice caramel, vanilla, malty aroma. Taste is sweet malty caramel. Some coffee? Bitter finish. More complex than I can describe. Evolves as it warms. Great experience. 

More beer please...

From a 12oz bottle into a brandy snifter. No date but this is a few months old tops.  Pours a light brown/dark red.  Little head, no lacing and no film on top.  Aroma is of coconut, dark fruit, brown sugar and bourbon.  Mouthfeel is as thick as youd expect it to be.  Not many bubbles in this one.  Taste is banana, coconut, dark fruit, sawdust, oil, alcohol (but not much) and bourbon.  I really liked this one.  Not hot at all, very smooth and lots of flavor.  My favorite from Founders so far!

Bottle to glass mug.  Pours a caramel color, cloudy and almost no head.  Looks like good lacing.  AVB is evident in this one.  Its almost too boozy, however I kinda like it.  Its barleywine-esque, like the description says.  I would keep these in the beer cellar...

Bottle @ home.... It pours hazy amber with a medium offwhite head.....The aroma is dark fruit like prunes, brown sugar, alcohol and caramel.... The flavor is dark fruits, hops, caramel, roasted malt and some alcohol...... very nice!....

Bottled on 04/19/2012. 12 oz bottle into a tulip glass.

A - Dark red body. Slightly hazy with some sediment and slime rolling into the glass in the last ounce. One finger off white head settles into a thin cap. Great lacing and retention with alcoholic legs.

S - Molasses, toffee, oak, brown sugar, plums, and a touch of vanilla. A bit harsh with some alcohol notes but incredibly sweet and inviting.

T - Strong toffee notes with some molasses, brown sugar, and caramelized dark fruit sweetness. Smooth with some oak and vanilla on the end. Boozy warmth with a lasting malt bitterness.

M - Low carbonation. Body is lightly syrupy and big on the booze.

O - Excellent aroma and a great taste, but the booze creeps up fast and becomes a bit too much. Some aging would do wonders on this beer, but at a few months old its not terribly impressive. I do prefer Old Stock to this.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2012 You know, this is terrific. Most malt driven beer Iâve had - like a barley wine without a hop presence. Intense roasted caramel malts. Pours a deep ruby red, slightly hazy, with an off white head. Great bottle art, great brewery, great beer over billiards.
Clear ruby with no head or lacing at all. Aroma is dark dried fruits, and sweet malt. Taste is very boozy, decent bitterness and lots of caramel maltiness. Pretty solid sipper!

The beer is mildly hazy and appears orange to copper in color. The head is off white hued, measuring approximately an inch thick. A substantial amount of lacing is left on the glass.

The aroma offers malt, alcohol, oak, vanilla, banana, and rum.

The flavor is strong and complex. As prefaced in the nose, alcohol, malt, and banana are the prevalent flavors. The beer is still a bit hot, and could likely benefit from some cellar time.

The feel is medium-heavy on the palate, with alcohol content noticeable throughout. Carbonation is moderate.

Overall, a decent brew from a great brewery. This one is a good candidate for sharing a few ways.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-27-2011

Deep amber slightly hazy with almost no head. Slight foam on the side of the glas.  Aroma is sweet caramel malts, some raisins, (My nose is on vacation today...have a cold...). Sweet caramel malt, raisins, alcohol, a nice bitterness at the back of the palate. Not too complex but a solid beer!

This is a great beer. I got my grubby little hands on a bottle of Better Half before I even tried this, but it absolutely lives up to it. The best way to describe this beer is "getting drunk off a pancake". I could drink this everyday.
Very cloudy - very thick feeling beer.  Nice aroma - barley, caramel, melon.  Flies like this beer when drinking it outside.  I do to.
Pours dark cloudy amber with almost no head. Aroma is of raisins. There is somewhat of a bourbon undertone. The alcohol is quite heavy throughout this pint. Great beer from Founders.

355ml bottle, bottled 13/04/12. Pours a clear ruby red with a small, fast receding white head. Aroma gives honey, mint(!), butterscotch, vanilla and faint herbal notes with a sweet, caramelly malt backbone. Flavor is sweet malt, light honey, earthy and vanilla-like. Could do with slightly more bitterness, its a little too much on the sweet side. Mouthfeel is soft, not too thick, not too light. Medium carbonation. No sign of alcohol despite the relatively high abv - deceptively drinkable indeed.
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2013 Bottle at Eulogy. Cloudy copper pour with a slim foam top. Heady brew. Honeycomb. Pinecones. Cinnamon. Mead. Sulfered apricot ears. Strong alcohol taste. Bourbon notes. Nice.
Straight from the bottle after a hard days labor... Deliciously sweet but intense alcohol taste...Really gets the job done quick.

Not the prettiest beer, no head, no lacing, dark orangy brown, smells raisiny, reminding me a lot of the smell of a raison detre. Taste is simular, only this is much boozier, I would not call this smooth at all, leaves a burning sensation. Thats not a turn off for me though, all in all tasty

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 Le liquide est ambré et voilé, ayant une mousse timide qui ne veut pas rester, mais laisse néanmoins des traces. Des odeurs de miel et de caramel en émanent tout dabord, suivies deffluves surettes sapparentant au levain. Il y a un côté qui rappelle un peu le vin dorge. Ça rentre dedans côté goût. Lalcool commence à réchauffer dès la descente du gosier et cest ressenti tout le long du tube digestif. Une saveur de gruau avec beaucoup de cassonade et de lalcool. (Embouteillée 08-06-12) (335-260812)
Malt, spice, roast, and alcohol smell. Curious for how smooth and creamy it is but retains so much stickiness and acidity. So much Malt in this one. Spiced at that; delicious!
Bottle at rattle n hum. Excellent brown gold with a slight off-white cap. Aroma of licorice, raisin and toffee. Smooth, creamy toffee taste with a bunch of licorice/raisin. Nice lacing. Yummy.
Pours orange-brown with little head or lacing. Aromas are caramel, dark fruit, raisins. Tastes are mostly sweet with some limited bitter in the finish. Alcohol well hidden. Body is quite light.

12 oz. bottle poured into a tulip.

A: Pours a burnt sienna color with huge, oily-looking chunks of sediment plopping down into the glass. That plus very little head means this is one ugly-ass beer - almost to the point where Im afraid to sip it.

S: Quite strong with molasses, mint, and caramel, while darker fruits help augment the malt backbone. Pretty nice smelling, and a lot more promising than the look of the beer.

T: The flavor is hard to describe. The first sip is loaded with caramel, dark fruit, brown sugar, and a little finishing booze; a few sips later, the profile changes to that of slightly burnt pumpernickel bread. Not as sweet as I expected, probably due to the age of the bottle and the yeast eating some of the sugar - despite that, its still a bit cough syrup-y at times. Kind of boozy, also. Just a weird, strange beer, one that Im struggling to finish.

M: Thickly textured, with tannins helping to neutralize the finish somewhat. Nice creaminess to start, before the body itself finishes slightly coarse and sticky. Rather boozy feeling on the throat in particular.

O: Meh. In fairness, this is not a good late afternoon kind of beer, but I still found it rather mediocre despite that. A rare misfire from Founders, but its not completely irredeemable.

Strong alcohol and malt aroma with a taste to match.  Beautiful amber appearance and warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours a hazy amber color with an off-white head that doesnt last very long. Aroma is of sweet malt with some notes of fruit, caramel. Flavor follows aroma with sweet malt, caramell and a distinct note of alcohol with a hint of whisky/bourbon?.  Flavor lasts a decent while, mouthfeel is light-medium body. Overall a delicious beer, would buy again.
Bottle @ home. Clear amber body with a medium offwhite head. Aroma is raisin, butterschotch, alcohol, Flavor is alcohol, raisin, toffee, butter. Burning alcohol finish.

Bottle from Breeze Thru. Pours a hazy amber color with some below-surface activity that lasted quite a while. Off white head leaving some lacing. Aroma has sweet earthy malts, hoppy citrus fruit, some spices, peppermint and vanilla. Taste is of sweet toffee, overripe fruit, lemons, wood and some whiskey. Layered syrupy texture. A bit of sourness with a stronger alcohol presence becomes more apparent through the glass. Finishes with some length; sweetly with some alcohol. This one is a sipper but it is pretty nice - more enjoyable than a barleywine, due to the more muted sweetness.
Pours hazy orange with a small off white head. Smell is nice yeast, bread and fruit notes, malt. Taste is smooth vanilla, caramel, malt. Very very smooth and drinkable. These guys know how to brew
Pours a thick and hazy deep sunset color. Heavy malty aromas. Taste is very malt forward, some slight smokiness, deep and pleasing. This is a "top fucken beer".  Thick and cummy.

Had at brewpub. A nice ale.  Drinkable despite the high ABV.  Balanced very well throughout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer pours an amber color with an off-white head. The aroma has a lot of caramel and dark fruit notes, as well as a good dose of alcohol. The flavor is similar. The caramel malt is pretty strong and provides a decent amount of sweetness. It is accompanied by some dark fruit and dark cherry notes, as well as some tobacco and alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Bottle pours amber tan with off head head with amazing retention. Big bread and caramel nose. Taste follows with increases the level of caramel. Full bodied... What an awesome beer.

12oz bottle from Tim, thanks 
Appearance: Pours cloudy dark amber with a medium sized beige head and some lacing 
Aroma: Toasted malts, sweet toffee and vanilla 
Taste: Toasted malts, bready, sweet toffee, finished with a bitter pine 
Very good and easy to drink, nice.

Bottle (12 oz). Hazy amber with almost no head and some off-white lacing. Aroma  is very malty with caramel, toffee, wood, alcohol and vanilla. Taste is heavy malt, caramel, toffee, vanilla. Body is thick and mouthfeel is sirupy. Warming alcohol. Very good malty old ale. Main flaw is drinkability because its so sugary and alcohol is everywhere despite being "only" 9,8% abv.
A dark amber pour with an off white head.  Aroma is caramel malty and sweet.  Taste is similar with some boozy flavor.  A really nice scotch ale.

Pours a cloudy dark copper with a thin white head.  The aroma is initially full of earthy hops, but the malts scream throgh with bread dough, caramel, and toffee.  On the palate, the beer doesnt feel sticky or thick, it actually finishes pretty clean.  Starts out sweet, but soon after the bitterness of the hops comes in to clean it all up.  Nothing overly spectacular, but a nice example of the style.

Pours a dark amber/brown with a creamy off white head and decent lacing.  Smell is caramel, booze, dough, fruits.  Taste is creamy caramel, bready yeast, burnt sugar, mild dark fruits and a bit of booze.
Pours a dark copper color with a fairly small head. Its got a lot of harshness to it, but a really interesting nose. Too malty for me with bitterness not attributable to hops.

Bottle date 04/13/12. Poured copper with a lasting thin head that left light lace. Aroma of toffee, dark fruits, and a light alcohol backing. Sweet malt flavor. Medium body, sweet throughout, and a light alcohol presents.

Bottle. Pours a light brown, diry coloured beer with a very small head that settles into a small ring very quick. Aroma is full of caramel, molasses and sweet malts. Almost no hops present. Flavour is sweet, malty and has thick mouthfeel. Alcohol is really showing her sweeter side, but not her burning sensation. Great beer to sip and let it warm to room temperatures. Really nice in balance.

Bottle. Pours hazy copper with a small head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is incredibly malty and seems to be mostly caramel and light booze. Taste is very malty and is mostly on the sweet side. The alcohol is well hidden but warming.
This is an incredibly smooth ale, with a smooth molasses malt to it as well.

Half a 12oz bottle into a small snifter

A- Deep garnet, zero head
S- Smells like a European macro-lager, really surprising for a beer this big.
T- Starts sweet, finishes crisp, a bit of vanilla in the middle. Not bad, just nothing noteworthy here.
M- Fairly thick, good carbonation
O- This beer is just bland. A big surprise from such a great brewery. I had a 3 year old version of this a few weeks back and thought it was terribly bland but figured it was past its prime. Its a bit better fresh, but not much.

Serving type: bottle

12 oz. bottle into a snifter. Bottled on 4/13/12. A clear orange pour. Quickly dissipating head. The aroma is orange, smoke, and bourbon. Full bodied, hot alcohol, tastes like a mild bourbon with hops. Strong vanilla and oak notes on the finish. Maybe a bit young.
The whiskey notes are well-balanced and dont make the beer overly-sweet like other efforts like Allagashs Curieux.  Good body, good texture.  Good brew.

Pours orange amber with no foam. Malt goodness right up front. Clean finish. So nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Blake - thanks!  Clear amber pour with a thin layer of white foam and active carbonation.  Aroma is rich and sweet malt with toffee/caramel.  Taste is thick, sweet malt with caramel and oxidization.  Smooth, coating mouthfeel.  Good beer.

A - Pours a cloudy amber-orange with a half-finger of frothy off-white head. The head fades down fairly quickly leaving behind a bit of lace.

S - Aroma is a mix of rich sweet caramelized malts with some brown sugar, molasses, and a touch of dark fruit, spices, and booze.

T - Starts off with some rich sweet caramelized malts with some prunes and other dark fruits and brown sugar. Through the middle, some more caramelized and dark malts come through with some molasses, oak, a bit of fruity yeast flavor, and a touch of spice. The finish is a mix of brown sugar, caramelized malts, dark fruits, and some booze.

M - Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth and a touch syrupy with a warming and sweet finish.

D - Very drinkable. Good malty old ale with a great balance of flavors and good mouthfeel and body.

The beer pours an amber color with an off-white head. The aroma has a lot of caramel and dark fruit notes, as well as a good dose of alcohol. The flavor is similar. The caramel malt is pretty strong and provides a decent amount of sweetness. It is accompanied by some dark fruit and dark cherry notes, as well as some tobacco and alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Draft @ Lazy Boy Saloon, White Plains, NY. Poured a clear, amber body with almost no head, this beer doesnt just taste like it was aged in whiskey barrels, rather it tastes like it is mixed with whiskey. Too much whiskey in my beer, but worth a try.

Very good beer. Unique style and nice malty notes.  Hints of cherry and rye with this beer pours a nice amber hue

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22nd October 2010Cloudy amber - brown beer. Residual off white head. Light palate, a little dry and a little soft. Smooth rich malt with toffee and mild caramel. Trace of Port wine and of dried fruits. Creamy malt and aniseed in the finish. Nice!

12 oz bottle. Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma is camarel, biscuits, quite sweet. Flavor is the same, but more intense. Carbonation is quite low, mouth feel is almost creamy. Even served not-warm-enough, this beer doesnt smash you over the head with the alcohol content, despite the 9.8% rating. Great beer from Founders.

Hazy amber with little head. Spicy and rich. I mean very rich. Thick body. Have with a heavy meal. A little too sweet for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled 4/11.  Poured very little head, just a thin lacing.  Amber/orangey appearance.  very cloudy, opaque.  Smelled of toffee, caramel, biscuity and malty sweetness.  Also some tobacco, almost like a sweet cigar.  Smelled good overall.

Just a hint of bitterness on the front of the tongue, then all the complex flavors of the aroma really hit you and take over.   Very pleasing.  Just the slightest hint of the alcohol, but almost non-existant.  I think some of the flavors might be a bit more pronounced on a better carbonated bottle.  Perhaps it lost some carbonation since this has been aged over a year.

Overall a delightful beer, smooth, and the flavors are wonderfully balanced.  would love to try on draft.   I have one more bottle thats been aged 2 years, cant wait to compare that to this one.
Tap at club house. Pours golden with thin head. Very sweet biscut and honey aroma. Very sweet and boozy
Dark amber pour with very little head. Aroma is molasses, caramel and citrus. Taste is darkly sweet with a bit of spice and lots of malt.

Poured from bottle, clear, deep amber color. Aroma of sweet malts. Taste s sweeter than I expected. There is some bitterness, but it is mild. This is a complex taste, something similar to a Barley Wine. Almost a syrupy feel to it.

This is a very complex beer, hard to name scents, slightly sweet. Taste has a nice spice and cinnamon mix.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

100th review. Draft poured into a tulip. Pours a clear copper red with an off white head and amazing lacing. Aroma is molasses, bitter citrus, and some malt. Taste is sweet, orange, grapefruit, malt, dark fruit, and brown sugar. Medium mouthfeel and sticky with little alcohol presence. Awesome beer.

Purchased at In Fine Spirits in Chicago, IL, enjoyed on a hot and sticky work night, not wanting to get up off the couch.  I like this stuff way more than the maple version of this.  Appearance is a vibrant dark caramel with a nice thin white head that rims around the glass.  Aroma of butterscotch, toffee, bit of maple syrup, similar to barley wine but distinctly different.  Taste is smooth, thick, syrupy, malty, not too potent considering the high ABV, sweet, bit of chocolate.  This is a monster of a brew, very good stuff.

Bottle. Pours dark orange/red with a tiny white ring of head. Aroma of oranges, dark fruits, perfume, molasses - all quite subtle. Flavour very similar. some cardamom and English malts. Not very exciting. OK.

12 oz. bottle, pours an opaque dark amber with a small beige head. Aroma of syrupy sweet malts, caramel, some English malt notes, and some peppery spice. Flavour brings out some peppery spice, more than offset by English caramel malts and syrupy sweetness - sort of a rummy boozy sweetness to it. No hop presence whatsoever, just some peppery notes that are quite bothersome. Not so enjoyable to me - way overrated.

Bottle. Pours hazy orangish amber with a small off-white head that has minimal lacing. Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, roasted malt, yeast, a bit of spice. Flavor is medium sweet, roasted malt, very interesting finish with flavors I cannot place. Perhaps a bit of clove? Medium bitter finish. Alcohol content is well masked in this interesting and unusual beer.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2012 Pours medium golden color, light, sweet malt aroma, modate head and carbonation. Taste is very balanced with of moderately complex malt and hop bitterness. Flavor is moderately robust, but the complexities are fairly subtle, and mostly hint of roasted malt and hop bitterness. Slightly syrupy, without being sweet. Finished with a mild lingering hop bitterness. A nice, fairly balanced, solid beer. Not quite as outstanding as I expected, but if this were available locally, I would buy it again.
Draft. Hazy deep golden color, small but thick beige head, solid lacing. Aroma of Christmas spice and Drambuie. Taste is spiced brown bread. Very nice.
Bottle to oversized snifter. Looks good; brown with low carbonation and thin lacing. Smells decent; sweet and doughy. Tastes sweet And malty with a nice mouthfeel. Solid.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2012 Bottle shared after day two, sos... decent beer - not too overwhelming or bitter. Easy to drink.

12oz. bottle shared by Dave S. Pour is amber/orange, with very little initial head, rapidly becoming no head. Aroma is caramel. malty, sweet, some toffee. Much like a typical barley wine. Taste is smooth, full bodied, malty, with toffee and a bit boozy. Finish is well balanced, sweet, with some heat.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels. Pours an hazy yellow with a nice head, aroma of honey, toffee, brandy, carob, flavor is sweet with honey, toffee, brandy, chocolate, nice acidity, nice carbonation, medium to full bodied

Bottle. Pours a rich dark orange color. Aroma is nice with alcohol undertones. The taste is big up front and continues throughout. Just a little bit too much alcohol in the beer, but that is the only downfall. Another great beer by Founders. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy copper brown with a thick off white head. Nose is coconut, alcohol ethers, caramel, wood and leather. Taste is sweet with minimal bitter only showing through on the end of the finish. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth. Long aftertaste and heavy body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beer pours a red amber, cloudy with a white lacing, no head; that fizzes out pretty soon after pouring. Smells of dark fruits and alcohol, most particularly figs, whiskey and cherry. Im sure this is good for a whiskey barrel aged ale it is pretty smooth and balances well with the malt. Im never a fan of dark fruit with high alcoholic beers. Combined with the whiskey it tastes like Im drinking something quite strong though the taste isnt overly strong and their is no burn.  Finishes a tad bitter with dry taste of figs.

12 ounce pour at the Founders Brewery. Amber color bordering on red with a good dose of palate sizzle. Raisins, figs, and that sort of fig-newton dipped in whiskey flavor.  In other words, it has that fruit-alcohol presence and while it tastes strong fisted, its not nearly as strong as youd expect from a 9.8 abv. Its not necessarily my favorite from Founders, but its high quality nonetheless.

I smell cherry, alcohol, oak, whiskey, plenty of malts and a little funk. Taste is caramel, light pine hops, a bit of whiskey, cherry, melons, brown sugar and bready malts. Alcohol is noticable but incorporated well. Palate is medium with some carbonation. Overall a little harsh but it was very different and interesting. Would age well for sure.

Aroma- caramel, dark fruits, oak, bourbon, maple syrup
Appearance- copper/rust orange, thin white head, massive alcohol presence
Taste- big malty sweetness upfront, caramel, figs, maple syrup
Palate- slick mouthfeel, decent body, feels right
Overall- More like a barleywine than an Old Ale to me but very nice nevertheless.  Complex and rich but highly drinkable.  Founders, as always, delivers.

Pours amber with an off white head and sweet aroma of malts and hops. Taste is complex, sweet and of malts, hops, vanilla alcohol, and whiskey notes with a nice, smooth finish. Great brew from Founders.

Bottled 04/19/12. ***FRESH*** Not a huge fan of this fresh. Cherry cough syrup in the nose and the taste. Cherry tinted dark brown appearance, clear, with zero head. Nail polish scent, cherry cough syrup. Medium bodied, sticky texture. Sweet tinge to a hop front and then that cherry cough syrup with a hot finish. Im curious to see if this improves with age.

On tap at Urge. 1 of 8 on tap. Dark orange w dense light-tan head. Nose deep rich sweet. Taste is big boom of creamy sweet and hints of tart. Big full fuzzy mouthful. Ring and lace destroy glass. Alcohol bite to vanilla and oak. Very nice.

12oz bottle with 4/6/12 stamped on the neck.

APPEARANCE: Poured reddish-brown in color with over two fingers of cream colored head.  When held up to the light, it was more of a murky orangish-red.  The head settled to a thin layer after about 10 minutes, but left behind plenty of nice lacing on the glass (especially for the high alc. content).

AROMA: Carmel malt, molasses, brown sugar, cough syrup, cinnamon, and some wood in the nose.

TASTE: Im getting some nice caramel malt up front followed closely by a good amount of hop bitterness.  Very sticky feel between the resinous hops and the sweet malt.  They also work well together helping to balance the beer.  Finish has a touch of alcohol, but I like it. 

MOUTHFEEL: Medium-full body (boarderline syrupy) with fairly light carbonation.

MOREYS BOTTOM LINE:  Very tasty, and a nice beer to sip on.  Well made, but nothing really jumps out and wows you either.  This would be a good campfire beer on a cool evening.
Aroma of honey, malt and slight dark fruit.  Pours dusty red with a small film.  Taste is very earthy with malt, pine hop, and some dirt.  Sweet without sensing the 9.8% alcohol.  Good.

Pours amber with a thin with head, BOD: 4/19/12, just about 1 month old. Aromas of figs and alcohol, taste is of heavy malt, oak, vanilla, a bit of bourbon even.  Hops come around mid to late with a noticeably strong presence (thank you Founders!) Finish is an off dry and not too sweet. Another solid entire from Founders.  Check out live Founders reviews at hopsandvines.net  via YouTube on our homepage... Thanks yall!

If you like a good heavy ale with a lot of alcohol put this one in your cellar. Great aroma and a nice burn going down. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2013 Rerated, 2013 batch: Aroma is complex, sweet malt and bready. Appearance is darkish amber, off-white-to-beige two-finger head. Taste is sweet raisins and toffee moving toward bitter, slightly boozy. Mouthfeel starts off creamy and finishes much smoother. Overall, this is not a beer for starters, and I rerated because I first had it as a starter. Not much as changed, it does taste much better with age though.

12oz bottle - pours amber with beige head and a ring of lacing.  Nose is caramel and oak or maple wood with hints of whiskey.  Flavor adds sweet malts.  Burns the gums.  This is not a beer to take lightly, wow!  Sweet, sweet, sweet.  full body and sticky mouthfeel.  A sipping beer for sure.  I would pair this with sweet venison stew or foie gras along with cornichon.  This is making me hungry!

Bottle at home. Hazy orange pour with floaties, almost no head. Aroma of dusty malts, sugars, honey, old hops, tutti frutti, nectarine and a hint of alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and smooth, quite fruity with ripe fruits and a huge body. Although this would normally be way too sweet for me, this one can have it due to its smoothness.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy amber color with white head.  Malty, butterscotch, and plum aromas.  Sweet, malty, caramel, and raisin flavors with a bit of a dry aftertaste.  I havent had too many old ales before, but if they are as good as Old Curmudgeon, I definitely want to try some more.
Aroma is malts, dark fruit and a hint of candy sweetness.  The flavor is heavy malts, dark fruit and a medium sweet/alcoholic finish.

Picked up this beer in a 4 pack on a whim. Ive always been satisfied by my experiences with Founders brewery and this was no exception. This old ale pours an enticing red amber hue with minimal head and a slight haze. The smell is sweet with hints of bourbon, its quite a treat to smell this beer. The taste follows the aroma, full of sweet malt, alcohol, bourbon, and syrup. This was a surprisingly good beer, I havent had too many old ales before, but if this is any indicator, it is definitely a style I will be exploring more.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels. Thanks zvikar. Murky reddish amber with a small, off-white head. Muddy, winy, then green aroma. Bitter, a little hot, spicy. Soft texture, soft carbonation.

Old English style ale with a heavy malt taste.  No wonder better half is so good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle. Pours dark copper, with a small, beige head. The aroma is plums, butterscotch, vanilla, and some white wine. The flavor is very sweet, lightly bitter in the finish. The palate is heavy and syrupy. The aftertaste is long and sticky and faintly bitter. Overall, this is a complex, syrupy, and delicious beer.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar. Clear reddish amber. Strong malty aroma with caramel, honey, some fruitiness and alcohol. Sweet flavor with thick malt and a bit of alcohol. Medium to full-bodied, slightly syrupy.

Pours a deep, rusty orange with only a slight, sudsy head.  The aroma is mildly fruity and rich, and the taste is really very good.  Not a tremendous amount of alcohol present in the flavor, which is surprising, considering the high ABV.  The taste is very balanced, hearty and rich upfront, with hops and a little alcohol heat at the end.  Only after Id finished it did the ABV sneak up on me and announce its presence with authority.  Id buy this in the sixpack if I get it again, and I likely will.
Draft at Stem and Stein madison al. Dark brown and clear. Light malty nose  taste is a bit sweet with a full richness of body. Alcohol is warmingly present.  Good winter warmer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Smells fruity and boozy.  Just a hint of hop aroma.  I had a year old version (2011) on tap and a new bottle 2012 both this week.  Both amazing.  Very sweet and dangerously smooth.  The only thing that could make it better is aging it in maple...well thats another story.

Pours a cloudy tea....very slight soapy head/ring.
Aroma is strong, sweet malt, fruity.
Flavour is sweet, dark fruit, some hoppiness...a slight tinge of alchohol bitter.
Wonderful balance, smooth.
This will only get better with aging....even at less than 3 weeks, its great.

12oz bottle. Poured a slightly red color with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet toasted malts, touch of dark brown sugar notes, dried fruits. Flavor is pretty sweet, with that dried raisin/date-style notes to it. Notes of earthy hops and plenty of alcohol is present in this one. I bet this will age well.

Amber with medium white head. Leaves some lacing. Light roasted malty aroma. Flavor is rather sweet at first with the molasses evident and a hint of oak. The finish is slightly biter. Very smooth and easy drinking for a strong beer. Light carbonation gives it a nice mouth feel but not too heavy.

Reminiscent of the Belgium trappist Quad style brews, this bold ale rings in dark fruits topped with a funky maltiness that holds true to the label on the bottle. The body and mouthfeel are interestingly full and creamy. Unexpectedly dry back-end really brought this beer up to another level. The palate is really perfectly balanced. Although the flavor leaves an hop-addicted american wanting, I can appreciate this brew for what it is; and surely for what it was meant to be, and old fuckin ale!

Pours a murky red, no head, just a little white fiz on top, no lacing.
The nose has some malt, spice and a bubble gum like sweetness. The flavor is a little earthy, there is definatly some sweetness, Im getting bubble gum again, big boozy finish. The feel is unusually thin, light carbonation.

(trade w/changeup45) - Minimal foam after slight pfft opening bottle. Murky muddy dark brown body. Aroma of cocoa powder and raisins. Very sweet. Raisins and figs. Mouthfeel has a texturre like theres something in it like cocoa. Slight alcoholic aftertaste. Hope to have this on draft someday to see how it tastes fresh.

12oz bottle dated 4/6/12 poured into tulip glass.  
Aroma:  malt, alcohol, banana, bubblegum, vanilla, woody, dark fruits
Appearance:  hazy reddish coppery color with little to no head
Taste:  very sweet, mild bitter, almost no sour in the taste
Palate:  medium carbonation, full body, oily texture.  Aftertaste is medium bitter, mild sour
Overall:  This is very rich and similar to a barley wine.  I like it.  The alcohol is surprisingly hidden well for 9.8%.  It is definitely a sipper.

Hazy red amber (very nice coloring) with a light head and spotty lace that slowly drops back to the brew.  Taste is full caramel malt with a touch of cookie spices and a nice alcohol bittering to bring things in balance at the finish.  It is a big brew, but also well-conceived.  Would be great on a cool evening around a fire.  Probably would go very well with under-sweetened desserts.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 Dark orange pour with no head.  Caramel malty aroma, fruitiness, some butterscotch.  A little hops come through too.  Very very smooth taste but I dont taste that much complexity.  Nice caramel malt taste, some sweetness, a little bitterness, and a slight alcohol burn on the finish. Its a good beer but I dont think I will seek this out again.  Doesnt really seem like on old ale either, more like an american strong with a little less hops.  Re-rate 3/29/14 - 2011 bottle thanks to mrebeks for sharing.  Much better with some age on it.  Flavor becomes richer and a little sweeter.

Bottle.  Pours an opaque red-golden with a small-medium off-white head.  Aroma is sweet, of caramel/toffee, fruit punch, and spices like cardamom, clove, allspice.  Taste is heavy sweet, medium bitter, with a ton of spice.  Dry, sweet, spicy finish.  Full bodied, oily texture, moderate carbonation.

I dont know why they release this in the spring, it would be great around the holidays.

A clear reddish beer with a small white head.  The aroma is clean grain and sweet malt with toffee.  The flavor is quite sweet, toffee and candy with a slight chocolate taste.  Good body and the alcohol is not overwhelming.

Bottle.  Pours a dark amber.  Aroma is woody and sweet.  Flavor is of alcohol, malt and bread.  Surprisingly drinkable for this gravity, though I would like a little bit more of the mineraly character.

Deep amber with a smaller white head limited lacing and retention... Chocolate covered toffee very sweet aroma, very barleywinelike, creamy, malty... Sweet malty lightly spiced dark fruits not nearly as chocolatey or candy sweet as expected from the aroma... lively full bodied kinda sticky... decent old ale, lots of flavor...

2011 12oz bottle from brystmar - got a few to age but needed to open up at least one. Ruby pale hazy brown with no head upon initial pour but a thin tan film. Very mellow aroma - vanilla, brandy, fig and plum. Low carbonation, moderate body, sweet and smooth, interesting combination of alcohol and fruit, somewhat dry finish, lots of brandy and sherry at the end. Very excited about this one with a year or two on it but fresh I would say its only ok.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 
35,5 cl bottle @ OHaras Freehouse. Rated on 09.03.2010
Dark red colour, disappearing head. Aroma is hoppy and sweet with fruits  feels a bit like scotch ale. Palate is a bit too high on CO2. Flavour is sweeti sh with ripe fruits, some raisins, plums and hints of sugar. Too sweet stuff for me.
8-3-7-3-14=35

Draught @ Sivukirjasto. Rated on 18.12.2014.
Aroma is sweet with toffee and caramel. Feels syrupy. Flavour has woody tones, sweet toffee, syrup, caramel, vanilla and alcohol. Vanilla grows stronger towards the end of the glass. Feels like an American strong ale at all its sweetness.

7-3-8-3-17=3.7
Has a distinct oxidized sherry, raisin flavor. The nose is a bit off-putting but flavor in the mouth is much more agreeable. Drinks very well for nearly 10%. Body is lighter than expected.
Amber color with fine head. Aroma of coconut and malt. Rich malty flavor. Tastes a lot like a barley wine.

On bottle @Monks, Wallingatan
Pours brown reddish with no head
Aromas of oak, barley malts and sweet fruits
Very well balanced barley wine, very vinouos and sweet. Low hoppyness and almost no bitterness. A bit to low in carbonation
However very fine tuned and smooth
Light brown, slight red haze with almost no head. Smell was of bourbon. Kool-aid powder grape. Rich fruits. Tasted of alcohol. Malty. Cherry cough syrup.

Poured from a 12oz bottle to tulip, just shy of a year old:

A dark amber gold with a finger and a half of dense, lacy creme brulee head.  On the nose theres tons of figs and candied sugar.  Booze really pulls through with a soft snort.  On the tongue, theres every element of the aroma with the addition of some harsh nutty bits.  Far more aggressive than I was anticipating.  Overall, a decent beer with all its ducks in a row but Im going to give the other three some time to relax.
Sweeter than I had inticipated but also very good for how lightly it is carbonated.

Bottle from Justin via trade. Pour was syrupy and thick with little to no head. Aroma was of light brandy and sweet malts with dark fruit notes. Flavor was decently sweet with excellent mouthfeel with all the flavors described above. Excellent beer. I want more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted side by side with Better Half

S: orangey brown, clear, some floaters, white head

A: sweet, fruit malts, a little dryness, a little earthiness

T: sweet maltiness, dry, earthy, smooth

O: solid brew, good taste, well balanced

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes.  First reviewed 1/10/2011.  Served on tap in a taster glass at the Haymarket Founders event.

Curmudgeon has a dark cherry color, existing between hazy and transparent. An off-white head fades to a ring but leaves layers of lace.

Brandy and ethyl alcohol kick me in the nose, with an earthy covering to the sweet dark fruit and malt aromas. 

Sweet brandy, caramel malt, and some dark fruits open up the flavor. Figs, raisins, and plums. Sweet all the way through. Some light earthy flavors slowly coat the tongue, adding some depth and complexity. This definitely gets better as it warms.

The mouthfeel is smooth, brandy-like, with light to medium carbonation. Sticky, with a fuller than medium body.

A fun and complex beer. Sweet, with lots of bite, so I am not sure I could drink this all night.

The beer by which all other beers are rated. There is no better beer to sip by a fire on a cool evening.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours deep orange-amber with a khaki head. Aroma is jampacked with notes of caramel, vanilla, tobacco, light roast, and dried fruit. Flavor shows the same with notes of dates, orange peel, brown sugar, bourbon, and oak. Overall body is moderate to full and finishes with some nice warming alc.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2015 Fantastic barleywine hybrid is the best description that I can give.  Big bold flavor with a heathy dose of etoh.

Pours a bright orange with a white head.  Yeasty and very balanced this is a great ale.  Great yeasty scent and taste with a touch of sweetness but at the same time finishes hoppy dry.  A great effort from Founders.
From a 33 cl bottle at Ölrepubliken, Gothenburg. Pours a nice redbrown colour with a offwhite head. Fruity with some raisins, malty vinous aroma and flavour. A really nice beer :-)

355 ml bottle at Ölrepubliken on February 11, 2012Murky orange color, off-white head. Oak, almond paste, alcohol scent. Sweet, minty, alcohol, marzipan taste. Warming alcohol. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness.

bottle 33 cl @ Ölrepubliken. Pours redish deep amber with a minimal off white rim of head. Aroma is very fruity, vinous, raisins, fidges, malty, caramel, tropical fruits. Flavor is very similar to aroma, good bitterness, velvety fullbodied. Finishes sweet bitter.

355 ml bottle bought @ Ölrepubliken. Pours clear dark red with no head worth mentioning. Smell is malty sweet with caramel, sweet fruits, orange peal and alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter and slightly metallic with sweet fruits, caramel, fudge, lemon peal and wood. Mouthfeel is fullbodied and sticky sweet. Finish is sweet and slightly bitter.
Bottle, thanks to Alex, at Ölrepubliken. Hazy copper golden beer with à small offwhite head. Malty vinous aroma, nutty notes, Vinous flavor, bready, hoppy, grassy, nutty, sourish, earthy notes.

Pours amber with a small head. Smells pretty malty, and earthy, with warm scotch notes. Taste like caramel, brown sugar, barnyard dirtiness and a bit of scotch. This fairly sweet, but has a clean and dry finish to it. Well balanced and flavorful. I like this and will drink it again.

Poured from a bottle into a stemless wine glass. Appearance is hazy copper with minimal cream colored head. The beer clears up a bit as it warms. Head retention is not as great as it could be. No lacing. Aroma is over the top malts and caramels. A subdued earthiness is prevalent. Taste is musty in the best of ways. Caramels overrunneth my glass. Alcohol is covered nicely in this one. Mouthfeel is creamy with little in the way of carbonation tingle. Long lasting aftertaste of earthy caramels.

Bottle, 12oz, bottled 2009.
Pours a dark amber with a beige head.
Smells of candi sugar, spice, caramel, prune juice, and definite bourbon with plenty of malt.
Tastes of a heavy sweetness, a lot of fruitiness, some coconut, vanilla, a mild bitter and some tartness.
Texture is superbly creamy. Full bodied. Soft carbonation. Finishes with a mild salty tartness.

Delightful.

Pours a reddish amber with pretty much no head.  Aroma is very rich malt, sweet caramel, butterscotch, and bread.  Taste is very sweet and malty with a perfectly balanced hop bitterness.  The smooth and creamy mouthfeel goes very well with the big full body of this monster.  This is really good.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2012 (Bottle) Pours orange red with a small off-white head. The aroma holds clear notes of oak - wood, butter, coconut and vanilla. Malt bring tones of caramel, toffee, fudge and bread. Hints of juniper, earth, resin and woodsy hops. The flavour is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with notes of butter, vanilla, cocoanut,wood, caramel, toffee and balanced hops. The mouhfeel clean, round and soft with a near medium carbonation. Plums, oak, sticky malt and resinous hops on the finish. Medium to full bodied.
Amber in color, clear with a thin head.  Nice malt and alochol aroma.  Rich bready and cereal like.  The rich malt flavors are pronounced and very much barely wine esque.  Super beer.
Hazy light brown. Rich, sweet malty character with a backing of hops that is somewhat subdued but suits the beer well. Thick, almost syrupy mouthfeel. Fantastic malty beer.
This is not one of my go to styles, but if more of them were done like this it might be! The 10% ABV is hidden way too well. Very, very tasty.

Amber-orange, large tan head which persists a little.  Aroma malt, caramel, butterscotch, wood.  Full body, some alcohol present.  Flavor is sweet and malty and brown sugary but with a kind of tannic background to prevent it from being cloying.  Interesting and excellent for sipping.
Pretty great taste. Malts, caramel and syrup. Nice aroma and color as well. Pretty hazy mahogany similar to a barleywine. I like it

12 oz bottle from Tiffanys in Kalamazoo MI, served in a snifter. Pours hazy reddish caramel with a small tan head that quickly fades to a thin remnant, leaving a small amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are notes of brown sugar, toasted malts, figs, raisins, peat, wood and hops. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with a balancing hoppy bitterness that develops through the middle. Along the way, there are notes of caramel, oak, molasses, raisins, wood, herbal hops and alcohol. The finish is long and peppery-malty. On the palate, it is full in body with a creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice malty ale reminiscent of a barley wine. The malt profile is beautiful but it is also surprisingly well balanced. This one begs for barrel aging. 2011-12-21

recd via tradel  great looking beer; mahogany - amber pour.  sweet malty aroma and can smell the alcohol (bourbon?).  rich mouthfeel and taste of sweet malts, dark fruits and the alcohol is ever present.  great alcohol at end of taste and more prevalent as it warms.  very solid as a winter beer.

Bottle. Pours a great dark ruby red with a off white head. The aroma is of dark fruits, vanilla and oak. The taste is very rich malt with a lot of sweetness. It really is almost Barleywineish. It very smooth with a touch of alcohol. Thank you to Rael at Mission Liquors for the share.

The bar has been set!! Now this is a brew one can truly come to appreciate all year long! Excellent flavors and aromas!
